story:
200 X $25 = 1 Year of Education for Seven Students

Five years ago, I began working with a friend, Oscar, to send 7 students in Ghana to school. In November, I will have a chance to meet them! I am looking for 200 friends old and new to donate $25 to help send these seven children to school for the next year.

My Story.

Five years ago, I embarked on a study abroad trip to Ghana. I had long dreamed of traveling to Africa, and I was ready to put my heart and soul into my trip. I spent five months doing everything I could to experience the culture. I lived with a large family (up to 14 of us in the house on any given night!). I studied Ghanaian literature, language and traditional dance at the University of Legon. I interned with a community development organization on the quality of water in Accra. I fell in love with spicy food. I traveled all over the country. So it may come as no surprise that when my friend Oscar told me about the challenges that children in his community face to access education, and asked me to help him support seven children, I had no choice but to say, "Yes!".

Pictured here, Oscar and Morgan

The Who.

For three years, these seven students have been in school. Oscar and I have been working together, with the support of many people along the way, to send those absolutely adorable faces pictured above to Wisdom Children's International School in Klikor, Ghana. Seyram, Ramatu, Eyi, Wisdom (top row), Jeff, Elikplim and Etsa (bottom row) each have a unique story. But their stories share a few common themes: they were given no opportunity to stay in school because their family didn't have enough money; they have a love and passion for learning; and each has the desire to make sure that no other student faces these same challenges to receive an education.

As I reflect on this five year anniversary of my trip to Ghana, I know that these children have changed my life. Their stories inspire me. To ensure that these students have the opportunity to remain in school, I am asking 200 friends and family (that's you!) to donate. Just $25 can help keep these students in school for the next year.

The Why.

Education is a global right. School in Ghana is free and compulsory through junior high school. But the reality is that most students cannot afford to go to school because of the many costs to attending class. Transportation to get to school, lunch and snacks while at school, the cost of school supplies and materials, uniforms, exam fees, sports fees. The list is extensive. Many families in Ghana cannot afford these costs, and children suffer the consequences.

The What.

$5,000 will cover all seven students' expenses for FOUR terms of school, all of the 2015-2016 school year and the first term of the 2016-2017 school year. All students attend fall, spring and summer terms, which are each 15 or 16 week sessions. Older students may attend additional two week terms in between, as determined by their grade level. While the fees to attend school at Wisdom Children's International School do change by grade level, an estimate of the expenses for one student for the entire school year is:
  1. Tuition: $110
  2. Books and school supplies: $90
  3. Fees for exams, sports and miscellaneous: $50
  4. Lunch and a snack everyday: $250

If you do the math, you'll notice that this does not quite add up to $5,000. Unfortunately, this is not an exact science as the prices at the school do increase from one year to the next, and the exchange rate fluctuates regularly. We have given ourselves a bit of wiggle room to accommodate for these unpredictable costs, as well as to cover the cost of wiring money to Ghana.

story:
**STOP PRESS**  (4th July 2015)

I am now out of fabric! please have a look at the update page to see some of the dogs i've made neckerchiefs for. Thanks to you, i'm off to the Scottish Youth Theatre in a week - cant wait!!! xxxx

*STOP PRESS*   I've reached my target!  People have been asking if they can still buy a cravat -  the answer is definitely yes!!  I've still got a little fabric left, so please do order if you would like one. I'll remove each perk as I run out of that fabric. x  

In March, I had a really big audition, and I am thrilled to say that I was successful.  I have been given the incredible opportunity of taking part in the Scottish Youth Theatre's summer course this year.

I will be away for three weeks doing their fantastic devising course, working with other teenagers to devise (create from scratch!) a piece of theatre.  The course is residential and self catering - which means that apart from learning to cook, I need to raise money for food, the course itself and accommodation.  Whilst my parents are able to pay for some of the cost, I need to raise £600 on my own.

Thanks to everyone who's donating - this opportunity means the world to me! 


As a thank you for helping me get to theatre school,  I have made some cute dog neckerchiefs!  You can buy them in the Perks on the right hand side of this page. 
The cravats fit most sizes of dog except miniatures - please send me a message if you have a tiny dog and I will make a petite set! :)   Here's some photos to help you choose the perfect set for your dog.  

Lots of Spots set:


SeaSide set:


Spots 'n' Stripes:

story:
Update 9/25/2014: Please help me make plans for RestoringHistory.US by taking this 3-question survey. Thank you! ~Steve


"Our forefathers came to certain conclusions... which have been a great blessing to the world. Before we can understand their conclusions, we must go back and review the course which they followed. We must think the thoughts which they thought." — President Calvin Coolidge

That is the vision for RestoringHistory.US: to help the next generation of Americans study the course of history and become effective defenders of the political, economic, and religious principles that led to freedom.

The mission of RestoringHistory.US is to link educational resources to chapters in popular history textbooks, helping families to easily locate materials that:
  1. counteract the liberal/progressive bias found in many textbooks, and
  2. make the study of history... NOT boring!


Phase 1: The birth of RestoringHistory.US

My name is Steve Johnston. I’m a freelance software developer with 18 years of experience, and I also help homeschool my kids. I found myself spending a lot of my time searching for the best books, movies, articles, and other resources to make history "come alive" for my kids. 

I thought this project would be a great way to bring together my skills and interests in a way that could help other families learn more about the history and founding principles of America.

I completed phase one of the RestoringHistory.US website in my spare time and launched it in August 2013.  You can take a look at the How to Use page for an overview of the site's current functionality.  The following screenshot is an example, showing New Deal or Raw Deal? as a resource that is associated with chapter 26 of the textbook The Story of the World, Vol. 4. 




Phase 2: Critical improvements to make the website useful

Since I launched the website last year, I have spent the majority of my available time promoting it on social networks, and writing blog articles on current events, to drive traffic to the site.  Recently, I have refocused my efforts on my core mission, and I have begun adding more resources to the website.  (The Updates page is a convenient way to see what resources have been added since your last visit to the website.)

In addition to adding more resources to the RestoringHistory.US website, here are the main features I want to add, to take the website to the next level and make it really useful.

  1. Support FREE content  Currently, amazon products are the only types of resources that I can add, but I want to allow linking other types of FREE online content such as articles and YouTube videos.
  2. Rate/review and filtering/sorting functionality  Giving users the ability to rate resources will allow the best quality resources to bubble to the top and make them easier to find.
  3. Support for multiple textbooks  Currently, The Story of the World is the only textbook that is indexed.  I want to add other homeschool and public school textbooks and link resources to those as well.
  4. Crowdsourcing functionality  In order for the website to grow exponentially, I need to allow other people to add resources to the database.  I’ve already had people volunteering to help, so I need to add the ability for these people to contribute to the site.

In the future, I want students to be able to go to the page associated with a chapter in their textbook and see many resources, including books, movies, articles, online videos, activities, field trip ideas, etc.  Users should have options for sorting and filtering to find the best resources of each type that will meet their needs.



Why I need your help

I have already invested many, many hours in the development and promotion of the site up to this point, with only a few donations.  However, the growth of the website is severely limited by the fact that I cannot afford to spend more time working on it.  My goal is to raise $20,000, so that I will be able to set aside some of my freelance projects and spend more time working to complete the critical features listed above by April 2015.

If I exceed my funding goals, I have a long list of additional features that I would like to add, including:

  • Personal organizational tools, to allow users to maintain their own private lists and notes
  • A forum to allow for user discussions
  • Search functionality allowing users to find resources by topic, time period, author, etc.

On the other hand, if I am not able to meet my goal of $20,000, I will use whatever money I raise to add as many resources and features as I am able to.  Even if phase two is not fully funded, I would eventually like to complete all of the critical features; however, doing the work in my “spare time” (haha!) would require the work to be spread out over a much longer period.



Perks — What do you get in return?

Most of the potential donors to this campaign are probably families that intend to use the website themselves and/or people who just love America and its founding principles. I believe that you probably care more about the impact of your donation more than any "stuff" (T-shirts, mugs, etc.) that you could get in return. With this in mind, I wanted to come up with perks that would help maximize the reach of this campaign, and provide some value to businesses or organizations that would like to make larger donations.

I'm offering 3 sponsorship levels: Minuteman for a donation of any size, and, for larger donations, Lexington and Yorktown sponsorships allow you to advertise your business/organization on the RestoringHistory.US website.


Minuteman Sponsorships

I have developed a webpage that will allow you to create a custom graphic with your personal profile image and name, OR your business/organization logo and name. You will be given access to this web page to create your graphic and share it on social networks.

Sharing this graphic will serve a dual purpose: to publicly recognize your contribution, and to help spread the word about the campaign further. See the "Johnny Doe" graphic below for an example.


Lexington & Yorktown Sponsorships

For larger donations, I can offer your organization/business a listing on the Sponsors page on RestoringHistory.US.  Yorktown Sponsors ($1,000+ donations) will have their logos displayed at the top of the sponsors page, with Lexington Sponsors ($250-$999 donations) underneath them. 

In addition, a smaller logo (max. 55x55 pixels) will be placed in the site header that will be displayed in all pages of the website.  Yorktown Sponsors will receive guaranteed placement of their logo in this sponsors section on every page view.  Logos for Lexington Sponsors will be displayed in this section on a rotational basis, with a minimum of one Lexington Sponsor displayed on every page view.

Both the large logos and small header logos will be linked to your URL. These will be displayed through July 4, 2016.

The screenshot below shows the Yorktown Sponsors section and the Lexington Sponsors section, as well as the section for smaller logos in the top-left of the page. The Twitter feed on the right will appear while the Indiegogo campaign is active. After that, it will be removed — hopefully, to make more room for sponsor logos!

Since launching the site, I've focused on creating a blog and building a social media presence on Twitter, Facebook, and Google+.  This effort has gone well, and I’ve connected with lots of people and brought increasingly more traffic to the site, as shown in the graph below. This should give you a rough idea of the number of impressions your logos might receive in the sponsors section in the page header.

I anticipate that this upward trend will continue, if funding allows me to resume blogging and staying active on social media. I don't know if growth will continue to be exponential like it was in June/July, but I do expect many visitors to return multiple times, after these new features are added, and more resources are listed.



What if you can’t afford to donate to the campaign?

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can spread the word about the campaign.  Use the share buttons at the top of this page to share it on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+.  Email it to your friends or link to it on your webpage.  Any way that you can help will be greatly appreciated!

I am hoping that this campaign will be successful, allowing me to add new functionality which is critical to its future success.  Please consider joining with me to make the vision of RestoringHistory.US a reality, helping raise a generation of young Americans who will lead us back to the principles of freedom.





One final note...
Filing for 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status

If this campaign exceeds its goal, or if I get feedback that people are interested in providing ongoing financial support, I would love to form a nonprofit corporation and file for 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status. I did not want to do this before running the Indiegogo campaign because I do not have time or money to deal with lawyers, accountants, and mounds of paperwork right now. I also didn't want to risk going through the process only to be delayed or denied by the Obama-controlled IRS, as many other conservative groups have. For now, my top priority is to get the majority of this new functionality up and running ASAP, to start making RestoringHistory.US useful for students and their families.




RestoringHistory.US is also on  Google+

story:
Need more Income?

                                                          




BIDS4BONDS.COM

A Subscription Website Newsletter To Educate Investors


The  goal of our subscription website and newsletter is to educate our users to the pit falls and opportunities for fixed income investors. Our subscribers will pay for specific business and investment related articles and information.  Our website will deliver unique, original, and one of a kind material, along with an aggregation of various content that will draw visitors to our site. 


 Then after evaluating our content they will subscribe. 


Our goal is to create a community of inter-related individuals who share a common interest.  

A membership subscription website is user driven and content based.  Our website will be a destination in and of itself.  Our business goal is to generate revenue from user access fees by acquiring and retaining members.  We will also create a newsletter whose minimum information unit is an issue of a publication.

To attract subscribers we will offer some free content which will be available to visitors or registered guests. Most of the content; archived articles, videos, and research will be behind a firewall and reserved for paid members only.  When an unregistered visitor arrives at our membership website firewall, they will be presented with conversion architecture with an offer to pay for access to the premium content.  The content that is not behind a firewall  is optimized for search engines so new audience members can be acquired.  Paid subscribers will be recognized and presented with architecture that will permit them to log in and immediately access the premium information.  Depending on price and perceived value of our paid content we expect one to five percent of the visitors will choose to become paid subscribers.  Our approach is to offer our audience free components of our subscription website.  The free content is used to promote the premium content.  Our free content offerings will show our users what the content is like before asking for money.  We intend to create a trusting relationship with our core audience members.  The fundamentals of how to achieve a large subscription membership are simple and proven. What will work at the micro level can generally be leveraged to work just as well at the macro level.  Success can be achieved by testing at the micro level, then applying cash, time and energy to scale it up to the macro level.  Adequate  cash is the ultimate fuel for growing a subscription model.  Time and energy represent the application to make it happen.  With a strong marketing budget, we can rapidly buy our way to certain minimum volumes of subscribers.  The internet is filled with poorly funded businesses.  Most subscription websites spend years trying to reach revenues of even 200K per year.


Other Revenue-Paid Ads


The E Newsletter will be ancillary to begin with.  With the probability of a small number of subscribers in the first and second year it will be tough to attract paid ads from brands with budgets.  The amount paid per ad is tied to the size of the subscription list.  Our plan is to focus on subscriber growth until our list is north of 5,000 before ramping up a significant and expensive sales program.  Ad rates are based on the number of emails sent (cost per thousand). Typical newsletters charge $25 - $50 per thousand for daily emails and $100 - $250 for dedicated ads.


What Makes Us Special


Along with a library of related content we will provide ongoing strategy reports, research, actionable investing opportunities, videos, celebrity interviews and market data to our subscribers.  Our website and subscription services will target consumers who have a pre-existing desire to buy the content on our site.  Our website and subscription services will offer our target audience content that they are looking for but can’t find, or in one place on the net. 


Subscription Websites


Subscription websites attract new subscribers through a combination of SEO placement on search engines, paid marketing campaigns and other free activities.  Over time other premium subscriptions can be developed and current subscribers can be converted or become repeat buyers for their existing service.  It is estimated that the cost to acquire  a subscriber can be recovered with a lifetime value of 3X – 5X, more than the cost to attract.  Publishers with subscription websites customarily offer up to fifteen percent of their overall content to unregistered visitors, with the remainder accessible only by subscribers.  The decision on what and how much content to open to  all and what is available only to registered users or paid subscribers depends on a flexible marketing strategy and the scope and intent of the website.  Our plan is to have a membership subscription website which will provide paid members with valuable information on a specific topic of interest or a cluster of topics .


Action Plan


• Identify target market – no gut guesses --Choose the right target audience.  Discover what buyers want and don’t want.  What is our product and what is it’s value and purpose?

• Develop subscription price strategy

• Create budget and source of funding

• Website development --Create a plan detailing how the mechanics of subscription and content publishing are to be handled.  The site must continually adjust and refine to make it appealing and valuable to subscribers.

• Content is King –-Collect existing content from other publishers.  Recruit writers and develop unique investment articles and videos.  Determine the frequency that we will be contacting our subscribers.  Set up a timeline from production to delivery.

• Sign Up Subscribers –-Develop subscribers using organic marketing efforts, lead generation and building an email list.  Identify email marketing service to facilitate growth.

• Survival Strategy –-Plan for and create a budget that permits our site to stay in business long enough so that revenues catch up to accumulated and current expenses.

All contributors receiving a free subscription will receive access to all subscriber levels for any and all of the newsletters that we publish. Launch date August 2015. Donations of $30 and above will receive a Free Bids4bonds.com T Shirt (white).

T Shirts will be shipped in March 2015.


What can I do in addition to contributing or in lieu of a financial donation?


You can share this campaign with friends.

 Earn an additional three months free subscription for introducing friends that contribute to our community. Remember that you must refer people using the unique URL that is generated through your Indiegogo account. Donations from friends must total at least $250.

Please share our campaign with anyone that may have an interest.


Why will people pay for our websites content?


I have worked in the investment industry for over 30 years as a revenue producer, principal, and as a bond strategist. Examples of my recent work can be found on our website: Bids4bonds.com. I have a long, audited track record of positive performance. I have successfully managed registered reps, individual customers and institutions and feel confident that quality information will be paid for and appreciated.


I look Forward To Your Assistance

Let's Make It Happen!


Stephen P. Vlahos

story_txt:
Need more Income?
                                                          



BIDS4BONDS.COM
A Subscription Website Newsletter To Educate Investors

The  goal of our subscription website and newsletter is to educate our users to the pit falls and opportunities for fixed income investors. Our subscribers will pay for specific business and investment related articles and information.  Our website will deliver unique, original, and one of a kind material, along with an aggregation of various content that will draw visitors to our site. 

 Then after evaluating our content they will subscribe. 

Our goal is to create a community of inter-related individuals who share a common interest.  
A membership subscription website is user driven and content based.  Our website will be a destination in and of itself.  Our business goal is to generate revenue from user access fees by acquiring and retaining members.  We will also create a newsletter whose minimum information unit is an issue of a publication.
To attract subscribers we will offer some free content which will be available to visitors or registered guests. Most of the content; archived articles, videos, and research will be behind a firewall and reserved for paid members only.  When an unregistered visitor arrives at our membership website firewall, they will be presented with conversion architecture with an offer to pay for access to the premium content.  The content that is not behind a firewall  is optimized for search engines so new audience members can be acquired.  Paid subscribers will be recognized and presented with architecture that will permit them to log in and immediately access the premium information.  Depending on price and perceived value of our paid content we expect one to five percent of the visitors will choose to become paid subscribers.  Our approach is to offer our audience free components of our subscription website.  The free content is used to promote the premium content.  Our free content offerings will show our users what the content is like before asking for money.  We intend to create a trusting relationship with our core audience members.  The fundamentals of how to achieve a large subscription membership are simple and proven. What will work at the micro level can generally be leveraged to work just as well at the macro level.  Success can be achieved by testing at the micro level, then applying cash, time and energy to scale it up to the macro level.  Adequate  cash is the ultimate fuel for growing a subscription model.  Time and energy represent the application to make it happen.  With a strong marketing budget, we can rapidly buy our way to certain minimum volumes of subscribers.  The internet is filled with poorly funded businesses.  Most subscription websites spend years trying to reach revenues of even 200K per year.

Other Revenue-Paid Ads

The E Newsletter will be ancillary to begin with.  With the probability of a small number of subscribers in the first and second year it will be tough to attract paid ads from brands with budgets.  The amount paid per ad is tied to the size of the subscription list.  Our plan is to focus on subscriber growth until our list is north of 5,000 before ramping up a significant and expensive sales program.  Ad rates are based on the number of emails sent (cost per thousand). Typical newsletters charge $25 - $50 per thousand for daily emails and $100 - $250 for dedicated ads.

What Makes Us Special

Along with a library of related content we will provide ongoing strategy reports, research, actionable investing opportunities, videos, celebrity interviews and market data to our subscribers.  Our website and subscription services will target consumers who have a pre-existing desire to buy the content on our site.  Our website and subscription services will offer our target audience content that they are looking for but can’t find, or in one place on the net. 

Subscription Websites

Subscription websites attract new subscribers through a combination of SEO placement on search engines, paid marketing campaigns and other free activities.  Over time other premium subscriptions can be developed and current subscribers can be converted or become repeat buyers for their existing service.  It is estimated that the cost to acquire  a subscriber can be recovered with a lifetime value of 3X – 5X, more than the cost to attract.  Publishers with subscription websites customarily offer up to fifteen percent of their overall content to unregistered visitors, with the remainder accessible only by subscribers.  The decision on what and how much content to open to  all and what is available only to registered users or paid subscribers depends on a flexible marketing strategy and the scope and intent of the website.  Our plan is to have a membership subscription website which will provide paid members with valuable information on a specific topic of interest or a cluster of topics .

Action Plan

 •  Identify target market – no gut guesses --Choose the right target audience.  Discover what buyers want and don’t want.  What is our product and what is it’s value and purpose?
 •  Develop subscription price strategy
 •  Create budget and source of funding
 • Website development --Create a plan detailing how the mechanics of subscription and content publishing are to be handled.  The site must continually adjust and refine to make it appealing and valuable to subscribers.
 • Content is King –-Collect existing content from other publishers.  Recruit writers and develop unique investment articles and videos.  Determine the frequency that we will be contacting our subscribers.  Set up a timeline from production to delivery.
 • Sign Up Subscribers –-Develop subscribers using organic marketing efforts, lead generation and building an email list.  Identify email marketing service to facilitate growth.
 • Survival Strategy –-Plan for and create a budget that permits our site to stay in business long enough so that revenues catch up to accumulated and current expenses.

story:
My name is Jayme Bridge and I am a second year university student at the University of Western Ontario. I have recently been given an amazing opportunity to travel to Port Au Prince, Haiti in February to participate in a C.L.O.U.D project.

Through this great opportunity, I will be teaching English to local Haitians at different levels, as well as volunteering at a local orphanage. The goal of the trip is to provide an English education that will help open up opportunities that the locals would otherwise lack. 

Any financial support, no matter how small, would be greatly appreciated to allow me to have the opportunity to make a difference in a well-deserving community. 

Thank you!

story:
**Stay tuned to this page - we'll be adding photos, videos and updates as soon as possible so you can learn more about the Peace Circles and the remarkable women who run them**
Summary

Despite over three years of violence in their country, ordinary Syrian women from all religions and ethnicities are working to heal their communities and build a peaceful future. The Women For the Future of Syria (WFS) program helps these women leaders build their capacity through trainings, mentoring and networking.

The Women for the Future of Syria program, which is also run by Syrian women, helps these local heroines found Peace Circles. Through the Circles women can join together in an organized group. By organizing a group their voices are amplified and they become an unstoppable force.

Since 2011, Women for the Future of Syria has helped hundreds of women form 30 Peace Circles all around Syria. Some examples of the Peace Circles’ power to transform their communities through women’s leadership include:

  • One peace circle in the Damascus suburbs conducted an advocacy campaign to put pressure on the local Free Syrian Army military council in order to force a ceasefire between the two sides. Women threatened to demonstrate in front of the military council headquarters to demand a ceasefire and they also lobbied their Local Council. The ceasefire was achieved for twenty days.
  • One peace circle in Aleppo launched a campaign to maintain the neutrality of the education system - making sure that the schools would not be controlled by armed or political groups.
  • Peace circles in both Lattakia and Hassakeh held cultural events designed to bring diverse ethnicities and religions together to decrease sectarian tensions. In Lattakia, Alawite and Sunni children were coordinated to write and perform a play which was attended by their parents; in Hassakeh a Kurdish cultural performance night included Sunni Arab children singing songs in Kurdish.

What We Need & What You Get

The Center for Civil Society and Democracy (CCSD) is the organization that sponsors the Peace Circles. CCSD needs funding in order to coordinate them and provide support.

CCSD is a Syrian NGO whose mission is to support and strengthen civil society and democracy and promote the values of freedom, justice and coexistence through analysis of the current situation and the development and implementation of solutions. CCSD is nonpartisan and is not affiliated with any political or religious party. The organization was founded in December, 2011 by a group of Syrian civil society activists.  Inspired by the peaceful revolution for dignity, freedom and human rights that was sparked in March 2011, they founded CCSD with a vision of strengthening a long term movement for peace and democracy in Syria.

With a main office in Gaziantep, Turkey, staff in Lebanon, Iraq, and Jordan and ten offices inside Syria (in Aleppo, Idlib, Qamishli, Damascus, Damascus Suburbs, Dara’a, Deir ez-Zour, Homs, Hama and Latakia) CCSD supports a network of over 3,000 individual human rights defenders, peace builders, and democracy activists who represent dozens of civil society organizations and local governance institutions. The network includes people who live in every province of Syria and who represent all ethnic and religious groups.

CCSD’s staff of 80 reflects this diversity, with Sunni, Christian, Kurdish, Ismaili, Druzi, and Alawite staff members working together towards a common vision of a peaceful, democratic Syria. Over 40% of CCSDS staff members are women, and women are included at the highest levels of decision-making within the organization.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word about this campaign, let your friends and family know!
  • If you want to donate clothing or food items for Syrian refugees, visit the website of NuDay Syria to see how: http://www.nudaysyria.net/

story:
The Existence of Rare Marine Mammals like the Hawaiian Monk Seal is Being Threatened

The Hawaiian Monk Seal is considered to be the most endangered mammal on earth; only about 1100 individuals remain. Most of these animals live in the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands, far from human contact, but a couple hundred of them now reside in the main Hawaiian Islands. Despite being critically endangered, the importance of these ocean inhabitants is not always appreciated or understood. There is often misinformation spread about their origin and their role in the environment. The spread of misinformation can often lead to unfortunate events.

Photo: Mark Sullivan, NOAA NMFS Permit#10137-6

In 2014, five healthy Monk Seal pups were born on Kauai, but in July of 2014, one of those female pups was killed in a dog attack. In fact, at least five endangered Hawaiian Monk Seals have been killed (by unnatural causes) since 2011.  A second female pup died (from head trauma) in December of 2014 . According to the necropsy, the pup did not die of natural causes. NOAA officials stated that the death of these female pups, makes the recovery of the species particularly challenging.

We at Storybook Theatre believe that children have empathy for the creatures of the world and are most receptive to learning about their importance and the importance of conservation of all rare and endangered species. Bringing an educational program such as this directly to children in schools can have an amplified effect as it reaches the homes of those children as well. The "Imagination with Responsibility" Tour of inflatables is an attempt to bring more accurate information to the community and foster respect for endangered species and their importance. It is our hope that as these children grow, they will become the ambassadors of these rare animals and the ocean environment which is also rapidly changing.

Now is the Time to Educate Children about Endangered Marine Mammals using Life Size  Inflatable Classrooms

The Storybook Theatre of Hawaii is expanding their proven Educational Inflatable Whale Program to include the endangered Hawaiian Monk Seal, one of the rarest mammals in the world! This program already reaches thousands of children every year by bringing life sized inflatable whales to young children to teach them about the importance of marine mammals in the marine ecosystem. 

What is the program like? Watch the videos below to find out more.


This year, Storybook Theater is expanding its fleet of inflatables to include the endangered Hawaiian Monk Seal. World-renowned inflatable maker, Evelyn Roth of Festival Arts will be coming to Kauai from Australia to create two baby Monk Seals. Evelyn will also be gifting Storybook Theatre with a 30ft seal if our fundraising goal is reached. (See more about Evelyn Roth below)

While they still pack the WOW factor, these inflatables are NOT bouncy houses! Instead, they double as inflatable classrooms that can be brought to children right in their schools so that they can learn about these magestic animals on-site. The "Imagination with Responsibility" Tour will add the inflatable Monk Seals and Monk seal education component to the existing Inflatable Humpback Whale Tour. The tour will also be expanded to reach more children.

Here the whales visit Lanai.




Creating New Hawaiian Monk Seal Inflatables

Your donation will help bring Evelyn Roth to Kauai to create the baby Monk Seal inflatables. Additional educational materials will also be created. This will include the program itself and an educational coloring and activity book that can be given to teachers and students to reinforce topics that were introduced during the program. 

It will cost approximately $2500 to bring Evelyn to Kauai and for her residency. 

The inflatable seals will cost $4500 to create, but upon their creation, Storybook Theatre will be gifted with an adult inflatable seal that is valued at $6000 for no additional charge, thanks to the generosity of Evelyn Roth.


The creation of supplementary educational materials runs about $2000. In this case, the additional educational materials consist of a packet or book of worksheets, coloring sheets, games, songs and other related activities. These educational materials may includes worksheets like the one pictured below (this worksheet is part of the packet that is given to teachers during the inflatable whale tour). Educational Materials are created in partnership with Lucid Publishing, a local expert on creating educational materials for kids.

The cost of bringing the tour to children in Hawaii and the Pacific is variable, but includes costs such as airfare, baggage, transportation and lodging. Storybook Theatre will apply any additional funds raised from the Indiegogo campaign to the costs of the tour. However, Storybook Theatre does typically seek additional grant support to help fund the tour itself, so you can be rest assured that once the Monk Seals are created, they will reach the children of Hawaii.

About the Educational Inflatable Marine Mammal Tour

Storybook Theatre has been serving the children of Hawaii with the Inflatable Humpback Whale Tour since 2002 This unique and engaging program teaches young children about Pacific Humpback Whales, their anatomy, migration and their role in the marine ecosystem engaging them with songs, games, sign language, and stories. The tour reaches more than 5000 children annually. Now is the time to help us build new inflatable baby Monk Seals, so that we can bring them to children everywhere.


About Storybook Theatre

Storybook Theatre of Hawaii has been providing educational programs mostly through performing and visual arts to children for more than 30 years. Storybook Theatre's main organizational purpose is to promote environmental and arts education, share cultural diversity, encourage global understanding and citizenship, and enable children to experience and participate in performing and media arts and to empower and elucidate children and families through stories and other means. For more information about Storybook Theatre, please visit our website at www.storybook.org

About Evelyn Roth and Festival Arts

Evelyn Roth of Festival Arts comes to us Adelaide, Australia. She is not only the creator of the Harmony and Melody inflatable whales that currently tour with Storybook Theatre, but is also a master fabric artist who has created over 200 inflatable creatures that bring an enhancing joy and environmental awareness to communities worldwide. She is the Creatrix of the Nylon Zoo Story Theatres, which raises public awareness about environmental threats. Her work has been showcased at major festivals, galleries and expos in Australia, Hong Kong, Korea, the U.S., Canada, Brazil, Africa, and New Zealand.


Challenges Facing our Teachers and Schools

While there are always exceptional schools and exceptional teachers, many schools are often at a disadvantage when delivering creative programs because they can get bogged down with new common core standards, national testing, IEPs, meetings, and an ever-increasing load of administrative work. These schools must stretch their limited resources to cover the entire educational spectrum.

Storybook Theatre's Solution

Storybook Theatre is a nonprofit organization that is devoted to developing and delivering programs with a specific focus. Storybook Theater seeks grant funding and now crowd funding which enables the staff to create much more vibrant, engaging programs than schools are able to develop and deliver. In this manner, schools can simply call upon Storybook Theatre to deliver the program right to their school with no extra prep for teachers or staff.


Helping Build Inflatable Monk Seals can be very Rewarding

Besides helping educate future generations about the most endangered mammal in the world, your contribution can provide you or your organization with some fun perks:

  • Get a Digital Copy of the 2014 Whale Tour Coloring and Activity Book

  • Get a Copy of Da Tree Rs Recycling Activity Book

  • Get a chance to intern with Evelyn Roth to build the Monk Seals

  • Have the whales visit your school or organization on Kauai

  • Appear on the Russell the Rooster Show

  • Place an Ad on Russell the Rooster Show

  • Monk Seal T-shirts

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that in this tough economy, not everyone can make a monetary donation to our campaign. Here are some other things that you can do to help:

  • Please help us  get the word out by forwarding this campaign to as many people as possible. This is easy to do with Indiegogo share tools.

Japanese Translation


絶滅の危機にあるハワイアンモンクシール、希少な海洋哺乳動物の存在

ハワイアンモンクシール（あざらし）は、地球上で最も絶滅の危機に瀕した哺乳類であると見なされている。約1,100頭 だけが生き残っていると思われる。これらの動物の殆どは北西ハワイ諸島に住んでいるが人間との接触はない。今そのうちの数百頭はハワイ州の主要な島の周りにいる。ハワイアンモンクシールは、地球上で最も絶滅の危機に瀕しているにもかかわらず、海洋生物の重要性は認められていないだけでなく、理解もされていない。その起源と環境の中の役割について誤った情報が広まっている。それは不運な出来事にもつながる。


2014年、５頭の美しいモンクシールの子が生まれたが、その中の雌のアザラシ一頭が犬の攻撃で殺された。実際、2011年から少なくとも５頭の絶滅危惧なハワイアンモンクシールがすでに殺されている。(不自然な死因にて)  二頭目の雌アザラシが2014年12月死亡。剖検によると、死因は不明で老衰とは考えられない。NOAAの関係者はこれらの雌の死亡は生物種の回復困難になると述べた。

ストーリーブックシアターは子供達が世界の生き物に大きな共感を持ち、稀で絶滅寸前の種族の大切さとその保護の重要性を学び受ける素晴らしい 可能性に夢をたくしている。この教育プログラムが学校の子供達へ、そこから更に家庭へと増幅効果があるでしょう。‘責任と共に想像’インフレータブル*ツアーは更に沢山の正確な情報をコミュニティーに提供し、絶滅危惧にある動物種への尊敬そしてその重要性を培う。この子供達が成長すると共に、彼らが 海洋環境 の急激な 変化と稀な動物の大使となる事を願っています。
＊インフレータブル：ヘリウム、ガスや熱した空気を注入して人や動物、製品等の形に大きく立ち上がらせたもの。（写真）

実物大のインフレ−タブルクラスルームを使用し絶滅寸前の海洋哺乳類について子供達へ教育
ストーリーシアターオブハワイは クジラと 世界で最も希少動物の一つのハワイアンモンクシールも加え 、実績のあるインフレータブル教育プログラムを提供し、さらに拡大しています。このプログラムは 海洋生態系において海洋哺乳類の重要性 を教えるのに実際のサイズのクジラのインフレータブルを用いて、 既に毎年千人の子供達に会い、プログラムを伝えています。

プログラムについて知りたい方、こちらをご覧下さい‘
今年はストーリーブックシアターは絶滅の危惧にあるハワイアンモンクシールを含め、さらに楽しいイベントも企画しています。フェスティバルアーティストのエブリンロスがアーストラリアからカウアイ島にモンクシールのベイビー２頭を布で創作しにやって来ます。この資金調達のゴールに達成した場合、エブリンはストーリーシアターに914メートルのアザラシを贈与して下さる様です。現場の壮大なクジラを学校で体験できるようにインフレータブルクラスルームをダブルにした。ツアーはクジラに加えて、モンクシールのインフレータブルと、その教育要素をとりいれました。ツアーが多くの子供達に届くことを願っている。

皆様の寄付金はベイビーモンクシールのインフレータブルを創作するエブリンのカウアイ訪問の大きなお手伝いとなります。更に追加の教育教材もあるでしょう。プログラムの中で紹介されたトピックを強化するために、先生と生徒さんに差し上げるエディケーショナルカラーリング、アクティビティーブックがあります。

エブリンのカウアイ島訪問と滞在費用はおおよそ$2,500です。モンクシールのインフレータブル創作費は$4,500。エブリンは実際$6,000 の価値があるものを追加請求なしで、贈与して下さるそうです。大変ありがたいものです。

パケット、ワークシートの本、カラーリングシート、ゲーム、歌、アクティビティーに関係したものから成る追加の教材はおおよそ$2,000。これらの教材は下の写真にあるワークシートを含む。そしてこれらは、地元の子供向けの教材を創作する達人の、ルーシッド出版の協力関係で作られた。
ツアーをハワイ、パシフィックの子供達に届ける料金一定してませんが、航空運賃、荷物、送迎, 宿泊を含みます。Indigogoを通しての寄付金はツアーの費用として使われます。
ストーリーブックシアターは引き続き,ツアーの資金となる補助金のサポートが必要です。皆様のご協力宜しくお願いします。

海洋哺乳動物の教育について

ストーリーブックシアターはザトウクジラのインフレータブルツアーで2002年からハワイの沢山の子供達に逢ってきました。このユニークで魅力的なザトウクジラのインフレータブルのプログラムでこれからの子供達にパシフィックザトウクジラ、その移動回遊、海洋エコシステムのルールを歌、ゲーム、手話、そしてお話を通して教えます。ツアーは年間、5000人以上の子供に出逢。そして今、さらに世界の子供達逢える為に皆様のお手伝いでインフレータブルのモンクシールを創作したいのです。どうぞご協力をお願いいたします。

/ストーリーブックシアターについて

ストーリーブックシアターは子供達にパフォーマンスとヴィジュアルアートを通して、３０年以上にも渡って教育プログラムを提供してきました。私達の主な目的は環境とアートの教育の普及の働きかけ、文化の多様性の分ち合い、グローバルそして市民権の理解の促進、子供達にアートメディアやパフォーマンスの参加と経験,お話を通して子供と家族に伝達し支援する。更に詳しい情報はこちらのサイトにてwww.storybook.org

エブリンとアートフェスティバルについて

エブリンロスのアートフェスティバルがオーストラリアのアデレードで開催された。彼女は今回のカウアイ島のストーリーブックシアターにてのハーモニーメロディーのインフレータブルクジラのクリエーターだけでなく、コミュニティーそして世界に環境の意識と創作の楽しみをシェアするのに２００種に渡るインフレータブルの生き物を創作してきた布のマスターです。彼女は ナイロン動物園*のクリエーター女王で、彼女の創作は環境危機への意識を高めてくれる。彼女の作品は主なフェスティバル、ギャラリー、オーストラリアや香港や韓国、とアメリカ、カナダ、ブラジル、アフリカ、そしてニュージーランドで見られてきている。

*http://evelynrothoz.com/photos-2/index.html
先生と学校が直面するチャレンジ

学校、先生が全てそうである訳でないが、クリエイティブなプログラムを教えるにあたり、 全米共通学力標準、国のテスト,ひき続き増える管理業務等で動きがとれない為、殆どの学校は不利な立場にある。これらの学校は 教育活動範囲全体をカバーし、限られた資源をを充実する必要がある。　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　

ストーリーブックシアターの解決策

ストーリーブックシアターは明確なフォーカスでプログラムを生み出し発展することに情熱を注ぐ非営利団体です。私達はスタッフが学校にはない活気があり魅力のあるプログラムを作り出すための助成金、資金支援,クラウドファンディング*を求めています。そういうことで、学校は先生やスタッフの事前準備なしでストーリーブックシアターにプログラムの配達を電話一本でできると言う事です！
*インターネット等で資金調達の方法の一つ

世界で最も絶滅の危機にある哺乳類の教育への助けに加え、あなたの貢献は、楽しい特典付きで、あなた自身そしてあなたの団体方々へと届くでしょう。
大変な経済の中で、誰もが私達のキャンペンへの寄付金をできない事は十分理解しておりますが、他にも皆様ができる事があります:
　このキャンペンができ限りの沢山の方々に渡る様に知り合いや友達、沢山の方にこのIndigogo を使ってメール伝えたり、FBでシェアしたり、広めて下さい。宜しくお願いします。
story_txt:
The Existence of Rare Marine Mammals like the Hawaiian Monk Seal is Being Threatened

The
 Hawaiian Monk Seal is considered to be the most endangered mammal on 
earth; only about 1100 individuals remain. Most of these animals live in
 the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands, far from human contact, but a couple
 hundred of them now reside in the main Hawaiian Islands. Despite being 
critically endangered, the importance of these ocean inhabitants is not 
always appreciated or understood. There is often misinformation spread 
about their origin and their role in the environment. The spread of 
misinformation can often lead to unfortunate events.Photo: Mark Sullivan, NOAA NMFS Permit#10137-6
In

 2014, five healthy Monk Seal pups were born on Kauai, but in July of 
2014, one of those female pups was killed in a dog attack. In fact, at 
least five endangered Hawaiian Monk Seals have been killed (by unnatural
 causes) since 2011.  A second female pup died (from head trauma) in 
December of 2014 . According to the necropsy, the pup did not die of 
natural causes. NOAA officials stated that the death of these female 
pups, makes the recovery of the species particularly challenging.

We
 at Storybook Theatre believe that children have empathy for the 
creatures of the world and are most receptive to learning about their 
importance and the importance of conservation of all rare and endangered
 species. Bringing an educational program such as this directly to 
children in schools can have an amplified effect as it reaches the homes
 of those children as well. The "Imagination with Responsibility" Tour 
of inflatables is an attempt to bring more accurate information to the 
community and foster respect for endangered species and their 
importance. It is our hope that as these children grow, they will become
 the ambassadors of these rare animals and the ocean environment which 
is also rapidly changing. Now is the Time to Educate Children about Endangered Marine Mammals using Life Size  Inflatable Classrooms 


The Storybook Theatre of Hawaii is expanding their proven Educational Inflatable Whale Program to include the endangered Hawaiian Monk Seal, one of the rarest mammals in the world! This program already reaches thousands of children every year by bringing life sized inflatable whales to young children to teach them about the importance of marine mammals in the marine ecosystem. 


What is the program like? Watch the videos below to find out more.

This year, Storybook Theater is expanding its fleet of inflatables to include the endangered Hawaiian Monk Seal. World-renowned inflatable maker, Evelyn Roth of Festival Arts will be coming to Kauai from Australia to create two baby Monk Seals. Evelyn will also be gifting Storybook Theatre with a 30ft seal if our fundraising goal is reached. (See more about Evelyn Roth below)
While they still pack the WOW factor, these inflatables are NOT bouncy houses! Instead, they double as inflatable classrooms that can be brought to children right in their schools so that they can learn about these magestic animals on-site. The "Imagination with Responsibility" Tour will add the inflatable Monk Seals and Monk seal education component to the existing Inflatable Humpback Whale Tour. The tour will also be expanded to reach more children.
Here the whales visit Lanai.






Creating New Hawaiian Monk Seal Inflatables Your donation will help bring Evelyn Roth to Kauai to create the baby Monk Seal inflatables. Additional educational materials will also be created. This will include the program itself and an educational coloring and activity book that can be given to teachers and students to reinforce topics that were introduced during the program. 



It will cost approximately $2500 to bring Evelyn to Kauai and for her residency. 
The inflatable seals will cost $4500 to create, but upon their creation, Storybook Theatre will be gifted with an adult inflatable seal that is valued at $6000 for no additional charge, thanks to the generosity of Evelyn Roth.



The creation of supplementary educational materials runs about $2000. In this case, the additional educational materials consist of a packet or book of worksheets, coloring sheets, games, songs and other related activities. These educational materials may includes worksheets like the one pictured below (this worksheet is part of the packet that is given to teachers during the inflatable whale tour). Educational Materials are created in partnership with Lucid Publishing, a local expert on creating educational materials for kids.


The cost of bringing the tour to children in Hawaii and the Pacific is variable, but includes costs such as airfare, baggage, transportation and lodging. Storybook Theatre will apply any additional funds raised from the Indiegogo campaign to the costs of the tour. However, Storybook Theatre does typically seek additional grant support to help fund the tour itself, so you can be rest assured that once the Monk Seals are created, they will reach the children of Hawaii.
  About the Educational Inflatable Marine Mammal Tour 
Storybook Theatre has been serving the children of Hawaii with the Inflatable Humpback Whale Tour since 2002 This unique and engaging program teaches young children about Pacific Humpback Whales, their anatomy, migration and their role in the marine ecosystem engaging them with songs, games, sign language, and stories. The tour reaches more than 5000 children annually. Now is the time to help us build new inflatable baby Monk Seals, so that we can bring them to children everywhere.

  About Storybook Theatre


Storybook Theatre of Hawaii has been providing educational programs mostly through performing and visual arts to children for more than 30 years. Storybook Theatre's main organizational purpose is to promote environmental and arts education, share cultural diversity, encourage global understanding and citizenship, and enable children to experience and participate in performing and media arts and to empower and elucidate children and families through stories and other means. For more information about Storybook Theatre, please visit our website at www.storybook.org


About Evelyn Roth and Festival Arts


Evelyn Roth of Festival Arts comes to us Adelaide, Australia. She is not only the creator of the Harmony and Melody inflatable whales that currently tour with Storybook Theatre, but is also a master fabric artist who has created over 200 inflatable creatures that bring an enhancing joy and environmental awareness to communities worldwide. She is the Creatrix of the Nylon Zoo Story Theatres, which raises public awareness about environmental threats. Her work has been showcased at major festivals, galleries and expos in Australia, Hong Kong, Korea, the U.S., Canada, Brazil, Africa, and New Zealand.

Challenges Facing our Teachers and Schools 

While there are always exceptional schools and exceptional
teachers, many schools are often at a disadvantage when delivering creative
programs because they can get bogged down with new common core standards,
national testing, IEPs, meetings, and an ever-increasing load of administrative
work. These schools must stretch their limited resources to cover the entire
educational spectrum. 
Storybook Theatre's Solution
Storybook Theatre is a nonprofit organization that is
devoted to developing and delivering programs with a specific focus. Storybook
Theater seeks grant funding and now crowd funding which enables the staff to
create much more vibrant, engaging programs than schools are able to develop and
deliver. In this manner, schools can simply call upon Storybook Theatre to
deliver the program right to their school with no extra prep for teachers or
staff.

  Helping Build Inflatable Monk Seals can be very Rewarding
Besides helping educate future generations about the most endangered mammal in the world, your contribution can provide you or your organization with some fun perks:
Get a Digital Copy of the 2014 Whale Tour Coloring and Activity Book


Get a Copy of Da Tree Rs Recycling Activity Book




Get a chance to intern with Evelyn Roth to build the Monk Seals


Have the whales visit your school or organization on Kauai



Appear on the Russell the Rooster Show


Place an Ad on Russell the Rooster Show





Monk Seal T-shirts



Other Ways You Can Help
 We know that in this tough economy, not everyone can make a monetary donation to our campaign. Here are some other things that you can do to help:  Please help us  get the word out by forwarding this campaign to as many people as possible. This is easy to do with Indiegogo share tools.   Japanese Translation絶滅の危機にあるハワイアンモンクシール、希少な海洋哺乳動物の存在ハワイアンモンクシール（あざらし）は、地球上で最も絶滅の危機に瀕した哺乳類であると見なされている。約1,100頭 だけが生き残っていると思われる。これらの動物の殆どは北西ハワイ諸島に住んでいるが人間との接触はない。今そのうちの数百頭はハワイ州の主要な島の周りにいる。ハワイアンモンクシールは、地球上で最も絶滅の危機に瀕しているにもかかわらず、海洋生物の重要性は認められていないだけでなく、理解もされていない。その起源と環境の中の役割について誤った情報が広まっている。それは不運な出来事にもつながる。2014年、５頭の美しいモンクシールの子が生まれたが、その中の雌のアザラシ一頭が犬の攻撃で殺された。実際、2011年から少なくとも５頭の絶滅危惧なハワイアンモンクシールがすでに殺されている。(不自然な死因にて)  二頭目の雌アザラシが2014年12月死亡。剖検によると、死因は不明で老衰とは考えられない。NOAAの関係者はこれらの雌の死亡は生物種の回復困難になると述べた。ストーリーブックシアターは子供達が世界の生き物に大きな共感を持ち、稀で絶滅寸前の種族の大切さとその保護の重要性を学び受ける素晴らしい を使ってメール伝えたり、FBでシェアしたり、広めて下さい。宜しくお願いします。

story:
St. Louis Bound! 

We are off to St. Louis, Mo: Gateway to the West!  To be financially stable as we start this new chapter, we are asking for a modest donation from those that believe in us and believe "if there's a will, there's a way" to achieve your dreams.  

Matt has the opportunity to pursue a career that reflects his values and passions starting in April.  I am happily going along for the ride, and plan to seek out a position in the field of community development and education.   

Matt will be the Culinary Director of Athlete Eats, with a mission to support local farms and businesses to prepare all-natural, healthy meals.  Since the day I met Matt, this was his number one passion in business; now he can pursue that dream.   

I have had several opportunities to 'try out' varied career paths, which would not have been possible without the support of my friends and family.  Those experiences have shaped who I am today, and I am forever grateful.  I fully support Matt in his aspirations and look forward to seeing all that he will accomplish, as I'm sure you do to.   

After putting this transition into perspective, we realize that we need help with relocating to build our lives together and give back to the communities of St. Louis.

Moving is Costly 

We know moving is never cheap, but this one is a doozey!  We have extensive fees to terminate our lease (which is up June 1st and we hit the road in April) not to mention the overlapping rent we will have to pay once we arrive in St. Louis. 

We have researched several affordable moving options for our belongings and vehicles, but nothing is short of $1,100.   

For those of you that don't know, Matt was involved in a serious car accident two years ago, and was not able to walk for a year.  Though he is on his feet now, the cost of his recovery is an ever-present reality.   His spirit and appreciation for life has landed him this opportunity, but his finances have created some tenacious obstacles.  

To make ends meet, we are contemplating taking out a personal loan.  Though this is a valid option, it will prolong our financial stability and the future we hope to build together.  We would hate to start our new life together, out West, on the wrong foot. 

No Donation Too Small 

We love and appreciate all of you: friends, loved ones and kind hearted strangers. We know times are tough for everyone, but your contribution, no matter the size, will help us to achieve our goals. $10...$5...$1? We appreciate all denominations!  This campaign will only work through exposure and the generosity of others.

We hope to pursue new opportunities while serving the community, but we need some help getting there.  We appreciate your consideration and promise to pay it forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word!  Share on Facebook, Twitter, or  by word of mouth.  We only have 60 days to reach our fundraising goal, so every effort counts!

story:
LessonPlanPro.com is a marketplace where teachers can save time, earn residual income, and inspire students in classrooms around the world by sharing their best teaching materials. 

With so much emphasis on standardized testing, students have more and more difficulty working electives into their school schedules. Arts educators are spending more time on fund-raising and recruiting and less on content development. Many arts educators work 50 - 60 hours a week, only to have their programs cut for low enrollment. 

LessonPlanPro.com provides a venue for arts educators across the world to share their best resources and improve their teaching while saving time and making extra money.

The Impact

When LessonPlanPro becomes successful, the ripple effects will be tremendous. We believe the site will do the following:

  • Reduce burnout among quality arts educators because they will be able to save hours and hours of planning time.
  • Reward quality teachers for taking the extra time to create amazing materials to share with their colleagues.
  • Attract "the best and the brightest" to the arts education profession by raising the compensation potential and lowering the number of hours teachers will have to work.
  • Create more demand for arts electives in the schools because teachers will have access to amazing content from their colleagues, thereby attracting large numbers of students.

What We Need

While we hope to raise $100,000 in start-up capital in the coming year, our goal for this campaign is to raise $35,000. These funds will be used for:

  • Website infrastructure and maintenance to make the site faster and more user friendly -- 35%
  • User guides and tutorials -- 10%
  • An outreach program that will create awareness of the site to the teachers that will benefit, both from selling and purchasing materials on the site -- 55%
LessonPlanPro.com is a marketplace, so there really isn't a specific product we can offer for pre-sale. Instead, we have created a special line-up of perks to say 'Thank you!' for your support of our mission to Elevate Extraordinary Arts Educators Everywhere!

What You Get (The PERKS!)

Digital Display - $10 : With every donation of $10 or more, you can leave a personalized message to your favorite arts teacher on the "Thank a Teacher" section of our website. You'll also receive a digital certificate of thanks and a social media "shout out"

Wristband & Sticker - $25: With every donation of $25 or more, you will receive a rubber wristband & sticker declaring your love and support of the arts.  (Sticker shown below)

Annual Professional Membership - $50: Given to yourself or as a gift to a favorite teacher, the Professional Membership provides much higher royalty payments to teachers who are selling their materials on LessonPlanPro. Donors at this level also receive the perks provided at the $25 level and below.


Tote Bag - $50: In addition to the perks at the $25 level and below, receive an "I support innovation in arts education" tote bag for carrying your music, dance, theater gear and art supplies. (shown here)


Tshirt - $75: Receive a black "I support innovation in arts education" Tshirt in addition to the perks at the $25 level and below.

Gift Card + Tshirt or Tote - $100: A $20 gift certificate to purchase teaching materials of your choice on LessonPlanPro makes a great holiday gift to your favorite teachers! Donors at this level also receive perks from the $10 and $25 levels.

Advertise on LessonPlanPro - $100: Receive three months of ad space on the web site, your choice of a Tshirt or Tote and all of the perks from the $25 level.


_____________________________________________________________________________

Evolution of LessonPlanPro

After attending a personal growth workshop (PSI Basic Seminar)more than 2 years ago, I wrote a mission statement that I posted on LinkedIn, without having any idea of how I would ever accomplish it:

"Utilize my 20+ years of experience in publishing/communications, non-profit management, and orchestra education to create a viable income source for underpaid musicians and arts educators."

My business plan is patterned after a very successful site that caters primarily to elementary teachers of core academic subjects. LessonPlanPro focuses on supporting arts programs at all levels — a segment of the teaching profession with very unique needs and challenges.

I have been working on transforming this concept into a startup while continuing to teach full-time as a high school orchestra director, a career that demands quite a few more hours than 40 per week! People who told me “it will take 10 times longer and 10 times more money than you expect to start a business” were correct! I came to my senses and realized I will be so much more successful if I reach out for support.

I am so excited now to have the backing of two committed partners and two amazing advisers. What’s missing is the capital to upgrade the website and do a proper marketing launch. For the last two years, I have invested all of my personal savings and disposable income, as well as nearly every second of free time, into making this project a reality. A recent cancer diagnosis has thrown a wrench into my plans. The time has come to go outside of my comfort zone and request financial assistance from friends and family, and their friends and families.

I would like to invite you to visit our website and learn more about my partners and advisors at  http://www.lessonplanpro.com/lpp-team. Also, here is a link to a PowerPoint with voice-over that summarizes the business plan (warning: it is seven minutes long!):https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_JfVL44S2KI.

Risks & Challenges

The online marketplace business model is a proven concept. The challenge is to fund the venture adequately to have it stand out from other similar sites that are beginning to pop up. We believe LessonPlanPro will be successful because of the partnership team that is dedicated to the long-term vision of "elevating extraordinary arts educators."

Our goal is to be profitable, but more importantly we want our USERS to be profitable. Only in this way will the site's true impact be realized. We are true believers in a Win-Win relationship with everyone who comes in contact with our site.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a huge financial commitment at this time, there are many ways you can help! 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share our posts on your own social media pages and let you friends and colleagues know about it.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so, so much for your generosity in supporting our campaign!

story:
According the World Health Organization, about 50% of the world's population live in rural areas, but only 24% of doctors work in these areas. One reason for this disparity is the fact that medical schools do not prepare their students to work in rural areas.

Communities and rural people are those whose livelihoods and social reproduction are predominantly related to the countryside, the forest, water, agriculture and extractivism. Are peasants, settled rural workers, traditional communities, as quilombolas, riverside; craftsmen and fishmongers; those that inhabit or work in extractive reserves in forest or aquatic areas; those affected by dams and many others. These populations use natural resources for their subsistence, with family labor, and so the process of sickness of these people is related to this context. In the rural environment, illiteracy, child mortality and suicide rates are higher; in addition, some health problems and risk factors are more often found in rural than in urban areas. Some examples of this are: acute, subacute and chronic intoxications by pesticides; accidents with venomous animals and toxic plants; accidents resulting from the occupational hazards of rural lands, such as agriculture and livestock.

Physicians in rural areas need to be decisive in their care because they are often isolated from other colleagues. Thus, they need to be able to perform diagnostic and therapeutic surgical procedures, handle emergencies and perform care in all life cycles, including terminality.

The 15th WONCA World Rural Health Conference will be held from April 26 to 29, 2018 at the India Habitat Center, New Delhi, India. The conference is an opportunity to bring stakeholders from around the world; bringing together best international practices and brainstorming sessions addressing current and future challenges in rural health.

At the congress, we will be responsible for various workshops (on Young doctors and academics in the rural area, video production, rural women, Social media), we also submit several papers for oral presentations and posters, we also compete with several animations and a documentary  in the International Short Film Festival and with the text - in the Rural Ideathon contest and we will participate in activities in rural areas of India to know the Rural Family Medicine in the country.

In addition, Brazil is still developing a curriculum on rural family medicine in all medical schools. In addition, we do not yet have the specific residency in rural family medicine in Brazil, as it already exists in other countries.

Attending a world-wide conference is an opportunity to represent Brazil, share experiences and return with the intention of encouraging the country to discuss the importance of looking at the rural, valuing and respecting its peculiarities. In addition to providing better care for the communities we are working in.

story:
My name is Sudan Zhuang. I am  currently a Junior at Malden High School.  In October 2012, I was introduced to a program called Youth in Government, it is a YMCA programs in the United State that allows high school students to serve in a model government process at the local, and state levels. As I was unexpected, this amazing programs has totally changed me. Not only because it changed my life, but it also helped me to be a confident person who now is willing to take every challenge. I was once a shy girl who spoke limited English when I just came to America three years ago, everything in the beginning was a huge challenge for me, but I am glad that I finally overcame all the difficulties throughout the years. I remembered two hours before the YIG conference: palms sweaty from the nervousness, stomach churning from the apprehension of the events to unfold. Then, a sense of warmth embraced me as I walked through the State House, comforting some of my worries. I know it  was my time to be brave again, it was my time to take the this conference seriously as it was of my responsibility. Life before Youth in Government: I could never imagine myself speaking in front of audiences with a loud and brave voice. Life after Youth in Government: I am now ready and willing to speak in the public and I am comfortable enough to share my own preventives on different things.

 

However, this great program also provided me a great opportunity. I was selected as one of twenty-one delegates from the Massachusetts YMCA Youth in Government programs to participate in the YMCA Youth Conference on National Affairs (CONA). Participants from all over the U.S will be presenting their proposals on National and International issues.This conference will be held at the YMCA’s Blue Ridge Assembly in Black Mountain, NC from June 19-July 5 2013. I will be spending 7 days with 700 participants selected from 34 states.

CONA is a great opportunity and experience that helps participants to meet people from all over the nations. It is created to gain an awareness of National concerns and issues. It help us to increase the understanding of Federal Government and its relation to State, National and International matters.  Formal debate of participant’s proposal on national or international matter and informal interactions are balanced throughout the conference. This allows participants to build relationship and work creatively together with young adults and adults.

 

The cost to attend CONA is $1,000 which includes airfare and ground transportation conferene fee, and miscellaneous expenses such as conference photo, conference and delegation t-shirts. Your contribution of $50 or $100 will help me attend this grat conference. Your response before June 15 will be greatly appreciated.

 

 

Thank you for your consideration and generosity.

 

Sincerely,

Sudan Zhuang Malden YMCA Youth in Government Delegate

My Email & cell phone: sudanzhuang@yahoo.com   

____________________________________________

My proposal for CONA is to outlaw the animal testing.

_________________________________________________

Besides being a YIG delegate, I also have a great passion about art. I do drawing, painting, and photography.

This painting is transferred from one of my landscape photographs. I will be mailing my landscape paintings along with a Thank You card.

 

Your donations will be highly appericated.

 

Thank you for reading this. 

______________________________________________

story:
Blueprints for A New Global Movement

We are just beginning a long and worthy road toward unified success with our first 1000 members. Our plan is to restore our global integrity by ushering in a new cultural renaissance revolving around green technology, sustainable lifestyle, the arts, music, local cooperation, and the empowerment of shared wisdom.

By leveraging the power and attunement of social media, we will begin to build the network and content necessary to help shift global consciousness and provide a platform for real tangible change in local communities.

Phase 1

Our first endeavor is to build and maintain an online social network dedicated to educating and enriching the public with resources for the purpose of building thriving local communities in line with sustainability, cultural integration, and environmental health.

Phase 2

Using our platform, resources and online community, we will implement cause-based fundraising campaigns to reach even the most cynical audiences, inspiring open-minded community and cultural development.

Phase 3

Having accomplished our goal of disseminating a wealth of holistic knowledge and resources to the world, Thrive Society will begin its efforts to implement real-world change. We will build and staff community centers based on our shared knowledge and values dedicated to social, cultural, economic, and environmental healing.

Phase 1
Our first endeavor is to build and maintain an online social network dedicated to educating and enriching the public with resources for the purpose of building thriving local communities in line with sustainability, cultural integration, and environmental health.
Phase 2
Using our platform, resources and online community, we will implement cause-based fundraising campaigns to reach even the most cynical audiences, inspiring open-minded community and cultural development.
Phase 3
Having accomplished our goal of disseminating a wealth of holistic knowledge and resources to the world, Thrive Society will begin its efforts to implement real-world change. We will build and staff community centers based on our shared knowledge and values dedicated to social, cultural, economic, and environmental healing.

story:
Hello, we are three 8th graders from Tucson, Arizona trying to raise money for our our school immersion trips. At our school, we strive to create independence and interest in helping the community. We do this by going on specialized immersion trips that will teach us these things. Our first immersion trip is one that will be an all night trip to a mountain in Arizona called Kit Peak. There we will use all the knowledge we have gained during our time studying astronomy to enjoy a night of observing the universe for ourselves.

Our second immersion trip takes place in December right before Winter break. We call this trip Community Service Week. During this time, we split up into groups and travel around Tucson doing Community Service. Prior to that, we call all the organizations ourselves and independently plan the whole thing. Our other immersions include: bike safety, art learning,and a week long trip to a leadership camp called Windsong.  

Any donation to our campaign, small or large, makes a huge difference in our educational experience. Thank you!

story:
Introduction

Our next generation of women leaders is suffering. The American College Health Association reported in 2011 that 91% of female college students felt “overwhelmed.” USA Today reported last year that female college freshmen’s emotional health hit an all-time low. Only 46% surveyed would rate their emotional health as “above average.” This pressure to “do it all” and to do it perfectly is manifesting itself in low self-esteem, poor relationship choices, anxiety, depression, eating disorders and suicides.

Living away from home for the first time, the stress of wanting to succeed, adapting to new routines and studies, trying to make new friends, getting insufficient sleep, feeling pressure to use alcohol and drugs, worrying about money – it all takes a toll.

After her own personal experience with depression, Dr Tanya wants to encourage women of all ages to make their health & well-being a priority, not an afterthought. Dr. Tanya seeks to specifically engage college-aged/millennial women (undergraduate & graduate) around the globe in a discussion on mental/emotional wellness.  Dr Tanya has also launched a national pledge campaign, Stress Free Sorority (SFS) that invites women to TAKE THE PLEDGE  and seeks to promote discussions and increase awareness around emotional and physical well-being.

The Pledge:

• MONITOR and be honest about my feelings

• ENGAGE in activities to manage and minimize stress

• TALK to someone if I feel overwhelmed, depressed, or suicidal


What We Need & What You Get

Dr Tanya is on a mission to raise funds to support the attendance of of ONE (aiming for 2) college student (graduate or undergraduate) at the 6th World Congress on Women’s Mental Health in Tokyo, Japan in March 22-25, 2015. Together, we will collaborate on an international scale to learn about

  • Social, economic, ethical, cultural and biological factors that affect women’s mental health
  • Women’s roles in marriage, family and society, and how it affects their mental health
  • The causes, effects and elimination of domestic violence/abuse on women
  • Better education and public information about women’s mental health
  • Gender-specific treatment and prevention
  • And much more!

Where Do Your Donations Go?

FUNDS raised will off-set student's travel & registration, to include:


The Impact

In 2013, with the support of over 50 contributors, the Developing Leaders in Women's Health Award successfully supported one exceptional student to attend the Women's Mental Health Congress in Lima, Peru.  Ideally, the 2014-2015 Award Campaign seeks to exceed our funding goal in order to open the door for more deserving young women to benefit. Imagine the impact that these students will have, armed with their new found knowledge to educate others on their campuses and beyond! Together, we can erase the myths and the stigma that surround mental health issues. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Want to take your investment further?  Here are a few other ways for you to get involved:

  • Share this campaign with your friends, families and coworkers via email, Twitter and Facebook. This is VERY EFFECTIVE! 
  • Encourage young women you know to visit the SFS website to TAKE THE PLEDGE!
  • Encourage students who are interested to apply to receive this travel award -- Click HERE to complete ONLINE application!

Thank You for your generosity!!

*Contributions made via Pay-Pal are preferred. If funding goal is exceeded, additional monies will be used to support the attendance of additional students. ALL funds will go DIRECTLY to support students.  If funding goal is not reached, ALL donations will be refunded.  


Recognizing our COLLABORATIVE Campaign Partners:
