story:
I am Colonel John Boggs, U.S. Marine Corps (Ret.). I have had the privilege of wearing the cloth of the nation, serving you, for over 30 years. I need your help. More specifically, our children, and in many respects your children, need your help.

I am a member of the Scarlet and Gold Committee of Arizona and we are raising money for college scholarships, as part of the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation, for the children of Marines and Navy Corpsman who served with Marines.

Our goal this year is $1million dollars. We have never asked for the help of everyday Americans. Marines pride themselves on taking care of each other and never being a burden to others. I am convinced that American people care for their Marines and Navy Corpsman as much as they do each other. So, I am asking for your help.

I am asking, no, I am confident that American People will help us raise at least $25,000 towards our goal of $1million.

The money we raise will go directly towards the scholarships for the children of Marines and Navy Corpsman who served with Marines. Those who donate in excess of $250 will receive an invitation to our 11 May 2013 Awards Dinner.

A short story—in April 2008 two young Marines stood their post in a town known as Ramadi in Iraq. It was considered the most dangerous place on earth at the time. The two Marines had just taken their post and given the normal orders …no unauthorized personnel or vehicles are to pass. Shortly after assuming their duties, a truck turned into the ally way and picked up speed. It was apparent that it was not going to stop. The two Marines did their duty. They fired into the truck, stopping it just short of where they were posted. It exploded. They did not survive.

Sadly, this is not uncommon in combat. Marines are killed, and many suffer wounds that will be with them for a lifetime. This incident, however, was caught on a nearby surveillance video camera. The video showed that the entire event took six seconds. The last views of the camera showed the police officers fleeing as any normal person would do. The truck was picking up speed. The Marines never wavered; the truck was stopped, and in an instant, it exploded. Had the truck been able to get past the Marines it would have ended up in a barracks area where Marines and their Iraqi counterparts sleep.

One of the Marines, a young corporal, had a wife, two children, and a mother and sister that lived with him. His salary was about $23,000 annually. His children, and the many other children of Marines and Navy Corpsman, should they want to go to college, will not be stopped because of a lack of funding. That is why the Scarlet and Gold Committee is in full support of the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation. That is why we are going to raise $1million this year. That is why I am asking everyday American People to participate in this effort.

I ask that you contribute what you can; if you cannot please pass along to your friends and shipmates what we are trying to do.

I wish all who read this fair winds and following seas.   Semper Fi!  John

story:
Who We Are:

At the Community Mediation Center (CMC) we know that Conflict Transformation Training Changes Lives.  We’ve been helping people find peaceful ways of solving conflict for 13 years, serving more than 30,000 people in the Kansas City area, with mediation, dialogue facilitation and training. CMC is a non-profit 501(c) 3, and no one is turned away because of a lack of ability to pay for service.  A small staff and many volunteers go to sites that are convenient for participants, and provide processes for respectful interaction, resulting in a plan to move forward in peaceful ways. 

Preventing Headlines by Changing Lives

Safe and Connected Communities

This project, Safe and Connected Communities, will provide a conflict resolution training experience for Kansas City residents in areas that are high risk for conflict and violence.  The training will teach the principles of Restorative Justice; all parties affected by conflict are included in plans to make things as right as possible moving forward.  A circle format will invite learning and a deep connection between participants, forming a core group of individuals who will support each other during and after the experience.  Participants will create a project to take back to their communities that will hold up the concepts of Conflict Resolution they have learned.

The Problem:

Homicide is the leading cause of death for persons aged 16-40 in Kansas City, Missouri.  Homicides account for more than 75% of KCMO’s violent crime in an area labeled the ‘Urban Core’ which accounts for only 9% of the city’s land mass (30 out of 320 square miles). Studies show that violence stems from unresolved interpersonal conflict, often beginning as a misunderstanding and escalating to out-of-control reactions to simple situations.  Although most residents attempt to live their lives in a law-abiding manner, persons overwhelmed by life, and dealing with social and economic woes, have created a different norm. 

Our Solution:

Your contribution allows us to put trained peacemakers as "boots-on-the ground" in our neighborhoods. Violence is a learned behavior and can be affected by combining evidence-based and innovative interventions.  Every community houses bright and energetic people who have a great capacity to foster and create positive change.  Safe and Connected Communities brings training and hands-on experience in conflict resolution to residents in the community who are best poised to spread the skills to others around them, creating a different norm from the inside out. Peace going viral!

Executive Director Annette Lantz-Simmons, MA: “I have witnessed hundreds of examples of reconciliation between parties that never dreamed they could come together, talk through their issues and co-create a plan to move forward in peaceful ways.  There is a new wave of collaboration and respect that is washing through our area.  We are helping to stir the waters!”

What We Need:

We need $19,950 to provide conflict resolution training experience for 3 groups of up to 25 participants, 5 sessions each group, meeting weekly for 5 weeks.

Recruiting for sessions $2,200

Incentives for participants $2,750

Childcare for sessions $900

3 trainers $4,500

Support for participants restorative justice projects $3,750

Snacks and materials (incl. training and textbooks) $3,150

Research $500

Admin/Staff costs $2,200

Total: $19,950

What You Get:

$10 and all other donations receive the headline you prevent, the new headline you made possible, and the story behind them.

$25 donation receives an original art print with a peace theme by Kansas City artist Rob Hatem.

$100 donation receives a one hour individual facilitation.

$500 donation receives a circle facilitation or training for your group.

$1,000 donation will sponsor a youth. Receive a personal letter from a youth who is benefiting from restorative justice or conflict resolution training.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Funds raised will support every aspect of the project; recruitment, training materials, childcare, facilitators, and participant projects. However, if you can’t or choose not to donate, you can still support the Community Mediation Center by volunteering to prepare/attend the sessions, talk to participants, write about the project, or donate in-kind supplies.

story:
No child should be abused, exploited, or forced to work. Help Stahili Foundation end child exploitation and abuse and empower communities in rural Kenya through education! On March 9th, 2014, Stahili and its fabulous supporters will be running in the CPC Marathon in The Hague to raise funds to support child victims of exploitation and abuse.

Your support for our runners will make a huge impact in the lives of our children!

About Stahili Foundation

Stahili Foundation is a volunteer-based non-profit organization dedicated to combating child labour, exploitation, and abuse of children living in rural Kenya. We believe that we can combat these issues through education.

Goal: To rescue child victims, give them a life that they deserve through education, and empower them and their communities.

The children living in an abusive situation at an orphanage in rural Kenya were the driving force behind Michelle Oliel, Laura Walker, and Hannah Ackerman organizing Stahili Foundation. Project Mwangi is Stahili Foundation’s first project. It was established after Laura, Hannah, and Michelle realized that the abuse and exploitive situation the children were living in at the Orphanage needed to end. We called this Project Mwangi, named after the child who had his femur bone violently broken as punishment for soiling his bed.

Stahili Foundation started its work by rescuing a child victim of forced labour at the orphanage. To date we have rescued 25 child victims and provided them with the basic needs they deserve: a supportive and loving environment and a top-notch education through post-secondary school.

Education is at the core of our philosophy. Sending our children to high-performing schools gives them the greatest chance of building a successful future and breaking the cycle of poverty and conditions that fuel exploitation and abuse.

The Impact

Your support will ensure that our children are free from exploitation and have all the tools they need to succeed. Your donation will be used to support family and community relationships as well a child's secondary school education. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways If you would like more information about Stahili Foundation or join us on our mission to end exploitation, we would love to hear from you! Laura, Hannah, and Michelle can be reached at stahilifoundation@gmail.com.

Like us on Facebook and Follow us on Twitter!

Asante Sana!

story:
Short Summary

The gift of Mathematics is not to be kept to one person. It's the one subject that encompasses the truth of "The more you share, the more you keep!"  I am on a mission to help those see Mathematics with a new set of eyes that will enable those in underprivileged communities to overcome this seemingly difficult topic with ease.  I've been very successful at this type of training for over 10 years (from GED to high school to College) where I've been able to match life situations to mathematical topics and examples. It's not only in the United States, but this epidemic of a universal topic is global.  I contacted B.A.S.I.C.S. International founder (Patricia Wilkins) and she loved my workshop proposal.  The goal is to obtain 450 donation of $9.99. I plan to make a difference with the help of people like yourself.  Thanks in advance!

What We Need & What You Get

  • I estimated a funding amount of  roughly $4,500 and the donors will be recognized in a blog I'm putting together.  The funds will be for workshop materials (books, internet, chalk, print outs) for nearly 50 - 100 Ghanian students, transportation, and meals lodging.

The Impact

Mathematically literacy has become the great equalizer for economic disparity and the very foundation for critical thinking and problem solving.

  • Enhancing math and science skills makes ethnic groups more attractive candidates for high tech, engineering, physics, and financial related jobs . 
  • I've taught over 2,000 students in my career and I've been able to witness growth in confidence, job security, and a willingness to share new found knowledge amongst family and peers.
  • We go from strong math fundamentals to strong global communities by adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing and READING.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is time. If we the funds are raised in a timely fashion, due to school and work schedules in mid to late August, I may have to postpone the workshop until a later date.

  • Find the right priced books at the decent price and shipping them may be a challenge if the time is squandered.
  • I know the book I plan to use and will contact the publisher for bulk rate discount and logistics assistance regardless if I make the trip or not because the children can still use the materials.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks,

Tjuan

story:
Urban Acrobatics

   Urban Acrobatics is a parkour and freerunning gym that features aerial fabric, tumbling, martial arts, dance, and other acrobatic arts.  The parkour and freerunning classes were originally taught out of 5280 Gymnastics; one of the top gymnastic gyms in the state.  Soon these classes were being offered in three different gyms in order to accommodate student enrollment.  It has become clear that a dedicated facility is needed to accommodate the program.  Urban Acrobatics is now a 14,000 square foot facility dedicated to movement and acrobatic arts.

   Today, students continue to grow in skill and  in number.  Urban Acrobatics is in a position to set the new standard for fun, fitness, and safety in the acrobatic sports community. With your help, this gym the will provide training equipment for kids, soft landing mats, and exciting new parkour obstacles.  Your donation will help us make parkour and other acrobatic arts a staple in today's physical education.  We hope to see parkour become standard in physical education, recreation centers, and gyms.

Donation allocation

  • $4,000 will provide students with gymnastics quality landing mats (a cheese wedge mat for tumbling, 2 8" mats for landings, and rubber/foam surfaces for our floors and obstacles).
  • $2,000 will help ensure our gyms coaches are receiving expert training in health and safety to provide kids and adults with a professional learning experience. 
  • $4,000 will be invested in building Urban Acrobatics' "Parkour City."  This exciting system of structures will include slanted walls, bars, and crawl spaces.  This will open up many new opportunities for movement and creativity.

Your Impact

   Parkour has been getting the attention of people all over the world.  People are striving to master their physical capabilities and trying to have fun doing it.  While parkour attempts to safely help students achieve greater physical strength, awareness, and control.  However, parkour does not encourage the competitive and rigid training structure that most organized sports have today. It welcomes all ages and skill levels and has formed one of the fastest growing athletic communities in the world. Come join us and contribute to this humble community!  You will find a new way to stay fit and will gain life long friends as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

   Help us get the word out by sharing this page with your friends and family.
Social media, email, and word-of-mouth will make a difference.

Thank you
Sincerely

Lorin Ball / Gym Manager
& the Urban Acrobatics Family

story:
Who We Are

Follow My Vote is a startup from Virginia Tech, which is located in Blacksburg, VA.

Our company was born on the 4th of July in 2012, founded on the principles of freedom, as a tribute to the Founding Fathers of the United States. We are on a mission to change the world, while ensuring that it changes in the way “We the People” want it to!

We are well on our way to establishing ourselves as a credible nonpartisan political news source.

We're also in the process of developing a mobile application that improves upon the lack of transparency and efficiency in governmental affairs and allows the people in the United States to hold their elected officials accountable to voting in ways that truly represent the people’s beliefs.

With the support and participation of the citizens of the United States of America, our hope is that our mobile app becomes a legitimized voting system that is adopted among democratic societies across the globe and helps to bring about a real understanding of the true differences and similarities among the citizens of this planet, which in turn could make the world a more peaceful place.


What We Need

Unfortunately, we have hit a road block on our path to success and need your help to break through, as the sole developer working on the Follow My Vote app had to step away from the project due to personal reasons, leaving us with an unfinished product.

This may have been a blessing in disguise, as we have been able to use these past few weeks to re-think the design and functionality of our application and have settled on some new ideas that we think will make the finished product even better.

However, being that we no longer have a developer on our team, which is the most critical piece needed to bring our vision to reality, we've decided to launch this crowdfunding campaign to raise the funds necessary to secure the development support needed to complete our app.

We've estimated that it will take the work of two part time developers 14 weeks to complete the project, which is exactly what your contribution(s) will go toward:

2 Developers  (20 hrs/week x 14 weeks)


What You Get

In return, we have a range of perks to show our gratitude for your support. If you are willing to contribute, we will also put your name on our website, listing you as an honorary "Founding Father" to showcase to the world that you have contributed to such a noble and worthy cause.


The Impact

We are dedicated to getting "We The People" back into the political process and ensuring our elected officials' votes reflect the will of the people; and, we intend to accomplish this through the widespread use of our mobile application.

Once built, the Follow My Vote Mobile App has the potential to fundamentally change how our country operates by making our government more accountable and, in turn, more effective.

So, please contribute to our crowdfunding campaign today, so that we can complete our mobile app and begin using it to create a better tomorrow!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in good financial standing, that is okay! There are so many ways to help contribute to our success:

- Find us on Facebook, like our page, and engage with our posts.

- Follow us on Twitter and Pinterest.

- Subscribe to our YouTube Channel

- Visit our website, check out our blog, and subscribe to our newsletter.

- Volunteer! If you have any skill or expertise that may help us on our road to success, please contact us.

- Tell your friends, family, and co-workers about our mission by using the Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word even further!

story:
My request? Let me help you with phone, web or face to face tech+learning support. 

Anyone who knows me will tell you I love to help and regularly chat for far too long than is normal about how tech like laptops, smart phones, iPads and tablets can, in balance, help make our lives better. To help with my job security in 2014, I am now making the technology and education skills I have gathered over the last decade available for those who really need some simple, personalised assistance.

Help me fulfil a dream to listen, learn & teach in the USA this June and July.

I will achieve this if I can fund a trip to improve my own skills by attending the NMC (New Media Consortium) 2014 conference in Portland, Oregan, and/or the Apple Distinguished Educators Institute in San Diego, and attend and deliver workshops in the USA while I am there.

 My massive thanks to Educorp for selecting the top Super supporter pledge!! Look out for more from them soon re: transforming learning spaces.



What You Get:

  • Access to my unique way of explaining technology in simple but empowering ways
  • The chance to choose just the level of support you need
  • The chance to follow my journey and support me to become even better at what supporting my fellow educators and people like yourself
  • I can provide support and workshops on a range of topics, and even customise them for you immediate needs
  • My areas of expertise include: iPads, Macs, big picture planning, innovation, the SAMR model, Challenge Based Learning, Citizen Science, mobile devices, Using tablets to do 'work', App workflows, creating with iPads and tablets, Online learning tools and iBooks.

Why you can trust me to support you:

Not only am I an experienced teacher, but also an Apple Distinguished Educator who has been rated at number 1 in the world for tech knowledge (via the Quiz-Up app). My iBook about iPads and apps reached number 1 in Australia for computer-related titles, my educational YouTube videos have been viewed over 50,000 times, and I've been awarded by both the Department of Education in Queensland, and the UK's Learning Without Frontiers conference as an innovative educator. You can find out more via JNXYZ.net and JNXYZtraining.net.



What I need:

I will be contributing my own money, time and frequent flyer points to make this trip possible, as well as volunteering to help pay for event fees. What I still need is:
  • Additional funds to cover travel and accommodation expenses
  • Opportunities to hone my craft by supporting your tech + learning needs
  • Opportunities to Listen, Learn and Teach in US locations


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask the people in your networks to support the campaign
  • Suggest other perks to me that I can add to best support you
  • Send the link for this page to Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest etc with a personal message of support from yourself.
  • Follow @jnxyz on twitter, or 'Like' JNXYZ training on Facebook to help increase my ability to share online.

story:
I am Bertony Paul, founder of Ifriendnet Orgnization, inc. I am from Haiti and experienced hunger first hand. I started the Wolove Garden Haiti project since March 2014 with 50 children whom have 50 backyard gardens to feed themselves today. Though, I need a laptop and 20 portable solar panels to start an online class to teach small business management and entrepreneurship to the kids. Finally, your support is needed to continue to empower the Haitian children to have hope and possibilities and enable them to dream!

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Mamie Cashmere Kamara, formerly Miss N’zerekore 2002, Guinea, is Founder and Owner of Cashmere Entertainment LLC with a mission to organize MY AFRICAN QUEEN CONTEST, which nurtures and supports contestants along their paths to personal and professional growth as they strive to be self-confident, elegant, charismatic, and honorable in their representation of their countries.



    Each contestant is fighting for a CAUSE, which is described in their bios. 

    The money that is raised will be applied in the following manner:

    • 30% for the contestants
    • 30% for the organization (Cashmere Entertainment LLC)
    • 40% for the cause of the winner


      More about

      Mamie Cashmere Kamara

      Born in Liberia, grown up in Guinea, Cashmere’s talents are not limited to entertainment, fashion, cuteness, and beauty alone. She successfully organized her own pageant five years in a row until she moved to the United States in 2005, where she acquired an Associate Degree in Human Services and a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration Management.

      MY AFRICAN QUEEN CONTEST is her newest venture and she is welcoming everyone to become part of this innovative experience by celebrating the African Beauty in all its forms.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't contribute, you can still help; get the word out and make some noise  about thiscampaign.

story:
Support Our Village

The heart and soul of our humble preschool cooperative is perfectly described through the definition of lazure – a rhythmical, purposeful blending of watercolors to create something beautiful. 

Like the watercolors, we aim to blend various educational philosophies to foster the individual learning style of each child.  The child-led environment will infuse concepts from Montessori, Waldorf, Reggio, and other methods. Lazure Learning Village families will collaboratively develop intentional curriculum, guide our children, and create a supportive village.

Our Marietta-based cooperative has a location, a small group of committed families, and a start date of September 8th – but we need your support to help cover major recurring expenses.

The Need

Let's get to the numbers - we are aiming to raise $1800 this Fall quarter fundraiser. We are so thankful to have raised over half of that goal through our yard sale fundraiser, and just need a little more to meet our target amount. We have a grand vision and are diligently working to bring that vision to fruition. While we would love for all of our tuition to go directly to enriching the curriculum and learning environment for the children, a huge chunk will be spent on general recurring expenses such as:

-Rent ($750/month)
-Building maintenance and supplies
-A 2-day per week teacher that will work directly with the children

We are asking for your support to help cover just a portion of these expenses for the months of September, October, and November. Reaching our goal would help cover $600 per month when combined with our yard sale fundraising total.

    The Impact

    The reality is that we are small - a dozen preschool-age children stemming from a handful of families - and being small will allow us to truly focus on each individual child and their needs.

    Your contribution will help sustain Lazure Learning Village, allow us to stay small, and help us spend more time focused on the caliber of our truly original, blended curriculum and less time focused on making rent.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      This IndieGoGo campaign exists for those who feel led to give to Lazure Learning Village. But there are other ways you can help!

      • Share this campaign with friends and family
      • Check out our website for upcoming fundraising events
      Regardless of how you give or how much you give, we are so grateful and appreciative of your support.

story:
There are only 2 days left for the campaign! 


Every contribution of $25 or above will receive a free $50 gift voucher! 
Every 3rd contribution of $275 or above will receive DOUBLE value for gift vouchers!! 


Who We Are

     We are Village Industrial Artist Studio (VIAS). Our goal is to provide education and tools to people of all ages and create a "Maker Space" for the public. When you have an idea to create something big or small, we want to help make it happen! Weather it involves pattern-making, wood working, machining, forging, casting, 3-D printing and modeling, ceramics, lost wax casting, or a combination of any of these, we want to provide an environment that fosters learning and hones skills.


Classes We Provide

     At the Studio we will provide a variety of classes that range from beginner and intermediate to advanced and special-project. In addition to  offering classes  spanning from  woodworking, metalworking, pattern making, jewelry making, and forging, we want to offer rotating "boutique" classes that will specialize in a unique genre or item. For example, we are acquainted with the artist who created the Nimbus 2000 for the game of Quidditch in the Harry Potter movies; we want to offer a class where you can make your very own!


Our Gallery

     We also plan to build a beautiful gallery within our studio where students can showcase and even sell their work. We want to share local talent as well as to give each of our students the opportunity to succeed by using those talents in a real-world setting. Many of our faculty members wear two hats: they are both teachers and practicing industrial designers. We want to demonstrate that Industrial Art can be a worthwhile hobby as well as a means to make a living from your talent.

Our Passion

     One thing that we are especially passionate about is teaching  young people the wisdom of an older generation. By contributing to our campaign you will be helping to keep Industrial Art alive and well. Without early exposure to shop class many kids will fall through the cracks and miss out on the opportunity to discover that they like making things, or the inclination to pursue a career as a designer, wood worker, welder, mechanic, machinist or artist. We recognize a real need for education and exposure to Industrial Art and we want to provide a place to champion creativity and opportunity.

The Importance of Industrial Art

     "…the skilled trades are undervalued in America. They are undervalued in the American educational system that has systematically eliminated shop class. They are undervalued in the collective consciousness that views them as lowly, “blue collar”, dirty, unprofessional. But, the funny thing is that there is one place where they are actually not undervalued at all, and that is in the marketplace, which has seen a greater and greater demand for the skilled craftsman, be he a carpenter, electrician, machinist, mechanic, and so on. On account of his being in demand, the skilled tradesman has his choice of jobs, needs answer to no one, and earns a living wage, perks that are not to be scoffed at in this economic environment."

-From A Critical Review of Matthew Crawford’s Shop Class as Soulcraft

The Team

Rob Lewis began his career in the industrial arts apprenticing with his father.  After four years as a journeyman cabinet maker between 1983 and 1987 he founded Orenco Wagon Company.  Building wagons for several years brought him to a new career as a full time blacksmith with Mountain Stream Forge in 1997.  Starting as an instructor for Mount Hood Community College in 2002 teaching horse drawn vehicle constructions marks Robs entry into education.  Moving his career further in to education Rob started in 2004 as the wood studio manager and instructor at the Oregon College of Art and Craft.  Seeing a need for industrial art education for high school and college aged students Rob is creating the Industrial Artist Emporium to pass on the industrial art skills of the past to the next generation.

Gary Martin has been woodworking since he was 5 years old.  Working his way through college with woodcarving carving signs for businesses and refurbishing furniture.  Through the inspiration of a high school shop teacher Gary went into teaching industrial arts at the high school level.  After several years in the public school system getting burned out with the bureaucracy Gary decided a change was in order and he began an apprenticeship as a pattern maker at Columbia Steel Casting. Gary started his own business Martin Model and Pattern in 1990 making patterns for everything from model steam engines to gears for giant machinery. Gary’s pattern business is still going strong running out of the Village Industrial Art Studio, a training facility he co-founded with Rob Lewis, where Gary continues to teach college level woodworking and pattern making.

How Your Contribution Helps

     Your contribution will not only provide you with a discount on classes through our facility but will also help us to bring the facility up our high standards of organization, safety and fun.

  • $10,000 brings the facility to a basic level for occupancy and use.
  • $20,000 allows us to get the studio to a  basic level of organization.
  • $30,000 enables us to complete all planned improvements.
  • $50,000 begin purchasing and replacing the tools with newer equipment.
  • $75,000 begin creating mobile classrooms. (More on that later)
  • $100,000 begin renovations on a second location.


FALL CLASSES

To sign up for classes through the Industrial Artist Emporium click follow the link bellow.

Sign Up for Classes Today

After filling out the form to sign up for classes expect an email within 1-2 business days with a confirmation of registration and further instruction regarding payment.

If the class you are signing up for is full you’ll receive an email notification that you have been placed on a waiting list.

Classes held at the VIAS location are $300 a piece plus studio fees. Studio fees are $50 unless otherwise noted.

For all classes marked PCC you must sign up through PCCs webpage here.

story_txt:
There are only 2 days left for the campaign! 

Every contribution of $25 or above will receive a free $50 gift voucher! Every 3rd contribution of $275 or above will receive DOUBLE value for gift vouchers!! 




Who
We Are

     We
are Village Industrial Artist Studio (VIAS). Our goal is to provide
education and tools to people of all ages and create a "Maker
Space" for the public. When you have an idea to create something
big or small, we want to help make it happen! Weather it involves
pattern-making, wood working, machining, forging, casting, 3-D
printing and modeling, ceramics, lost wax casting, or a combination
of any of these, we want to provide an environment that fosters
learning and hones skills.

Classes
We Provide

     At
the Studio we will provide a variety of classes that range from
beginner and intermediate to advanced and special-project. In
addition to  offering classes  spanning from  woodworking,
metalworking, pattern making, jewelry making, and forging, we want to
offer rotating "boutique" classes that will specialize in a
unique genre or item. For example, we are acquainted with the artist
who created the Nimbus 2000 for the game of Quidditch in the Harry
Potter movies; we want to offer a class where you can make your very
own! 


Our
Gallery

     We
also plan to build a beautiful gallery within our studio where
students can showcase and even sell their work. We want to share
local talent as well as to give each of our students the opportunity
to succeed by using those talents in a real-world setting. Many of
our faculty members wear two hats: they are both teachers and
practicing industrial designers. We want to demonstrate that
Industrial Art can be a worthwhile hobby as well as a means to make a
living from your talent.

Our
Passion

     One
thing that we are especially passionate about is teaching  young
people the wisdom of an older generation. By contributing to our
campaign you will be helping to keep Industrial Art alive and well.
Without early exposure to shop class many kids will fall through the
cracks and miss out on the opportunity to discover that they like
making things, or the inclination to pursue a career as a designer,
wood worker, welder, mechanic, machinist or artist. We recognize a
real need for education and exposure to Industrial Art and we want to
provide a place to champion creativity and opportunity.
The
Importance of Industrial Art

     "…the
skilled trades are undervalued in America. They are undervalued in
the American educational system that has systematically eliminated
shop class. They are undervalued in the collective consciousness that
views them as lowly, “blue collar”, dirty, unprofessional. But,
the funny thing is that there is one place where they are actually
not undervalued at all, and that is in the marketplace, which has
seen a greater and greater demand for the skilled craftsman, be he a
carpenter, electrician, machinist, mechanic, and so on. On account of
his being in demand, the skilled tradesman has his choice of jobs,
needs answer to no one, and earns a living wage, perks that are not
to be scoffed at in this economic environment."

-From
A Critical Review of Matthew Crawford’s Shop Class as Soulcraft

The
TeamRob
Lewis began
his career in the industrial arts apprenticing with his father.
 After four years as a journeyman cabinet maker between 1983 and
1987 he founded Orenco Wagon Company.  Building wagons for
several years brought him to a new career as a full time blacksmith
with Mountain Stream Forge in 1997.  Starting as an instructor
for Mount Hood Community College in 2002 teaching horse drawn vehicle
constructions marks Robs entry into education.  Moving his
career further in to education Rob started in 2004 as the wood studio
manager and instructor at the Oregon College of Art and Craft.
 Seeing a need for industrial art education for high school and
college aged students Rob is creating the Industrial Artist Emporium
to pass on the industrial art skills of the past to the next
generation.Gary
Martin has
been woodworking since he was 5 years old.  Working his way
through college with woodcarving carving signs for businesses and
refurbishing furniture.  Through the inspiration of a high
school shop teacher Gary went into teaching industrial arts at the
high school level.  After several years in the public school
system getting burned out with the bureaucracy Gary decided a change
was in order and he began an apprenticeship as a pattern maker at
Columbia Steel Casting. Gary started his own business Martin Model
and Pattern in 1990 making patterns for everything from model steam
engines to gears for giant machinery. Gary’s pattern business is
still going strong running out of the Village Industrial Art Studio,
a training facility he co-founded with Rob Lewis, where Gary continues to teach college level woodworking and pattern making.How Your Contribution Helps     Your contribution will not only provide you with a discount on classes through our facility but will also help us to bring the facility up our high standards of organization, safety and fun.
$10,000 brings the facility to a basic level for occupancy and use.

$20,000 allows us to get the studio to a  basic level of organization.

$30,000 enables us to complete all planned improvements.
$50,000 begin purchasing and replacing the tools with newer equipment.
$75,000 begin creating mobile classrooms. (More on that later)
$100,000 begin renovations on a second location.

story:
About Author:

Dr. Ansir holds Ph.D. in Entrepreneurship, MBA, Babson College, USA (ranked # 1 in MBA Entrepreneurship) and BSEE, SUNY Buffalo, USA. Dr. Rajput has founded 5 ventures and assisted 100+ ventures in start up and expansion stages Bangladesh, Canada, Italy, Sri Lanka UK and USA. Dr. Rajput has 20+ years of teaching, training and coaching , consultancy experiences and has trained 10,000+ individuals and Entrepreneurs.

Introduction 

Venture Creation: Business Success Secrets Revealed is a step-by-step guide of self-discovery, building the right attitude to business world, build competences to enter, survive and excel in the world of entrepreneurship. It's also a practical book that will be utilized by anyone who wishes to be an entrepreneur.

The core theme of book is hinged to fact that entrepreneurial success is ensured if ones confidence in success is increased and fear of failure is reduced. This book uses hands-on experiential teaching techniques and interactive participation to prepare individuals for planning, opening and operating a business. Venture creation; Business Success Secrets Revealed has two major parts. In Part 1 the reader is revealed to the secrets that the biggest road block to entrepreneurial success is not lack of resources, but not having the entrepreneurial competence, the ability to locate the golden opportunity and gives one’s the tips and techniques how to build this competence. Part 2 focuses on process how to increase chances of success and shares with reader the complete guide map on how to screen, prepare feasibilities, business plan and execution plan.

Venture Creation: Business Success Secrets Revealed is a step-by-step guide of self-discovery, building the right attitude to business world, build competences to enter, survive and excel in the world of entrepreneurship. It's also a practical book that will be utilized by anyone who wishes to be an entrepreneur.

By sharing my experiences through this book, I aim to leave readers with a better understanding and a practical advice on how to create a venture.

Brief Table of Contents

    1. Author’s Profile

    2. Preface

    3. Chapter 1: World of Entrepreneurship

    4. Chapter 2: Ideas and Opportunities

    5. Chapter 3: The Creativity & Innovation Paradigm

    6. Chapter 4: Venture Creation: Step by Step

    7. Chapter 5: Stage 1-Passion

    8. Chapter 6: Stage 2- Conviction

    9. Chapter 7: Step 3 – Execution

    10. Chapter 9: Action Exercises Section

    11. Notes and Terms

    12. References

    Interview with Dr. Ansir Ali Rajput

    Why did you write the book?

    Venture Creation: Business Success Secrets Revealed is a step-by-step guide of self-discovery, building the right attitude to business world, build competences to enter, survive and excel in the world of entrepreneurship. It's also a practical book that will be utilized by anyone who wishes to be an entrepreneur.

    What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?

    The success of this campaign will allow me to publish this book in digital and print formats. Every dollar will go toward publishing expenses that include:
    • Editing
    • Proofreading
    • Cover Design
    • Interior Design
    • translation
    • Typesetting
    • Printing a modest first run
    • Distribution
    • Promotion of the book in traditional and social media

story:
Short Summary

     PeaceJam is the single greatest campaign in the world for inspiring teens to make the world a better place.  Led by a team of 13 amazing Nobel Peace Prize winners, including the Dalai Lama and Desmond Tutu, PeaceJam has not only inspired over 2 million youth service projects, it has also itself been nominated for the Peace Prize eight times. At Affiliate sites all over the world, PeaceJam continues to educate teens in classrooms and after-school programs, inspiring them to create "Global Call to Action" projects which tackle the most critical issues facing humanity today like racism, violence and environmental degradation. 
     Here's how it works: 1) students study the lives of Nobel Laureates, investigating the issues that inspired them into action, as well as the words and philosophies that guided them; 2) students then look at the Global Call to Action, the 10 global issues the PeaceJam Nobel Laureates have identified as THE key issues we need to solve as a species; students pick an issue and create a project that addresses that issue in their own community; 3) students attend an annual PeaceJam Conference, at which they get to present their project, IN PERSON, to one of the Nobel Peace Laureates who work with PeaceJam.  Powerful, inspiring, and life-changing, and teens are doing this all over the world!
     Here in Oregon, after eight years at Oregon State University in Corvallis, the Pacific Northwest Affiliate of PeaceJam is moving to Eugene as a collaboration between the LEARN Foundation and the University of Oregon.  There is already a broad network of educators and youth workers excited to participate in PeaceJam, and there is enormous potential to reach many more. 

What We Need

Drawing from a wide variety of resources, like foundation grants, private donors, and fee-for-service trainings and workshops, we are working hard to reach our total budget of $110,000 so that we can achieve the following goals:

  • Mobilize 30-40 PeaceJam groups in Oregon, Washington and Idaho, engaging between 300-400 middle and high school students in PeaceJam curriculum and service projects.
  • Train 40-50 teachers and youth workers in the region in PeaceJam curriculum.  Even if students aren't able to attend a PeaceJam Conference, there is enormous impact in getting exposed to the curriculum itself, which looks at the roots of racism, bullying, and international conflict, addressing sophisticated educational standards in innovative ways.
  • Host a two-day PeaceJam Conference at the U of O this May.

What Your Donations Do:

$2500 donors:  become Guest Hosts, with the opportunity to attend an informal lunch with our world-changing key-note speaker before the Conference; *NOTE: this May, because it is the first year of our Affiliate, we will not be hosting a Nobel Laureate, but rather another amazing and inspiring peace hero as a keynote, to be announced in March.

$900 donors:  become PeaceJam group sponsors, providing training and curriculum for two teachers and Conference fees to 5 students.  You'll be in touch with the teachers and students you supported and receive stories of their work.

$100 donors:  become PeaceJammer patrons, sponsoring one teenager to attend the annual Conference.

$50 donors:  provide a PeaceJam Leaders Journal to a middle-school student in need.

Because our Northwest Affiliate is housed by LEARN Foundation, a 501c3 nonprofit organization, donations are tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

The Impact

Our Leadership Team here in Eugene is very excited about the emerging possibilities of our partnership with the U of O.  We're working with departments and student organizations at the University to pair college mentors with teens: we're working towardt ways to create online PeaceJam classes for high school students to receive college credit; we're working with school districts to focus their community service requirements into more profound and globally-engaged action.  And on an international scale, PeaceJam has recently partnered with Google in the 1 Billion Acts of Peace Campaign.  See http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTqL0zgADhbVJ5HFFyhwXfA for more.

There is truly no way to quantify the impact that PeaceJam has on the young people who participate in it, but here is some evidence of what this program has already done.
  • Over ONE MILLION young people have already participated in PeaceJam.
  • Those participants have created over TWO MILLION acts of peaceful service to address the world's issues.
  • Evaluations of PeaceJam curriculum show that students who participate are 45% more likely to go on to college, and go far more focused on what they want to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to contribute to PeaceJam Northwest financially, we are always in need of volunteers.  Here are some other things you can do to pitch in:
  • talk to people you know about PeaceJam and direct them to us
  • talk to a teacher or youth program director you know about PeaceJam and how amazing it is
  • find a PeaceJam group in your area and help them with their service project (remember to check in with schools and group leaders on background check requirements)
  • organize an Act of Peace on your own and register it on the 1 Billion Acts of Peace home page: http://onebillionactsofpeace.com

story:
Hi there!  My name is Miranda and I am a math teacher at Woodridge High School in Peninsula, Ohio.  I have been teaching for eight years.  I have a Bachelors degree in Finance and Accounting and a Masters in Curriculum and Instruction.  Teaching is my passion and I enjoy opening my students’ eyes to the wonders of mathematics.

Recently, Ohio has changed its graduation requirements to include Algebra 2.  This course requires a TI-84 Graphing Calculator.  Many of my students are unable to afford this piece of technology, 57% of them actually.  I often call this calculator a lifeline because it is so extremely important to the understanding of Algebra 2 concepts.  I am advocating for these kids so they can get an advantage where one might not otherwise exist.   Imagine trying to type an email without a computer, hammering in nails without a hammer, or mowing ten acres of grass with a push mower. 

If you contribute, you will be affecting the lives of high school students for years to come.  I will continue to use these calculators like a textbook, collecting at the end of each year, and allowing upcoming students to benefit from your contribution.  Students will get higher GPAs, higher ACT scores, get into great colleges and become outstanding members of society. 

I need $10,000 to buy enough graphing calculators for my students.  Kids are our future and I just want to help them get that chance to make the most of theirs by showing them that math can be easy and fun with technology.  Every $100 will buy one graphing calculator. 

Every year the state asks us, as teachers, to do more with less.  Common Core Standards and requirements have made teaching a challenge.  Having this tool for my students will allow me to get through more concepts and the students will gain a deeper understanding of math.

Help me show students that math opens doors!  The higher a student goes in math the more money they will make over their lifetime.  Math is powerful and I am the facilitator that can show them the way!

a TI-84 Graphing Calculator.  Many of my
students are unable to afford this piece of technology, 57% of them actually.  I often call this calculator a lifeline
because it is so extremely important to the understanding of Algebra 2
concepts.  I am advocating for these kids
so they can get an advantage where one might not otherwise exist.   Imagine trying to type an email without a computer, hammering in nails without a hammer, or mowing ten acres of grass with a push mower.  
If you contribute, you will be affecting the lives of high
school students for years to come.  I
will continue to use these calculators like a textbook, collecting at the end
of each year, and allowing upcoming students to benefit from your contribution.  Students will get higher GPAs, higher ACT
scores, get into great colleges and become outstanding members of society.  
I need $10,000 to buy enough graphing calculators for my
students.  Kids are our future and I just
want to help them get that chance to make the most of theirs by showing them
that math can be easy and fun with technology. 
Every $100 will buy one graphing calculator.  
Every year the state asks us, as teachers, to do more with less.  Common Core Standards and requirements have made
teaching a challenge.  Having this tool
for my students will allow me to get through more concepts and the students
will gain a deeper understanding of math.
Help me show students that math opens doors!  The higher a student goes in math the more
money they will make over their lifetime. 
Math is powerful and I am the facilitator that can show them the way!

story:
Dear Friends, 

I can't fully explain in words why I feel so compelled to do this. It's like we all start out charting this map of the world, placing key coordinates on it, and strategizing how we will move from point to point. Meanwhile, we're prepping for this journey and Chance drops its coins, points, and shouts, "Bang!" We stop our pen scratching, set our maps aside and lo and behold, there is a whole other world happening! It's scary and it's liberating and it's maddening at times, but it's LIFE and it's the natural rhythm and we gotta serve it right. 

I love babies. They are the real revolutionaries of this world. And let's not forget the wonder of mothers, fathers, family units. We've evolved as a species because of this elaborate bond pairing! It's one of the most powerful relationships in existence, the building blocks of life, and yet quickly dismissed in our modern pursuit of progress and individualism. 

Families are the most sustainable structures we have. We gotta trust this. Birth is the fundamental creative act. Together let's respect this.

For me, to be a doula means to serve and witness the birth experience in its rawest form. It means to dwell in the house of creativity and to support the infrastructure of love and sustainability. 

This September, I will be participating in a week-long doula certification program. Basically, I'll be training to provide a full spectrum of care for new families--from offering emotional support, preparing mothers for their birth through visual arts, and cooking for mothers post-birth to keep their hormones and bodies happy. While the cost is relatively small, I am in need of any help I can get! Don't forget, I've got some fun perks for your gracious support :)

story:
The Campaign

          We are Novancia Business School students in Paris, France. Our program as a Master's of International Business Developing & Consulting, consisting of a group of 15 awesome international students from 12 diverse countries, ranging from Egypt to Belgium. We joined a meeting group of Parisian students from Novancia which functions to promote social interaction between new international students and the existing local student body. So far we have thoroughly enjoyed our experiences with the group, from social gatherings, to information sessions, to tours of Paris. As a result, we would like to give back to the organization so that it continues to exist for future international students who will follow in our footsteps. Please help us reach our goal so that we can provide the platform for friendships and fun times in the future!

Nous sommes des étudiants internationaux de Novancia Business School Paris, affiliée à la Chambre de Commerce et de l’Industrie de Paris.

Nous faisons parti d’un programme de Master en Business Developement, qui est composé de 15 étudiants internationaux provenant de 12 pays différents, de l’Egypte jusqu’à la Belgique, en passant par la Canada.

Nous avons à notre arrivée dans l’ecole, intégré un groupe de rencontre constitué d’étudiants parisiens de Novancia dont la mission est de favoriser notre integration dans l’école.

Nous avons particulièrement apprécié l’éxperience vécu avec ce groupe à travers les différentes rencontres organisées, les réunions d’informations, ainsi que les visites de la ville de Paris.

Par conséquent, nous voudrions apporter notre aide à cette organisation pour lui permettre de continuer à éxister et pour qu’elle aide les futurs étudiants internationaux à s’intégrer comme elle nous a permis de le faire.

Pour cela, aidez-nous à atteindre notre objectif  afin que l’association perdure dans l’amitié et la bonne humeur.



The Impact

           To understand why you should fund our project, it is important to understand who we are and what the organization Meeting Potes means to us.

Enchanté!

My name is Cédric Verfaillie, I was born in Belgium and I am currently studying in the MSc International Business Development & Consulting program at Novancia Business School in Paris. Meeting Potes has been a very helpful organization to smoothen my adjustment process here in Paris by giving guided tours, organizing wine and cheese evenings in local bars and even assiging me a personal buddy from the organization. As a sign of gratitude, I would like to offer Meeting Potes extra resources so they can keep up their good work in the future.

Salut tout le monde, heureux de vous rencontrer ! 

Mon nom est Cédric Verfaillie, je suis né en Belgique et je suis actuellement en MSc International Business Development & Consulting à Novancia Business School à Paris. Meeting Potes a été une association très serviable qui m’a aidé à m’intégrer ici, à Paris, en nous faisant visiter la ville, en organisant des soirées dans des bars et aussi en m’attribuant un partenaire faisant parti de l’association. En signe de gratitude, je voudrais offrir à Meeting Potes des ressources supplémentaires pour qu’ils puissent continuer leur bon travail les années à venir.

Bonjour!

My name is Jordan Barrett and I am an American student currently studying in the MSc International Business Development & Consulting program at Novancia Business School in Paris. My personal motives to give back to this great student-led organization is the fact that they introduced me to this great international network of foreign and domestic students.  Without Meeting Potes, it would have taken me significantly longer to meet all these diverse people. Therefore, I would like to return the favor by raising money for Meeting Potes so they can help future foreign students just as they have helped me.

Salut !

Mon nom est Jordan Barret et je suis un étudiant Américain qui étudie en ce moment en MSc International Business Development & Consulting à Novancia Business School à Paris. Je voudrais remercier cette superbe association d’étudiant qui m’a présenté à des étudiants locaux et internationaux. Sans Meeting Potes, j’aurais certainement mis beaucoup plus de temps à faire leurs connaissances. De ce fait, je souhaiterais verser une somme d’argent à Meeting Potes en guise de remerciement, pour qu’ils puissent aider les prochains étudiants internationaux comme ilsm’ont aidé.


Salut!

My name is Moataz El Shewikh, born in Egypt and currently studying in the MSc International Business Development program at Novancia Business School in Paris. When I arrived in Paris, it is needless to say that I experienced significant cultural differences. A different language, cultural norms and rules, and interesting new ways of thinking. Meeting Potes has been a great help to me since they have provide a notable array of services that have helped me to adjust to the Parisian culture. As my way of saying thank you, I would like to reward Meeting Potes by raising additional resources so they experience my appreciation and continue to be motivated to carry on their remarkable organization.

Salut !

Je m’appelle Moataz El Shewikh, je suis né en Egypte et je suis actuellement en MSc International Business Development à Novancia Business School Paris. Lorsque je suis arrivé à Paris, il est inutile de préciser que j'ai ressenti des différences culturelles significatives. Une langue, des normes culturelles ainsi que des règles différentes et de nouvelles façons de penser intéressantes. Meeting Potes a été d’une immense aide pour moi en me rendant des services, et en m’aidant à m’intégrer à la culture Parisienne. En guise de remerciement, je souhaiterai verser à Meeting Potes des aides financières pour qu’ils puissent continuer cette remarquable association.




What We Need & What You Get

               We need you to contribute in any way you can! Small donations are appreciated, and with larger donations come tangible rewards to help you remember your donation to the organization. The funds will go towards establishing the first ever Meeting Potes treasury. This fund will help the leaders of the organization continue to provide fun and interactive events on a regular basis for new students to meet current students, and build friendships and relationships! Our goal is only 500€ because we want this to be a manageable project that every person can say that they had a significant impact on when they donated. We hope to crush our 500€ goal, thereby providing the Meeting Potes family with as much funding as possible, allowing for new opportunities for those who participate and interact with the organization. Help us make this an annual tradition that will help to ensure the continuity of the organization for future students studying abroad for extending time periods.

Here are some of the recent activities that Meeting Potes has organized:

Afterwork wine tasting: learn about different types of wine and try some!

End of week get together along the river Seine!

Valentine's Day Get-Together "Afterwork"

'We Loft You' Student Party


Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • We ask you to spread the word about our project and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, in addition to sharing our project link with your social networks on FaceBook, Twitter or through your email!

Thank you for your time and help!

story:
Thank you for visiting my page! Later this summer I will be going to multiple cities in Spain for a little over two weeks on a study abroad trip with a small group of students. There we will be exploring the urban environment in multiple cities. This trip is put on by the School of Architecture at Portland State University, and is a 6 credit course which will help me progress though my architecture eduction in multiple ways. 

First and for most it will inform my future designs and understanding of architecture and built environment by expanding my knowledge and views.  Secondly, since we are only there for two weeks we will be recording everything through drawing, which will greatly expand my skills on how to communicate graphically which is a necessary skill set to have to have in Architecture. 

Although this trip counts as credit for my bachelors of science which i will complete next spring (2015) the tuition and fess for abroad study is very expensive, and is almost entirely out of pocket. 

Therefor ANY donation no matter the size to help my cause and send me to Spain will be greatly appreciated. 

Large donations will have the option to receive (if wanted) a photo print or drawing of the amazing architecture we encounter in Spain.  


Below is a link for more information on the program and a video describing a past trip.

http://stage.pdx.edu/the-arts/study-abroad


Also here is a link to my website portfolio which displays some of my more recent work produced through out my studies. 

www.chase-ashley.squarespace.com

Thank you for you time

-Chase

story:
This summer, STAR Education and Project STEPS will expand the mathematical minds of 100 low-income 9th graders with our 3-week CSI: SFV CAMP conducted at California State University Northridge (CSUN).

Our intensive camp experience introduces students to the real-world excitement of science, technology, engineering, and math. Students will conduct DNA experiments, explore crime scenes, use algebra to investigate footprints and heights, dust for fingerprints, and finally solve their own murder mystery. Our goal is to not only have fun, but to also expose students to higher levels of math and science that might encourage future careers as well as college educations.

Students from 4 middle schools in the San Fernando Valley are already partially funded through a Gear Up grant, which aims to raise college attendance among low-income students. However, these funds cover only a fraction of the entire camp cost.

The most important aspect of this camp is the capstone event where students will use math and science to solve a murder mystery brunch at Saddle Ranch Restaurant in Universal City Walk, giving the students an even closer look at how their new skills apply to the real world. We've recruited CSI actors and forensic experts to lead this exciting event, but we currently do not have funding to cover all 100 students attending this field trip.

Your gift will help bring math and science to these students with a hands-on, real-world experience while also giving them a positive, summer camp adventure with their classmates and teachers.

Here’s what your gift can do…

$25  Support one student's trip to CSI Murder Mystery Brunch, including transportation and unlimited food and drink
$50  Cover the cost of two students to attend the CSI Murder Mystery Lunch
$100  Purchase curriculum / materials for the CSI Murder Mystery Lunch

$500  Sponsor an entire camp team for one school

$1500  Be the sole sponsor for the event.  We will make a banner that says "Sponsored by X" and make sure your name or company is mentioned throughout the Murder Mystery!


We believe this real-world experience is ESSENTIAL to students connecting with the math and science they've learned at camp as they learn to apply it outside the classroom. We hope they will leave inspired not only about going to college, but also eager to explore the many interesting careers available in math, science and related fields.

For as little as $25, you can give one of these students a learning experience they will never forget. You can also make a difference by sharing this campaign on your Facebook or emailing it to interested friends and family. Thank you for partnering with us! All donations are tax deductible.

(Any funds that exceed our goal will go into our STAR Fund, providing scholarship for other STAR Programs serving low-income and Title One students.  If we do not meet our goal, all funds will go towards the CSI Murder Mystery Lunch.)

Thank you to everyone who donated to last year's Roller Coaster Mania campaign.  These are the same core group of students who you supported last July.

 

About STAR Education…

STAR Education has spent the last 25 years helping to raise test scores and improve communities through outstanding after-school programs at some of our most challenged public schools in Southern California. We reach over 1 million students and families in Southern California every year with our programs. We also host the nation's only wildlife and exotic animal rescue facility in our Culver City Eco Station. www.starinc.org


Don't forget to click "Share!"
