story:
Who We Are

Auburn University Students for Life is the pro-life and human rights organization on Auburn's campus. We strive to make campus friendly to mothers and help those in need around Auburn and Opelika. We do so by:

  • Running diaper drives to raise money to buy supplies for women's shelters.
  • Assist in any capacity with the founding of a non-profit home for student mothers.
  • Spread information about resources for those with an unexpected pregnancy.
  • Create a positive and pro-woman environment at Auburn University.

What We Need & What You Get

While we stay active on Auburn's campus, we're raising money to attend the March For Life in Washington D.C. This is what your donations will go to:

  • We are raising money to bring 50 students from Auburn University and the University of Alabama at Birmingham to Washington D.C. We are planning on flying from Atlanta on January 20, 2014 and returning on Jan. 22, immediately following the March for Life. While in D.C., we will attend the annual Students for Life of America Conference, take part in the March for Life and possibly other related events.
  • Helping AUSFL does more than make you feel warm and fuzzy inside - we will give  signed cards with pictures of all participants at the march to all donors, club sweatshirts to those who donate over $75, and we will put the names of donors of more than $150 on the back of the club sweatshirts.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will still put the money towards the trip. However, not reaching our goal will mean students will have to pay nearly $300 to attend the trip, and the number of those going will significantly decrease.

The Impact

Attending the March for Life will do more than give these college students a trip to the capital. These are other benefits from our pilgrimage

  • Students who attend the annual SFL conference and march for life will meet pro-life people their age from around the country - a rarity for our movement
  • Attending the March for Life and SFL conference is an amazing opportunity for students to stand up for what they believe in.
  • This trip isn't a vacation - it's educational. We become inspired and get new ideas on how to bring the pro-life mission home.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't contribute financially, you can still help us reach our goal:

  • Share our link on your facebook, twitter, blog, emails - anywhere people will see it.
  • Like us on Facebook, and tell others to as well!
  • All positive thoughts, prayers, juju and fingers crossed are greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Kimberly Gayle I am a sophmore at The Baldwin Wallace University.

I've been granted the opportunity to study abroad in Northern Ireland and Cape Town South Africa. This opportunity is so important to me because I believe it is only Gods intention for me and my fellow peers to spread the gospel and lift up the name of Jesus to young people just like me.

Your contribution will make it possible for me to procalim Jesus to the youth in Ireland and Capetown South Africa. In simple terms you are allowing me to be a blessing to a group of young people who dont know the Lord.

What We Need & What You Get

This trip is a total of 3,000 dollars which includes my flight, room, and board. I will be traveling for a total of nine weeks. This money will cover all of the monitary necessities that the trip requires.

All funds reached under 3,000 will go to my missions trip and anything raised over the goal will go toward Youth Excellence Performing Arts Workshop. (www.yepaw.org)

The Impact

Your contribution is way more than a financial value, but your contribution we help me as a believer of Christ obey what God has asked of his people. God's love wasn't meant to keep hostage but to spread freely so that all may hear and believe the gospel of Jesus Christ. With that being said it's not enough for me to honor God wihtin the four walls of the sanctuary but to reach those outside the church who may not have the things that I take for granted.

The desire to reach to young people and be a positive example to youth has always been a passion of mine. I've worked with YEPAW for as long as I've been alive. I strive to live my life as an example to those who look up to me. I live to be Christ-like so I have a heart for people and making the Name of Jesus shine before myself.

story: Sarina attended Berklee College of Music 5 week Camp last year and needs your support to go again this year.  Berklee has a reputation of offering students a rich diversity of music, the best programs, and awesome career possibilities.  Sarina can now add that they also have great instructors that are passionate about teaching.

story:
Dear Friends~

The Pioneer Project is a program designed for students who want to spend a semester immersed in homesteading, traditional crafts, and wilderness adventure.  It is designed for purpose-seeking students who'd like to become active community members and empowered self-starters.  It is designed to remind people of the deep confidence that grows from a foundation of self sufficiency; the deep inner and outer awareness that stems from a connection to the natural world; and the fulfillment that comes from the patient creation of crafts with one's own hands.  It is an experimental mixture of progressive education, eastern philosophy, back-to-the-land idealism, fine craft, and outdoor adventure.  It is intent on spurring growth and transformation in each student, and by extension, contributing to a more sustainable, aware, and enthusiastic society.  It is our 10-year dream that has been evolving and coming into focus (Read more at our website).

Our dream is well on its way to manifesting.  We have students enrolled, a campus to host them, and a wonderful crafting community to introduce them to - not to mention some fine wilderness right at our doorstep.  Indeed, the stars are aligning here in this enchanted valley in Brasstown, North Carolina to make our dreams a reality.

We are two months away from its launch in September 2013.  Whoa!  We have spent much of the last 10 years preparing for this moment in direct and indirect ways.  As a couple, we have worked and volunteered with more than 15 educational organizations and are intent on applying our experience to create a powerful program (read our bios here).  This project will be the culmination of hundreds of hours of dreaming, planning, recruiting, studying, and believing in dreams coming true. The Pioneer Project is woven from our inner fibers that emerges from the intersection of what we love to do and how we believe we can contribute to a better society.  It is at that intersection that the magic seems to happen - where the universe conspires on your behalf so that you may find support to fulfill your purpose.  We are seeking that support here on Indiegogo. 

What We Need

So what do we want from you?  Well, we are seeking funds to purchase a small inventory of outdoor equipment to outfit our wilderness expeditions.  The wilderness component of our program is integral to helping our students forge a deep connection to the natural world, reflect on their purpose, learn to live simply, conquer challenges as a team and push their comfort zones.  It is also the component with very high startup costs, which is why we'd love your help!  Below is our list of items needed and price estimates from various gear shops. 

Our list + costs

$3000

 - Three expedition worthy canoes

$400

 - Dry bags + boxes for student gear

$420

 - Six life jackets

$120

 - Six paddles

$240

 - Six whitewater helmets

$40

 - Five gallon buckets for canoe expeditions

$60

 - Water jugs

$1800

 - Four mountain bikes

$200

 - Five bike helmets

$300

 - Two climbing ropes

$300

 - Five climbing harnesses

$200

 - Carabiners, and other climbing gear

$120

 - Tarps for backpacking expeditions

$50

 - Camp stoves

$60

 - Large water filters

$30

 - Pot set for cooking

$40

 - Four fuel bottles

$400

 - Miscellaneous outdoor clothing from thrift shops

$500

 - Four 15 degree sleeping bags

Grand total = $8,280

A note on our funding goal

Although our grand total is $8,280,we recognize it is a lot! So, we have set a lower, more realistic goal of $3500. This will still allow us to purchase priority items first (camping gear), then paddling gear, then climbing gear, so that we can establish a full inventory of one department at a time. This will allow less reliance on outfitters all around.

We are also keeping the campaign goal low because Indiegogo takes a higher cut if the goal is not reached.  So despite setting a lower goal, we would still love to raise the grand total if we're able to!

What's in it for you?  Our PERKS!

See our Gallery page for photos of some of our perks!  We are highlighting a collection of some of the practical things that we make here at the homestead with our students.  Enjoy nourishing your body with homemade soaps, salves, tinctures, and other herbal products made by Allison!  You may also opt for some promo T-shirts or mugs - or even a hand knit hat.

We're also including some of the bigger, more adventurous endeavours we offer, so you can get a taste of what the region offers and how we use it to help our students reach their fullest potential.  You, too, can feel the excitement of embarking on an adventure you might not have thought you'd do and feel the sense of accomplishment after putting in a couple miles on a mountain trail to take in amazing views, or from a day of paddling and facing your fear about white water.  Alternatively, you can take in the peacefulness of the humble homestead as you learn a craft and enjoy a home-cooked meal. 

Redeeming these perks can happen within a one year period.  We have a busy Fall ahead, so it may be Spring before we can redeem.

Low on Cash, but Still Wanna Help?

If your happen to have any of these items and would like to donate them, that would be great too!  Contact us here to arrange that.  You can also share this campaign with others and tell people about us.  You can like us on Facebook here and send people to our website.  Please refer students to us who you think would benefit from our program!

Your donation is an investment in a project that is devoted to helping create a more sustainable, empowered, and purpose-driven society through our programming.  We thank you wholeheatedly and appreciate your generosity.

Sincerely,

Adam and Allison Haigler
Co-founders of the Pioneer Project
story_txt:
Dear Friends~
The Pioneer Project is a program designed for students who want to spend a semester immersed in homesteading, traditional crafts, and wilderness adventure.  It is designed for purpose-seeking students who'd like to become active community members and empowered self-starters.  It is designed to remind people of the deep confidence that grows from a foundation of self sufficiency; the deep inner and outer awareness that stems from a connection to the natural world; and the fulfillment that comes from the patient creation of crafts with one's own hands.  It is an experimental mixture of progressive education, eastern philosophy, back-to-the-land idealism, fine craft, and outdoor adventure.  It is intent on spurring growth and transformation in each student, and by extension, contributing to a more sustainable, aware, and enthusiastic society.  It is our 10-year dream that has been evolving and coming into focus (Read more at our website).
Our dream is well on its way to manifesting.  We have students enrolled, a campus to host them, and a wonderful crafting community to introduce them to - not to mention some fine wilderness right at our doorstep.  Indeed, the stars are aligning here in this enchanted valley in Brasstown, North Carolina to make our dreams a reality.

story:
Short Summary

While the Indiegogo campaign has closed, donations can still be made via the Hilgos Foundation website:  www.hilgos.org 

Thanks for your support.

We need your help! Over 5 million Americans currently have Alzheimer's and that number is expected to TRIPLE by 2050. It affects everyone it touches, not only those diagnosed, but also the friends and family around them. And, unfortunately there is currently no cure.

As the toll rises, and as researchers continue to search for ways to cure or prevent it, we want to do everything possible to help those who are ALREADY LIVING WITH ALZHEIMER'S–and their caregivers– to improve the quality of their lives. That is why we have developed a plan to distribute the film “I Remember Better When I Paint” on a broad nationwide basis. For the film is not just another story; it is a powerful case study, showing how life can take on new meanings despite the impact of memory impairment.

“I Remember Better When I Paint” was inspired by the true life stories of people who experienced the renewing power of creative engagement.  One such person was the artist Hilgos, who, after being afflicted, became very reclusive, withdrawing from almost all social interactions. As the disease took hold, it became increasingly difficult to connect with Hilgos, even for her own daughter, the film’s co-director.

But, this is a heartwarming story, as her daughter was able to see a pathway to connect with her mother again. On one particular visit, she was having a very difficult time communicating with her mother. In an effort to find anything that would reach her, she asked: “Mother, do you want to paint?” And, to her amazement, Hilgos responded, “Yes, I Remember Better When I Paint.” These words were the catalyst for the film and book of the same name.

The film takes us through her journey as she picks up a brush, begins to paint again—and recovers a sense of identity and fulfillment.

I Remember Better When I Paint, narrated by Olivia de Havilland, is the first international documentary about the positive impact of art and other creative therapies on people and how these approaches can change the way we look at Alzheimer's. Among those who are featured are noted doctors and Yasmin Aga Khan, president of Alzheimer’s Disease International and daughter of Rita Hayworth, who had Alzheimer’s and also painted.

We have shared the film through community screenings at the Metropolitan Museum in New York, The School of the Art Institute of Chicago, The Phillips Collection in Washington, DC, medical schools and in foreign venues from Paris to Dublin to Hong Kong. The film has also been broadcast on television in local markets including New York City, Chicago, and Washington, DC. "It changes the way people look at Alzheimer's," says Marc Wortmann, CEO of Alzheimer's Disease International. The film "shows a new pathway for engaging with a loved one you thought was lost..." comments Gail Sheehy, renowned author and journalist. Yes, the feedback has been wonderful. But we feel we have only scratched the surface - and that an enormous potential audience can be reached through a concerted effort to bring the film to a nationwide television audience.

What We Need

Our Goal: $25,000 will help to air the film on nationwide television. We have been assured that sponsorship and the broadcast will take the film into hundreds of thousands of households all across the country. With your help we can now bring the film to a national audience.

Your contribution to the Hilgos Foundation will also help support more art students in its intergenerational scholarship program - each one of whom will have designed a project reaching out to help people with memory impairment.

If you are a United States tax payer, your contribution will be tax-deductible and a tax receipt will be sent.

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you unable to help financially, you can still help us in our mission to spread this information to as many people as possible. Please share our website with your friends, family, and co-workers. Help us reach the millions of Americans affected by this disease to know that they are not alone.

https://twitter.com/IRememberBetter

story:
So what is all of this?

First off; HELLO, I AM GRIMALKIN. From the Atheism+ forums. I am going to Skepticon 6- a huge and awesome Skeptical/Atheist convetion- but there is a problem; Not absolutely everyone in the forums (and the rest of A+...) gets to go to Skepticon because, while Skepticon is free, planes and hotels and all of that is not. This simply will not do. I would fix it, but I don't have unlimited money. However, my sources tell me that YOU, internet, do have unlimited money somehow. Or perhaps a finite amount of money but a little bit to spare. Would you perhaps give a little so we can have travel and hotel grants for A+ people who want to go but can't because of money?

What we need:

While it changes from place to place, a safe number for what it costs to get to Skepticon from within the continental US is around $700, for a roughly $300 flight and a 4 night stay at the reduced hotel rate. While we'll give each grant receiver exactly what they need, $700 is our base goal to fund at least one generic person (but hopefully we go over!). We will ensure that the money is used properly, either through buying the tickets/booking rooms on their behalf, or better solutions should they arise.

Of course, there's always the sad chance that we don't hit our goal... or the chance that we hit out goal SO WELL that we have more money than we need to fund people. In both of those scenarios, the money will be donated to Skepticon.

What's in it for you? 

Besides the knowledge that you made an already awesome convention that much more awesome, we also have perks courtesy of our more creative A+ members. They're varied, some are cool, and some are silly (most of mine are silly) but hopefully they sweeten the deal a little.

So you have no money to give:

that's okay! Do you have a rich friend? Tell them about this! Tell everyone about this! Share on facebook and twitter and let all your friends know "HEY, this sounds like an awesome thing, but I can't contribute. Will you contribute for me?"

Alternately, are you crafty/creative/otherwise able to make neat things? Get in touch with me and I'll see about having something you make be a perk for donating!

I want to submit a grant request/I want to see the grant requests!

Go here! http://aplusskepticon.tumblr.com/ You can browse through the current submissions and submit your own request as well.

Some more info for you all:

Wondering where to see examples of Elizabeth Connal's work? It's right here:

http://elizabethconall.dreamwidth.org/2037/01/01/published-works-and-works-in-progress-masterlist.html

Wondering where to see examples of EllieMurasaki's work?

Here are tie-tacks:

http://i.imgur.com/B5FtgcA.jpg

And dangly earrings:

http://www.etsy.com/shop/sunbowgems

So you want to actually get your perks:

Make sure that you leave a comment with the specifications of what you want for your perk when you donate. Otherwise I have to email you- which works, but not quite as well as seeing the comment associated with your name, and being able to get started immediately. That said, if for some reason you want to put off deciding what you want in particular, you can always comment later.

story:
Short Summary

Burning Books is an independent bookstore in Buffalo, NY. We are organizing an event dealing with sexual assault and rape within the U.S. military and we need help with funding.
 
On October 18th, we will be welcoming author Helen Benedict. She will be discussing her book "The Lonely Soldier: The Private War of Women Serving in Iraq" which vividly tells the stories of five women who fought in Iraq between 2003 and 2006 - and of the challenges they faced while fighting a war painfully alone. She will also be talking about her new novel "Sand Queen," which is culled from real life stories of female soldiers and Iraqis, and offers a story from the rare perspective of two young women on opposite sides of a war. These two books as well as some of Helen's other writings were the inspriation for the new, award-winning documentary "The Invisible War," which tackles the issues of sexual assault and rape in the U.S. military head on. Ours will be the first local screening of the film. Helen will be speaking before the film and answering questions afterwards.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to pay $108.00 in Licensing fees for "The Invisible War".
 
We've already raised enough money to cover travel and hotel costs for Helen, but we need to raise an additional $500 for a speaker fee.
 
The money raised goes directly to funding this event. It promises to be a very powerful evening and we need help from you to bring it to our community.
 

The Impact

A few months ago, a young female veteran came into our bookstore and shared with me her experiences of sexual assault from within the U.S. military while serving in Iraq. The devastating effects of those experiences, which she continues to deal with on a day to day basis, is the inspiration behind this event.

I told her I would try and make it happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out. If you'd like to support us in any other way, please contact theresa@burningbooksbuffalo.com
 
Thanks! Hope to see you there!
Theresa

story:
My name is Roberto Lara and my sister Janessa and my nieces Nina (6yrs old) and Iliany (4) have gone through sad and traumatic past week.

On August 11 2012 my sister found out that her boyfriend of 2 yrs had sexually assaulted my oldest niece Nina. This took a toll on my sister that had to be hospitalized for 3 days not to mention the traumatic experience for both Nina and Iliany. He was arrested and currently is awaiting sentencing after pleading guilty. You can check his status and information in this link. http://www2.cookcountysheriff.org/search2/details.asp?jailnumber=2012-0812078

My sister Janessa has lost financial support from her boyfriend and needs your help while she gets through this horrible time. There is only so much the goverment can help with including myself with my current pay, she needs to make ends meet.

Your donation will go towards helping her buy school supplies for my nieces, pay for public transportation, babysitter, school uniforms, rent, shoes and to pay other encessial necessities until she is able to find a job and try to get to normal life for her and her children.

 

Please help them any donation will help tremendously!

 

My sister Janessa, Nina, Iliany and myself would like to thank you for your support.

story:
My Inspiration & Aspiration

Hi, my name is Jason He, a typical Asian guy. Albeit a generalization, it pretty much boils down to the fact that I follow instructions well. Life to date for me can be simply condensed into uncomplicated stages: I immigrated to the US as a kid, studied hard in school, attended a good liberal arts college on a full-tuition scholarship, then studied some more. After graduation, I followed an equally standard career track - first in consulting, then banking, and finally at a hedge fund. Yet gradually, I woke up to the realization that life has got to be more than following everyone else’s expectations. I’d never taken a stand on anything. Do I have what it takes to stand on my own two feet? Can I create something? But what?

     

The answer to what I was looking for came shortly after my son was born. Reflecting on my own path, the one thing that stood out was the power of language. This power shaped my surroundings and made me the person I am today. So naturally I wanted my son to learn his mother tongue, Mandarin Chinese. After sifting through a slew of antiquated learning materials and worst of all, gimmicks, I was disappointed, but excited. I was excited that there may be something I could do to make a difference.

I began reading anything and everything I could find on Chinese and language learning. The deeper I dug, the clearer it became that this sleepy field needs a serious makeover. Having worked in stressful industries, I am a firm believer of productivity hacking – exploiting ways to achieve more with less. The more I dissembled and understood the inner workings of Chinese, the more I realized that simply by adopting a rational and sensible learning approach and marrying the principles of time management with cognitive best practices, it was entirely possible to anyone to GET this seemingly difficult language. Little by little, I pieced together the framework for a holistic approach to hacking Chinese. After speaking and confirming with friends and language enthusiasts, I knew I had something of value.  It’s a road not taken, but one thing I was certain was that it would be a shorter path.

  

Just An Average Guy Who Refuses to Believe in the Status Quo

I'm not a linguist. And initially my knowledge of Chinese was only confined to having grown up with the language. But for what I'm not, I make it up for being a pragmatist with a passion for pushing boundaries. My time spent following polymaths and my training in finance have taught me one thing, and that is to really get something, question everything and be sensible. Applied to learning, this means investing effort to master the principles and drivers which in turn generate the greatest return. Unfortunately, much of the existing materials direct a learner’s efforts on acquiring the what (typically through sheer rote memorization), without realizing that the what is simply a byproduct of the how. A learner not taught the how and cannot see the big picture is like a traveler who has lost sight. In the journey to conquer a new language, what are the chances for the blind person to successfully make it across to the other side? Fortunately, there are sound principles that anyone can follow. I highlight four below that are cornerstones of Serika. These guiding stars can give "sight" to the learner so he/she is able to confidently walk the shortest path to the destination:

Deconstruction – dissemble Chinese into its core functional parts, then trim every part to its essence and eliminate anything that adds unnecessary complexity. Learn only what you will use. Unfortunately, this deconstruction process is missing in many of the existing materials which indiscriminately overload one with aspects of the language without giving consideration to its utility. Learning tones in Chinese is very important, but learning marking rules for tones returns zero practical value. Likewise, learning Pinyin facilitates character acquisition but memorizing obscure Pinyin rules does not. Similarly, character acquisition should focus on achieving comprehension, not in reproducing characters by hand (at least not initially), which unnecessarily taxes one’s mental capacity that can be better used for acquiring a larger vocabulary bank to aid in conversational fluency. In short, unselective learning curricula dilute a learner’s ROI on time and money invested and at worst can outright take a learner down the wrong path.

Controlled Sequencing - purposely prioritize the core material in an optimal sequence to facilitate learning in a natural, sensible order.  Chinese is a tonal language, which is often challenging for first-time learners. As a result, tone should be the first point of contact in learning Chinese. Grammar on the other hand, is the natural flow of the language. Therefore, it should never be memorized but rather exposed in its natural setting only when one has reached the stage of sentence production. In addition, Chinese grammar is relatively simple in construct (e.g. lack of inflections, Subject-Verb-Object sentence structure) but is complicated by nuances in word order, aspects, etc. A learner under traditional methodologies would spend considerable time memorizing the various nuances in Chinese grammar without regard for practical ROI. The more effective order of learning grammar should be tiered on its utility insofar as facilitating sentence production. Exposure to the more nuanced grammar topics should be held back and released purposely after one is comfortable in handling the most frequent conversational topics. Sequencing learning curricula this way ensures that 1). The learner gains progression naturally in pace with his or her’s overall capabilities, and 2). complexities do not prematurely distract a learner’s attention from acquiring skills of immediate utility.

Power Functional Characters – stacking is a powerful linguistic mechanism in Chinese that aids in the formation of characters and words in an intuitive manner.  A learner can achieve the greatest results by focusing effort to learn how this formation mechanism works and also by learning the most frequently used functional characters, which together make up a useful majority of the modern Chinese vocabulary bank. It follows that further enhancement of character acquisition can be achieved by optimally exposing a learner to “new” characters that are either combinations or derivatives of more basic components that a learner is already familiar with so as to minimize the cognitive load required to learn any “new” character.

Web Interactivity – an interactive web system can provide a multi-sensory learning environment that can supercharge the overall learning experience. The effectiveness of such concepts has been documented in many scientific studies. By combining the content with an effective visual layout, intelligent customization and gamification techniques and social features, a web-based platform provides a holistic learning experience that is greater than sum of any of the individual learning components. More importantly, interactive features can introduce stake, which motivates learners and help stimulate and maintain a high interest level throughout the course.

Simply stated, the end goal should be to make sure that every second of a learner’s time is spent efficiently on material that is effective.

    

I Need Your Help

Have you always wanted to pick up Chinese but never had the time? Are you afraid that you cannot learn it? Are you currently studying Chinese but are frustrated by the material or lack of progress? Do you want to impress natives by knowing even what they may not know about Chinese? I believe Serika can get you to your destination. But first, I need your help.

I have spent hours creating the content from scratch. I’ve also hired a web developer to build the web platform. But to get the entire system to its full functional form, I need additional funding for the following:

  • Retain a professional web development team to code the full set of customized back-end web applications, including an intelligent test engine, flash card system, dash board, and a multitude of community and social functions and features
  • Hire designers to create a suite of visual layouts to enhance the look and feel of the content delivery system. This is because I firmly believe that elegant and effective visual presentation can make or break the learning experience
  • Retain hands to turn fun and interesting contents available on the web into fresh and engaging Chinese learning materials

How great I can make the final system depends on how much funding I can raise. With your help, I will have the best shot at creating a fully functional system that delivers the best learning experience and results.

Even if you cannot contribute, I would be more than grateful if you can help spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, or simply tell anyone that you think might be interested or can benefit from this project. Thank you!

 

Visit Serika's landing page and leave your contacts to get updated on our progress:

 http://www.mylanderpages.com/serika/serika
story_txt:
My Inspiration & Aspiration
Hi, my name is Jason He, a typical Asian guy. Albeit a generalization, it pretty much boils down to the fact that I follow instructions well. Life to date for me can be simply condensed into uncomplicated stages: I immigrated to the US as a kid, studied hard in school, attended a good liberal arts college on a full-tuition scholarship, then studied some more. After graduation, I followed an equally standard career track - first in consulting, then banking, and finally at a hedge fund. Yet gradually, I woke up to the realization that life has got to be more than following everyone else’s expectations. I’d never taken a stand on anything. Do I have what it takes to stand on my own two feet? Can I create something? But what?
      
The answer to what I was looking for came shortly after my son was born. Reflecting on my own path, the one thing that stood out was the power of language. This power shaped my surroundings and made me the person I am today. So naturally I wanted my son to learn his mother tongue, Mandarin Chinese. After sifting through a slew of antiquated learning materials and worst of all, gimmicks, I was disappointed, but excited. I was excited that there may be something I could do to make a difference.
I began reading anything and everything I could find on Chinese and language learning. The deeper I dug, the clearer it became that this sleepy field needs a serious makeover. Having worked in stressful industries, I am a firm believer of productivity hacking – exploiting ways to achieve more with less. The more I dissembled and understood the inner workings of Chinese, the more I realized that simply by adopting a rational and sensible learning approach and marrying the principles of time management with cognitive best practices, it was entirely possible to anyone to GET this seemingly difficult language. Little by little, I pieced together the framework for a holistic approach to hacking Chinese. After speaking and confirming with friends and language enthusiasts, I knew I had something of value.  It’s a road not taken, but one thing I was certain was that it would be a shorter path.

story:
Hello!

My name is Ellen, and I'm a junior sculpture major at the Minneapolis College of Art and Design. I've spent four awesome semesters here and I'm only a few more away from graduating. Alas, tuition is very high, and has unfortunately gone up even higher this year. I need some help to make it this semester!

This upcoming semester I'm taking six classes, totaling 18 credits, half of which are intense studio classes. I have a work study job through MCAD, I do freelance work, and I'm currently looking for a part-time job to help pay the bills, though I don't know how feasible that's going to be once the semester gets rolling, considering my work load.

Before MCAD, I attended a community college where I had a full scholarship in order to save money. I was a part of the arts program and had a lot of great teachers and great experiences, but it didn't come close to MCAD. It's tough, and it's expensive, but I've learned more during my short time at MCAD than I have throughout all of the rest of my life. Had I not come here I would never have had access to so many amazing facilities, passionate teachers, or the opportunity to learn even a fraction of the techniques I know now.

I'm a sculpture major, but I also study illustration and painting. I love to draw and paint and play with all kinds of media!

What I Need

I'm hoping to raise $4000 dollars to put towards this upcoming semester: $2000 towards paying off my tuition bill, and $2000 to fund class projects in the form of supplies. However, my main concern is tuition, and every penny helps!

What You Get

In return for your generosity, I'm offering my artistic services in the form of custom drawings and paintings! I'll draw/paint anything you like! Perhas you'd like an illustration of a beloved pet, or a rendition of a story character, or maybe you'd just like some original art? Take a look at the perks to see what I'm offering!


If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to send me a message through indiegogo or email me at estrub@mcad.edu!

story:
What PEF is:

The Peace Education Fund is an organization established to provide funds for entities doing peace education work in Western New York. Entities are encouraged to apply for small grants (typically $50 to $250 US) if they have a specific project or opportunity that involves

"the strengthening of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms; promoting understanding, tolerance and friendship among all nations, peoples, racial, ethnic and religious groups; respecting all beings, their habitats and their diversity."

and is in need of such funding.

What PEF has done:

The following is a partial list of projects and opportunities that the Peace Education fund has provided funding for the 10 years we have existed.

PeaceJam

Travel to the Nevada Desert Experience

Venezuelan film documentary

SOA Legal Defense Fund

Prisoners Are People Too (award for karima and grant for Family Empowerment Day)

Travel to Oak Ridge/support services

Marty McGee (award for work on 9-11 study group)

Sierra Club for bus to D.C. (environment)

Rebecca Strong for Cosmogenesis/POEM

Many projects of the Latin American Solidarity Committee

Tom Potts for dental clinic

Mary Kay Jou for Reconciliation talk at International Institute

“Reaching Out to Africa” – medical supplies to Sudan

Peace Center for farmworker travel

Journeys of Solutions (4 walls project in El Sauce, Nicaragua)

NETO for Healing at the Heart of Niagara

Jeff O’Connell for videodocumentary work

Bail Fund (both PC and our own – drones, so far)

Travel for Alice Gerard to NCNV walk in Iowa

Travel for Peace and Justice studies in Argentina and the UK

What PEF Needs:

The funds that the PEF uses to provide grants and awards comes from a number of sources. Some of our more significant sources include our TOPS gift card program, private donations, our Celebration Circle program and our two annual fund raisers: the Lizzard Ball (in the spring) and June & Roger's annual Labor Sunday Potluck Party (in late summer). Because we were unable to organize a Lizzard Ball in the spring of 2013 we find ourselves needing to augment our summer fund raising efforts in the hopes of making up the difference in time for the 2014 grant review process. It is our hope that we can raise substantially more than our $800 target. If we fail to meet our target then some local ideas and projects will likely go unfunded and we would likely have to refuse more project than we accept for the first time in our decade of service.


Not able to contribute money?  Maybe you can contribute your time.  The Peace Education Fund board nedds to fill out a few more spots.  If you would be able to make it to 12 to 20 meetings a year (usually on the second Mondays of the month in the early afternoon) please send an email to JuneLicence@fundpeace.org .


Please Note: 

The Riverside-Salem UCC church processes financial transactions for the Peace Education Fund.  When you make a financial contribution the recipient will appear as "New York Conference of the United Church of Christ" but your contribution will actually go to the Peace Education Fund.


Our thank you gifts:

As our thank you for contributing to the 2014 funding cycle we are offering several thank you gifts.  See the right side bar for details.

story:
My Story: 

Hello all. I am young 22 year old and recent graduate with a passion for cultural diversity, education, bettering the lives of children, and giving back to the world in any way that I can. I've recently decided to spend the youth of my 20's pursuing my passions by teaching English abroad in an effort to enrich the lives of young ones while simultaneously broadening my own horizons. 

 

What are you supporting?

I will be taking off to Thailand in September for at least six months, if not longer, and I am looking for your support in my journey over to the beautiful land of smiles. I'm going with the TEFL Heaven group to teach English to Thai children of all ages. 

The donations will support my TEFL qualification, as well as, the travels and expenses to get myself there. 

 

Why?

English is not an easy language to learn - especially in those areas of the world, such as Thailand, that have limited resources. Sometimes the hardest places to reach out too are the ones that need the most help. This is why I chose Thailand to go teach English and be a helpful resource to their young students. 

I've been blessed with the opportunity to teach and live in Thailand, work with children and fully emerse myself into a completely different culture. I cannot think of a better way to spend the next 6 months, or even a year, other than spreading my knowledge and helping the young students of Thailand overcome this language barrier. 

I am taking a giant leap of faith by going on this journey, but am chasing my dreams and trusting my intuition that this is where I should be. Any donation is much appreciated and promised to be used in good faith. 

 

Thanks for reading and thank you for your donation. 

 

Saige Eshelman :)

story:
Allegro School of Music

The Allegro school of Music is a nonprofit organization that will serve the Jacksonville Florida community. Individuals will have the opportunity to learn a variety of musical instruments from trained musicians. Our ultimate goal is to enrich lives through the opportunity to explore and develop musical talents. We aim to provide a positive impact through allowing individuals the opportunity to be creative and the means in which to do so.

The Allegro School of Music values partnerships with other community organizations that have a commitment to improving lives through art and creativity. Its focus is to provide under privileged individuals of all ages a chance to learn how to play music in an inspired environment.

There is no gift too small, reaching the goal will provide over 200 music lessons to underprivileged individuals. Your contributions will help in the following way,

$25  funds one lesson for one individual

$100 funds one month of lessons for one individual

$500 funds one group class for 8 weeks

Funds will also go towards purchase of sheet music and instruments.

Since the Allegro School of Music is a nonprofit organization the business relies
primarily on sponsorships, donations, and grants.

The Allegro School's goal is to develop relationships throughout the community and obtain the funding necessary to keep the music ALIVE!

The Allegro School is in the infancy stages and if the goal is not met we will continue vigorously to seek support for this initiative. We will achieve this vision by strategically re-investing all proceeds in the cause as well as continue recruiting volunteers to teach and expand our purpose.

To become more involved with the cause and donate instruments, education materials, and equipment to the Allegro School by contacting theallegroschool@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

In November I received word that I had been accepted into the Social Responsibility and Personal Well-being course at the University of Mount Union.

This semester I’ve been learning about our world and how to improve it. Already we’ve learned about sustainability, global warming, social justice, and so much more! I’m grateful for this opportunity to be in a class with other people who are interested in improving the world. 

This class also includes a service trip over Spring Break. Originally we were going to go to El Salvador, but due to travel warnings we are now going to the Dominican Republic. 

In the Dominican Republic, I will be working with West Indies Christian Ministries. I’ll be painting and doing construction on their school, and I will get to work with kids all week. It will be such an incredible experience and I am so excited to go!

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to go on this trip, I need to raise funds. I thought I would try a different approach-- an online campaign.  Here’s where the money is going:

  • Airfare
  • Room and board
  • Food for the week
  • Transportation
  • Supplies for construction/painting
  • Vaccinations

I greatly appreciate anything you are willing to give. Any amount will be very helpful! I have some prizes as well for anyone who helps me monetarily:

  • Donations of $5 or more will receive a shout out on my Facebook page and a signed photograph of everyone on the trip.
  • Donations of $25 or over will receive the above, and a small souvenir from the Dominican Republic.
  • Donations of $75 or over will receive the above and a piece of amber jewelry, a stone abundant in the Dominican Republic.

If you can’t give monetarily, please help me spread the word by passing this along via email and to your Facebook friends.

 

The Impact

I’m really looking forward to this trip. It’s going to have a huge impact on the children we’re going there to see. I will be stuffing my suitcase full of food, toys and clothes to leave behind when I come back to the U.S. I’m also learning Spanish songs and learning games to share. I cannot express in words how excited I am to spend a week with these kids.

I’ve always loved service trips, but I know that this one will be something special. This is my very first out-of-country service trip. I’m excited to learn about a new culture, to learn more Spanish, and to come out of this trip with more life lessons.

Thank you so much for coming to my website and learning about my trip! I hope you can help me, and I look forward to telling you all about the trip when I return.
story_txt:
Short Summary
In November I received word that I had been accepted into the Social Responsibility and Personal Well-being course at the University of Mount Union.
This semester I’ve been learning about our world and how to improve it. Already we’ve learned about sustainability, global warming, social justice, and so much more! I’m grateful for this opportunity to be in a class with other people who are interested in improving the world. 
This class also includes a service trip over Spring Break. Originally we were going to go to El Salvador, but due to travel warnings we are now going to the Dominican Republic. 
In the Dominican Republic, I will be working with West Indies Christian Ministries. I’ll be painting and doing construction on their school, and I will get to work with kids all week. It will be such an incredible experience and I am so excited to go!
 
What We Need & What You Get
In order to go on this trip, I need to raise funds. I thought I would try a different approach-- an online campaign.  Here’s where the money is going:

Airfare
Room and board
Food for the week
Transportation
Supplies for construction/painting
Vaccinations
I greatly appreciate anything you are willing to give. Any amount will be very helpful! I have some prizes as well for anyone who helps me monetarily:

Donations of $5 or more will receive a shout out on my Facebook page and a signed photograph of everyone on the trip.
Donations of $25 or over will receive the above, and a small souvenir from the Dominican Republic.
Donations of $75 or over will receive the above and a piece of amber jewelry, a stone abundant in the Dominican Republic.
If you can’t give monetarily, please help me spread the word by passing this along via email and to your Facebook friends.
 
The Impact
I’m really looking forward to this trip. It’s going to have a huge impact on the children we’re going there to see. I will be stuffing my suitcase full of food, toys and clothes to leave behind when I come back to the U.S. I’m also learning Spanish songs and learning games to share. I cannot express in words how excited I am to spend a week with these kids.
I’ve always loved service trips, but I know that this one will be something special. This is my very first out-of-country service trip. I’m excited to learn about a new culture, to learn more Spanish, and to come out of this trip with more life lessons.
Thank you so much for coming to my website and learning about my trip! I hope you can help me, and I look forward to telling you all about the trip when I return.

story:
What we do!

We would like to introduce ourselves, we are Michael and Davina Duff, we have started a unique ministry. Our mission statement and vision is to see marriages revived, addiction deafeated and families saved. Marriages are falling apart at the fastest rate ever and need encouragement. Addiction is still on the rise and we want to bring new hope to those in need of help finding recovery. This campaign is so important to us because we were those people, trapped in addiction and a marriage that had no hope. We want to bring our personal testimony to you, churches and other organizations all over the world. We are living proof that hope can be restored and God's love can prevail! 

 Why we need you!

Our goal is to be able to reach out to anyone who needs our services. We need to make promotional DVD's, brochures and other marketing items. We need your help. Please consider supporting this cause. 

 

 The Results!

Through grace, forgiveness, mercy and deliverance we know that marriages can and will be revived. Families can and will become whole again, and this will have an impact on our entire communities!

Our first service was held in Apple Valley, MN on Feb 15th, 2013 and the outcome was amazing.  

"God was clearly working in this service. Marriage Revival and Peace Reigns International is a ministry that God is using to fix the damage in marriages all over the world." Todd Brux

 

What can you do?

Support us with your generous donation, if you are unable to support us financially, we ask that you help spread the word about Peace Reigns International and Marriage Revival Conferences to your friends, church and any organization. Share this link and pray for us as we go forward, may God bless you!

story:
Who are we?

Northwest Academy is a Public Charter School in Northern Michigan serving students in the Charlevoix and Emmet Counties.  We are known in the area for our outstanding band program and commitment to serving the community.  The band program was built by Mr. Gary Stutzman and our current success is due to his efforts.  Our school is small but reaches out to students with one of the first online learning programs in the state.  

What's the project?

Our band was selected by the National Alliance for Public Charter Schools to attend and perform at their conference in Washington DC during the first week in July.  This is a tremendous honor for the students in the school and in the band as it raises awareness of our school to a National level.  Our performance will tell people that even in a small school, you can be successful.

What is this paying for?

Funds raised will go toward our travel (by air), lodging, and food expenses on the trip.  The trip will cost about $600 per student and we will be spending our time in Washington DC at a Youth Hostel, attending the conference, visiting museums, we also hope to include the Capitol, the Lincoln Center and the President’s Own Marine Band for a rehearsal.

What if we don't raise our goal?

All funds will go toward the trip regardless of whether we reach the listed goal.  We are going!  Washington DC, here we come.

This will be the second trip to the National Charter School Conference for the Northwest Academy Band since they traveled to Denver, Colorado in 1999.  

What if I can't give?

Even if you can’t contribute, please consider passing along the information to someone who you think might be willing to make a contribution.

Our departure date is June 27 so we are closing the contributions on June 25!  Thank you for your support of our students and our school!

story:
Short Summary

CEF®stands for Child Evangelism Fellowship®, and we are a nonprofit, worldwide, interdenominational ministry with various chapters located across America and the world. The mission of CEF is to evangelize and disciple boys and girls with the gospel of Jesus Christ and establish them in Bible believing churches.

CEF of Orangeburg/Lower Savannah in South Carolina is a nonprofit local chapter committed to reaching children in our area with the gospel. We accomplish this primarily through Good News Clubs, 5 Day clubs, Family Fun Day and various community and open air events.

Your gifts will help us to reach the most forgotten mission field: the children. Christ said, "...it is not the will of my Father who is in heaven that one of these little ones should perish. (Mt.18:14)" Christ has modeled for us how important it is to reach children for His Kingdom. Your finanical gifts will make an eternal impact on the lives of thousands of children!

 

What We Need & What You Get

As with any nonprofit organization, we must rely on God as He uses faithful monthly supporters and generous donors. Our goal of $10,800 reflects our immediate ministry needs to ensure our continued effort of reaching the children in our area. Please prayerfully consider giving towards our needs however you can. Any gift you give will be used to reach the children of the Orangeburg/Lower Savannah area for Christ. Your funds will go to various ministry costs and projects. Some include:

Family Fun Day- This is a free community event held annually at the Orangeburg County Fair Grounds. Reaching over 10,000 people each year, this event is a huge endeavor and much financial support is needed. Over 300 children accepted Christ as their savior last year! Family Fun Day will take place on September 14, 2013. 

Good News Club®-A Good News Club is an action-packed hour of motion-filled songs, life-changing memory verses, dynamic Bible Lessons, exciting Missions stories and thought-provoking review games. The clubs meet one day a week after school on the public elementary school grounds. Throughout our ministry area, local churches adopt schools and provide the volunteers needed to reach the children. Each Good News Club has various costs and needs throughout the year.

5-Day Club® - Like the Good News Club, the 5-Day Club has the same teaching elements but is held at a location for a week, during the summer months. These clubs are mostly held at day cares, Boys and Girls Clubs, YMCA, Child Development Center, churches...anywhere there are children. These clubs are conducted by young people ages 15 and up through our CYIA™ program (Christian Youth In Action). This summer program trains teens and college students to share the gospel in their local communities.

GNC Workshop Training material- Good News Club workshops serve many volunteers twice a year with special training. 

Open Air events- Evangelical event focused on reaching out to the local community. 

 

Make sure you check out the various perks that will be available to those who feel led to give!

 

The Impact

When you invest in the life of a child, you invest in their future. Our children are in desperate need of the Good News of Jesus Christ. They need to know the love and hope that only the risen Savior can provide. If we don't reach them, who will?

Other Ways You Can Help

Any gift amount that you give will be greatly appreciated. We also ask that you pray for the children, volunteers, and staff of CEF of Orangeburg/Lower Savannah. Help us get the word out about our campaign by sharing our page link with friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media sites. Don't forget about using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

We are GoPink!DC, Washington's only dragon boat team for women touched by breast cancer. Our goal is to raise money so our team and crew can participate for the first time in the 2014 International Breast Cancer Dragon Boat Festival in Sarasota, Florida. It's also the first time the event, held every 4 years, will be hosted in the USA. This dynamic experience will include 100 breast cancer teams from all over the world.  We're thrilled to attend and represent our Nation's Capital!

In the dragon boat, twenty of us sit two-by-two, paddling in sync. We are interdependent, each relying on the other to pull us all forward. In this action we learn something powerful: Challenging ourselves on the water makes us stronger in life.

We race in festivals against other breast cancer teams, in a spirit of competition and camaraderie. The vibrant gatherings are transformational and teach survivors and supporters that breast cancer is an experience, not an identity. Tournaments support healing, growth, and offer poignant opportunities for remembrance of sisters who have died.

What We Need & What You Get

Goal = Generate sufficient funds to cover the following:
  • Defray team transportation and lodging costs for event
  • Shipping-related costs to transport team equipment and supplies
  • Team apparel to include hat, race shirt, jacket
  • Team paddles 
  • Team dinner
  • Team trading pins

Check out "perks" you'll receive in appreciation for your support. Since National Capital Area Women's Paddling Association (NCAWPA)/GoPink!DC is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, your donation is tax-deductible to the full extent allowed by federal law. 

The Impact

Through participation in GoPink!DC, women experience the healing power of community and the physical benefits of an activity that can relieve the side effects of treatment.

Our aim is to increase participation in the GoPink!DC community, introducing more survivors and allies to the physical, emotional, and social benefits of dragon boating.

We collaborate with local and national partners to raise awareness of breast cancer's impact, promote investment in treatment research, and expand knowledge of dragon boating's therapeutic benefits.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially, there are many ways you can help us by spreading the word to others:

 

  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to spread the word on social media!
  • Email our link to your friends, family, and colleagues! 
  • Post a supportive comment on our GoPink!DC Facebook site and share!

story:
Since the start of Operation Protective Edge on July 8th almost 2000 rockets have been fired by Gaza-based militants, mainly Hamas, into Israel. The IDF operation was launched in order to restore peace and quiet to Israeli citizens, particularly those in the South who have faced over 50 rockets a day. 

While the early stages of the operation were limited to air strikes against militant targets in the Gaza strip the increased barrage of rockets and several attempted border infiltrations via underground tunnels, led the IDF to launch a ground operation into the strip on July 18th. For Israeli soldiers and reservists alike the situation has forced them to drop their daily routines and leave their families in order to put their lives on their line for Israel's safety and security. 22 have been killed and over one hundred hospitalised so far. 

Inspired by others who have been collecting socks, soap, coffee, snacks and delivering them directly to the soldiers currently stationed near the Gaza strip we feel that the least we can do is make them a home cooked meal and what a better opportunity than this Shabbat. 

Please donate generously so we can provide the soldiers, who are honourably protecting our lives, with what we often easily take for granted. 

Thank You!!

For Israeli soldiers and reservists alike the situation has forced them to drop their daily routines and leave their families in order to put their lives on their line for Israel's safety and security. 22 have been killed and over one hundred hospitalised so far. Inspired by others who have been collecting socks, soap, coffee, snacks and delivering them directly to the soldiers currently stationed near the Gaza strip we feel that the least we can do is make them a home cooked meal and what a better opportunity than this Shabbat. Please donate generously so we can provide the soldiers, who are honourably protecting our lives, with what we often easily take for granted. Thank You!!

story:
The Challenge

52% of Uganda's 36 million people are children below the age of 15, and the future belongs to them. Unfortunately, 71% of them are not finishing primary school in time. This is caused by, among other reasons, low competence, low literacy rates and lack of interest.  In fact, Uganda is ranked lowest in the region in literacy according to a Uwezo 2012 report.

Our Solution

The enjuba Foundation created the Uganda Spelling Bee to enable children improve their literacy, learn key life skills and develop a positive attitude towards life. We believe this will not only help and motivate them to complete school but also transform them into change agents and credible leaders. 

We believe that words change the world, and the Uganda Spelling Bee will help children learn new words, their meanings and how to use them in sentences. This will enable them to understand concepts better, pass standardized tests and stay in school longer. 

Our plan

Our plan is to provide the children with an easy-to-use standardized Spelling Bee Handbook consisting of a list positive words, with definitions and examples of how they are used in a sentence. We have compiled over 2000 words related to the values of Character, Responsibility, Excellence, Empathy and Discipline (CREED). Some examples of our words include authentic, integrity, accountability, transparency, enthusiastic, considerate. 

We shall work with teachers and parents to help children learn these words. The children will work with each other in teams of three to learn the words as they prepare for the Spelling Bee that will take place in their schools, regionally and nationally. The Spelling Bee and the awards are incentives to study hard.

Over the next two years we plan to reach 200 schools and 60,000 pupils in Uganda and expand to the entire country within the next five years which will include 17,500 schools and 5,000,000 pupils. The Uganda Spelling Bee was started last year with a pilot in 10 schools and 3,000 pupils. This is a video of our final event which was covered by Uganda's leading national television NTV. You can also learn more on our website.


We shall be working on a franchise model to expand to other countries. We already have expressions of interest from South Africa, Nigeria and Rwanda to replicate our model. We are also building local partnerships and asking schools to make a small financial contribution towards the organisation of Spelling Bee. We currently have a leading television and leading independent daily newspaper as our media partners, and the City Council of Kampala has offered to provide us with the venue for free.

What Is Your Money Going Towards?

Your donation will enable us to design, print and distribute the Spelling Bee Handbooks and train teachers.  If you send us your mailing address, we would love to provide you with your own copy signed by the Spelling Bee winner and the enjuba Foundation team. We will also send you a link to a video of this year’s Spelling Bee and any media coverage we receive. Thank you for helping us empower Ugandan children to reach their full potential and increase character, responsibility, excellence, empathy and discipline in our country.

story:
**We have great news!!!  We have received financial aid from the AYF to fill in the rest of the goal, so...Do not donate any more money!!!!!  Thank you!!!

See new update video for more information.


Our Story

Hi,

 

Our Names are Kimberli Resinos and Janey Paredes.  We are sophomores at James Monroe High School who believe in our community.


We have worked hard to maintain excellent grades and were recently honored with receiving the American Youth Foundation’s National Leadership Award.  We have a strong desire to become leaders to help our community and need your help.

We are looking for sponsors to help us achieve our goal of raising $2270 so that we can attend The American Youth Foundation’s National Leadership Conference that takes place in Michigan, this August (5th-12th).  The cost of the conference is $610/person, the plane tickets are $425/person and camping supplies are about $100/person.

We are looking for any amount, large or small to help us achieve our goal.  If you contribute, we will keep you informed of our experience at the conference.

We can’t wait to be the change we wish to see in our community!  Thank you for taking the time to hear our story.

The Impact

We want to realize our leadership potential and explore new things to bring back to our school and community.


What We Need & What You Get

We have reserved our spots in the NLC and airlines on credit, but our families cannot afford to pay it back.  We know we can raise enough money to not burden our families with the cost of our high aspirations.  We cannot wait to show people what progress we have made!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word to anyone that would care to donate :)

story:
Keep in Touch

We believe, that address books should be about relations instead of just numbers and letters. We change our phone numbers, photos, job titles and e-mails on a regular basis throughout life, but we still remain the same person with an ever-expanding network of relations that needs to be held up-to-date. Therefore address books should help us to keep in touch with friends, family and colleagues as years pass by in the ever-changing world of late modern society.

 

How does it work?

Uptact (an acronym for update contacts) is a mobile application developed for iPhone and Android that keeps your address book updated and helps you share contact information with your network whenever you change your phone number, e-mail address, job title, etc.

If you change parts of your contact information, i.e. your phone number, the information is automatically distributed to all uptact users who has your name in their address book.

Likewise, if a person in your address book changes his or hers e-mail or adds a photo to the profile, your address book will automatically be updated.

This way uptact ensures a high quality of data in your address book by providing first hand contact information directly from the source.  Uptact uses your existing contact book (i.e. your local address book on the phone, g-mail, outlook, etc.), so it is not yet another address book you need to keep updated.

 

Please, help us keep it free of charge

Uptact is developed by three friends from Denmark - well, one of us is actually from the Faroe Islands - who share a common interest in developing new ideas and pieces of software that makes life easier. Furthermore, we believe that access to updated contact information should be a free service for everyone. Therefore, the application is free. However, software development, bug-fixing and hosting is a costly affaire.

 

The funds we are seeking will be used to host the solution and maintain, support and develop the software we have created.

 

We hope, that you will help us help people to get free access to updated contact information.

Keep in Touch
We believe, that address books should be about relations instead of just numbers and letters. We change our phone numbers, photos, job titles and e-mails on a regular basis throughout life, but we still remain the same person with an ever-expanding network of relations that needs to be held up-to-date. Therefore address books should help us to keep in touch with friends, family and colleagues as years pass by in the ever-changing world of late modern society.
 
How does it work?
Uptact (an acronym for update contacts) is a mobile application developed for iPhone and Android that keeps your address book updated and helps you share contact information with your network whenever you change your phone number, e-mail address, job title, etc.
If you change parts of your contact information, i.e. your phone number, the information is automatically distributed to all uptact users who has your name in their address book.
Likewise, if a person in your address book changes his or hers e-mail or adds a photo to the profile, your address book will automatically be updated.
This way uptact ensures a high quality of data in your address book by providing first hand contact information directly from the source.  Uptact uses your existing contact book (i.e. your local address book on the phone, g-mail, outlook, etc.), so it is not yet another address book you need to keep updated.
 
Please, help us keep it free of charge
Uptact is developed by three friends from Denmark - well, one of us is actually from the Faroe Islands - who share a common interest in developing new ideas and pieces of software that makes life easier. Furthermore, we believe that access to updated contact information should be a free service for everyone. Therefore, the application is free. However, software development, bug-fixing and hosting is a costly affaire.
 
The funds we are seeking will be used to host the solution and maintain, support and develop the software we have created.
 
We hope, that you will help us help people to get free access to updated contact information.

story:
Our Story

The North Oldham High School Speech Team (which was founded in 2003 when the school opened) has had its MOST SUCCESSFUL SEASON YET!  We have grown from 3 members back in 2003 to 32 members this year (check out our page on Facebook to see pictures of the team members and notes on our competition season - the page is listed under 2010-2011 North Oldham High School Speech Team).  


And to think it all started in 2003 with a trio of students riding to a competition in a mini-van!  My, how we have grown!


We have traveled to many tournaments across the state this year and have placed in the top overall sweepstakes category at nearly every competition.  We have had high numbers of finalists each time and many repeat champions!  This year, we are proud to have 5 NOHS students to represent our school and the KCFL state speech league at the National Grand Tournament in Washington, DC this coming Memorial Day weekend!


The students work throughout the year to raise money for the team.  Because we don't receive any funding whatsoever, we must work constantly to raise funds for competition fees, transportation, scripts and supplies, etc.  We produce drama productions, sell cookies, sell poinsettias, work concessions stands,, etc. And since we have 32 students on the team, our monetary needs have essentially doubled this year.  These students are continuing to do what they can when it comes to our cookie sales and productions, but we REALLY need your help to not only get these FIVE students to nationals, but also to get a head-start on our budget for next year.  We anticipate having 35 students on the team next year, so please do your part to help these students!


We are currently the NUMBER ONE team in our county, NUMBER TWO in our region, NUMBER FOUR with the KCFL state speech league, and NUMBER SIX in the state for the Kentucky HS Speech League! 


That's why we need YOUR HELP!  We are asking that you please donate to our cause--get these 5 students to nationals and also help us with next year's needs!  We are a small school and it is difficult to find sponsorships for our students--and they deserve this honor without having to worry about the money issue.


In short, we would be honored if you could donate and help these talented, honorable, sweet, wonderful students to be the best they can be--especially on the national level!  We will always make you proud!


SPECIAL NOTE:  If you are an alumni member of a speech team, then you especially know the importance of keeping our funds up for the season!  I am hoping that my former team members (from both BGHS AND NOHS) will help us for sure!


The Impact

I believe in the importance of competitive speech activities.  I fell in love with the activity when I was in the 6th grade.  I went on to compete on the middle school, high school, and college levels.  And I have been coaching speech teams since 1999.  From my wonderful students at Bowling Green High School to my most recent speech team kiddos at North Oldham High School, I consider it an HONOR to be a part of these students' lives. 


Being a part of the speech team is not just about competition--sure, the trophies are nice to have, but it teaches so many other positive things.  I can honestly say that the speech team community is a family.   And once you become a part of that activity, you have lifelong family members that support, love, and keep you in their hearts.  Speech also does SO MUCH for a person's confidence.  Many of us who now are coaches were speech team members in middle and high school in our home towns.  Some of us even competed on the college level.  Once you are a part of the speech team community, you never truly leave it.  The confidence you receive from being a part of speech is a major factor.  You use the public speaking skills forever in both your personal and career paths.  And we have all different types of students in this activity--that's the beauty of it.  It is an accepting, warm, and special team to be a part of for the rest of your life. 


Most of our students go on to college and pursue majors in everything from communications to teaching to engineering to nursing.  They go to college with confidence and determination.  And after having spent thousands of hours preparing and competing in the speech world, they know that the speech world has better prepared them for the real world.  We are proud that our students are Rhodes Scholars, Governor's School for the Arts students, Governor's Scholars, National Merit Scholars, and Gold Key Art students.   And, of course, regional and state champs--and now headed for nationals!  We are proud that we have had students compete on the national level every year since 2003.  We have had team members reach the semi-final round of competition on the national level--always a feat!


Our students compete in 12 various events--and many of them are triple or quadruple entered at each tournament!  All while maintaining their GPA status and other commitments!


As their mentor, I am truly proud that they are kindhearted, caring, giving people who are a joy to coach and call a part of my family!  I can't imagine my life without it.  But we can't do it without your monetary help--so please support us!


What We Need & What You Get

The costs of these tournaments include travel expenses, entry fees, hotels, and food.  Any leftover monies will be utilized for next year's competition season.  We can certainly go over our requested fundraising amount--and hope we do so!  Every dollar makes a difference!

The $2500 we are asking for would cover the hotel costs and airfare for our 5 students competing at the NCFL Grand Nationals Tournament in Washington, DC May 26-30, 2011.  Washington, DC is an expensive place to visit--and we are not allowed to drive due to school board rules and regulations. 

We would appreciate your help--

And if we happen to raise more than $2500 we will use the extra money to offset our upcoming expenses for next year (we typically need up to $7,000 to operate for the year).

And now for the perks!  We want to give you a gift for helping out our team!

Anyone who donates between $10 and $49 will receive a signed photo of our national competitors--so much fun!  We will take the photo in DC and then send it to you upon our return!

Any person who donates between $50 and $99 will receive one of our fun NOHS Speech Team t-shirts--signed by the ENTIRE team plus the nationals photo!

Any donor who gives $100 to $299 will receive a special souvenir from our nationals trip (that's right, a little "thank you" from our nation's capitol), the signed t-shirt, and signed photo!

And lastly, any person who donates $300 or more will receive the souvenir, shirt, photo, and a COMPLIMENTARY ONE-HOUR FAMILY PORTRAIT SESSION from Coach Rosemary Cundiff-Brown's photography studio!  Details about the session are available on request--session will be either in-studio or at one local location.  And you may gift the session to someone if you are not local.  Or you can make a trip to Louisville for your session! 

Check out our work at www.monarch-photography.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out and post this one your Facebook page--we need everyone to donate to the cause! Even if you don't know these particular students - I know that you will agree that this activity is important and a worthwhile cause. 


You can donate right here through PayPal or Credit/Debit card--BUT!


You may also mail a check (made payable to the NOHS Speech Team) to us via yours truly at:


NOHS Speech Team

Attn:  Rosemary Cundiff-Brown

1815 South Highway 1793

Goshen, KY 40026


“The foundation of every state is the education of its youth...”


THANK YOU!

From Rosemary Cundiff-Brown and the NOHS Speech Team
