story:
*EL TEXTO EN ESPAÑOL, SE ENCUENTRA AL FINAL

Welcome to
Caminando Unidos (Walking United)
Who are we?

We are a group of people from various social situations, economically and of
various educational backgrounds, of varying ages but all interested in
participating in this learning space, that we call our Sanctuary.  Here we
look for creative ways of educating, working for Peace and Active Nonviolence,
a change in the world.  In addition to building more humane relationships
that work to form bridges between distinct cultures and social classes, which
permit us to create a support system and solidarity in the same community.
Mission
To generate a
learning space of acceptance, self-control, and support for children, young
people, and women that allows us to fight together against the affects of
poverty.  In so, acquiring the strength and the necessary tools to improve
their lives and those of the community. 

Our population:

 The population that uses our facilities come from eight
different communities from the north-eastern zone of Cuernavaca.  They
come from conditions of poverty, extreme poverty, poor health, violence in the family,
violence in their environments, drug addiction, target for drug cartels , risk of
expulsion from the public education system or may have already been expelled.
 If expelled, there is no room for him/her in a different education
system, which can be considered as another risk to work in the street.  The
affects of being rejected from the education system leaves young people at a
higher risk for drug addiction, violent behavior and criminal acts.

We have different programs: Health program (includes breakfast and lunch,
monthly checkup from a doctor, showers and laundry). Construction program:
Houses with ecological techniques, backyard agriculture. Formative Program: our
methodology. Recreation Program: visit to swim, to the movie theater, parks,
museums, etc.
We actually serve on average 120 people daily, which spans an average of 50
families. 

SHARING THE FIRE:

We have been working with this community for over 20 years;
6 of which we have been working a curriculum created by Gracia Esteva (pedagogic
counceler), and they include Freinet, Freire, Education for Peace, The 4
Tolteca Agreements by Don Miguel Ruíz and Creative Transformation by John David
García (RIP) educational techniques. We propose –based on the evolution- that if we replicate
Evolutional Key Moments in the history of humanity, we gain access to ancestral
memories which make sinapsis in their brains; thus leading to an ethical and
creative society. We state that there are no morals in any social level; that
honor is lost and we can not appeal for values that are not there…  we create the pre-value:

The older takes care for the younger

The one that knows more teaches the one that knows less

The only prize is to learn

The only punishment is to not be creative

This, alongside the workshops given by Gracia Esteva and the
4 Toltec Agreements create an ethical society; starting in Caminando Unidos and
spreading amongst the neighbourhoods where we live. Even though it is a
curriculum that takes place with marginal-conditions population, foreign
volunteers, people working here and not living in the neighbourhood and
everyone that Works or has been involved in Caminando Unidos has been touched
by this methodology and have addopted it in their lives. This proves the
methodology Works no matter which social conditions we live in.

We plan to avoid normalizing the unbearable; there is
violence  and bullying and we have
erradicated that… we refuse to normalise it and we have changed it. Violence
reduced to 0% in the first 12 months, and for the next 5 years bullying
dissapeared. We have received national and foreign volunteers, and ther´s
been universities that have seen our path and asked us to reply our model; and
even though we have the material for the documentation, we have not the knowledge
to generate a manual. Caminando Unidos has funcioned out of donations; the
proposal to generate a video and a manual alongside our workshops is that we
become able to make a trade with them and charge for them. Caminando Unidos ´s
dream is for our youngsters to travel around the world to share our methodology
and our knowledge. Your donation is very important because you directly support
our youngsters and children, you certify our job and become yourself a maker of
this dream which is Caminando Unidos.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Our intention is to hire 4 professionals who give us
training in video, audio, script-writing 
and edition. We need to buy cameras, microfone, computer and edition
programs.

Likewise we need documentarysts to process the existing
information, to teach us show to create better instruments of documentation and
the design and printing of the manuals.

The final outcome will be a video and a manual, also our
workshops to be replicated. This all has a cost of u$ 80,000, our goal is to
reach 50,000 USD. We are willing to pay the difference; however if we exceed
the goal we can create better quality manuals and each extra dollar will be
used to improve the conditions inside our community house. If we dont reach our
goal we wont be able to to begin the documentation and info-processing process.
With your donation you will be able to get amazing perks;
like your own kit to start a fire, a mud piece created by our children,
pictures, or your name written on our donors Wall.

THE IMPACT

This dream coming true it will impact directly to our membres families; and we
will begin replicating this model as of 2015 with at least 3 universities and
their social work students.

Just like it happened with our 2 ecological houses in the
neighbourhood; we hope to ignite an ethical and creative spreading of our
methodology.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We receive species donations; toys, clothes, food and hygiene products.

You can sponsor by giving a unique or monthly donation to any of our programs
or to any of our godfathering participants.

And above all spread the voice and ask your family and
Friends to get to know our work, each penny counts.

The subtitled versión of the video (French, German) will be
published in our updates.

Thank You very much.

If you want to know more about us, or get the information of
our page in english, German or french, ask for it at the following mail:

info@caminandounidos.org.mx

¡BIENVENIDOS A CAMINANDO UNIDOS!

¿Quiénes
somos?

Somos un grupo de personas con
características diversas en condiciones sociales, económicas y  educativas, con edades variadas interesadas
en participar en este espacio formativo, que llamamos Santuario, donde buscamos
de manera creativa bajo la perspectiva de la Educación para la Paz y la No
Violencia Activa, un cambio en el mundo, la construcción de relaciones más
humanas, que tiendan puentes entre distintas culturas y clases sociales, que permitan
crear redes de apoyo y solidaridad en la misma comunidad.

Misión

Generar un espacio
formativo de aceptación, contención y apoyo para niños y niñas, jóvenes y
mujeres que permita luchar colectivamente contra los efectos de la pobreza y
así adquirir la fortaleza y herramientas necesarias para mejorar sus
condiciones de vida y las de su comunidad.

Población atendida:

La población que asiste a
nuestras instalaciones vive en 8 colonias de la zona noreste de la Ciudad de
Cuernavaca, en condiciones de pobreza, pobreza extrema, insalubridad, violencia
intrafamiliar, violencia del medio, drogadicción, riesgo de calle, riesgo de
expulsión del sistema educativo o ha sido ya expulsada y no cabe en algún otro
sistema educativo por lo que podría no sólo considerarse en riesgo de calle
sino que se la ha negado ya la educación y se les coloca en condiciones ideales
para el desarrollo de drogadicción y conductas violentas y delictivas.

Actualmente atendemos en
promedio a 120 personas diariamente, lo que abarca un promedio de 50 familias.

COMPARTIENDO EL FUEGO:

Tenemos más de
20 años de trabajo en esta comunidad, sin embargo, llevamos ya 6 años de
trabajo con una curricula que ha creado Gracia Esteva, nuestra asesora pedagógica,
que incluye técnicas de Freinet, Freire, Educación para la Paz, los 4 Acuerdos
Toltecas de Don Miguel Ruiz, y la curricula educativa de John David García
(RIP) “Creative Transformation” . Basado en la evolución planteamos que si
replicamos los momentos claves de la evolución del ser humano, accedemos a las
memorias ancestrales a la vez que se hacen sinapsis llevando así a una sociedad
ética y creativa. Planteamos que no hay moral en ningún estrato social, que se
ha perdido la honorabilidad de la palabra y que no podemos apelar a valores que
no están apropiados, y creamos el pre-valor:

El más grande
cuida al más chico

El que sabe más
le enseña al que sabe menos

El único premio
es aprender

El único
castigo es no ser creativo

Que aunado a
los talleres que imparte Gracia Esteva y los 4 acuerdos Toltecas, crean una
sociedad ética, empezando por la comunidad de Caminando Unidos, y que se ha
extendido en las colonias donde vivimos, aunque es una currículo que se ha
llevado a cabo con una población en condiciones de marginación, los voluntarios
extranjeros, el personal que no es de la comunidad que labora aquí, y todos los
que hemos participado en Caminando Unidos hemos sido tocados por esta
metodología y lo hemos adoptado en nuestras vidas, probando así que sirve en
cualquier estrato social.

Planteamos no
normalizar lo insoportable, que hay violencia, bullying, abuso que hemos
normalizado y en este proyecto lo hemos erradicado, nos negamos a normalizarlo
y lo cambiado, en los primeros 12 meses de trabajo se redujo la violencia a un
0% y se erradicó por completo y por los subsecuentes 5 años el bullying.

Hemos recibido
voluntarios nacionales, extranjeros y universidades que han visto nuestro
recorrido y que nos han pedido replicar nuestro modelo, y aunque contamos con
el material para la documentación no tenemos el conocimiento para generar un
manual. Caminando Unidos ha funcionado hasta ahora de donativos, la propuesta
al generar un manual y un video, acompañados de nuestro taller de capacitación
es que podamos cobrarlos y generar un intercambio. El sueño de Caminando Unidos
es que nuestros jóvenes viajen alrededor del mundo a compartir nuestra
metodología y nuestros saberes.

Tu donativo es
muy importante ya que apoyas directamente a nuestros niños y jóvenes, avalas
nuestro trabajo y te conviertes en un tejedor de este sueño, de Caminar Unidos.

LO QUE
NECESITAMOS Y LO QUE OBTIENES:

Nuestra
intención es contratar a 4 profesionales que nos capaciten en video, audio,
guionismo, edición, la compra de las cámaras, micrófono, computadora y
programas de edición.

Al mismo tiempo
a dos documentadoras que procesen la información existente, que nos enseñen a
crear mejores instrumentos de documentación y el diseño e impresión de los
manuales.

El producto
final será un manual y un video, acompañado de nuestros talleres replicables,
esto tiene un costo de 80,000 USD, 
nuestra meta es de 50,000 USD nosotros estamos dispuestos a poner la
diferencia, sin embargo si excedemos nuestra meta podemos crear manuales de
mejor calidad y cada dólar extra podrá ser usado para mejorar las condiciones
dentro de nuestra casa comunitaria. Si no alcanzamos la meta, por lo menos
podremos empezar el proceso de documentación y procesamiento de la información.

Con tu donativo
podrás obtener increíbles y únicos perks, como tu propio kit para hacer fuego,
una pieza de barro creada por nuestros niños, fotos, o tu nombre en nuestra
pared de donadores.

EL IMPACTO

Al hacerse
realidad este sueño, impactará directamente a las familias de nuestros
participantes, y empezaremos a partir de 2015 a replicar este modelo por lo
menos con 3 universidades y sus estudiantes de trabajo social.

Así como dentro
de nuestro programa de construcción contamos con 2 casas con ténicas
ecológicas, esperamos contar con un contagio ético y creativo de nuestra
metodología.

OTRAS FORMAS DE
AYUDAR

RECIBIMOS
DONATIVOS EN ESPECIE DE JUGUETES, ROPA, ALIMENTOS Y PRODUCTOS DE LIMPIEZA E
HIGIENE PERSONAL.

PUEDES
PATROCINAR HACIENDO UN DONATIVO ÚNICO O MENSUAL CUALQUIERA DE NUESTROS
PROGRAMAS O A ALGUNO DE NUESTROS PARTICIPANTES EN APADRINAMIENTO.Y SOBRE TODO
PUEDES CORRER LA VOZ Y PEDIRLE A TUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS QUE CONOZCAN NUETRO
TRABAJO, CADA CENTAVO CUENTA.

MUCHAS GRACIAS

SI QUIERES
SABER MÁS DE NOSOTROS, SI QUIERES SABER LA INFORMACIÓN DE NUESTRA PÁGINA EN
INGLÉS, ALEMÁN O FRANCÉS PIDE INFORMACIÓN AL SIGUIENTE MAIL:

info@caminandounidos.org.mx



 

Para saber más
de nosotros:

www.caminandounidos.org.mx

Youtube:
CaminandoUnidos1

FB: www.facebook.com/caminando.unidos

Twitter: @caminandounidos

AcuerdosToltecas de Don Miguel Ruiz, y la curricula educativa de John David García(RIP) “Creative Transformation” . Planteamos que no hay moral en ningún estrato social, que seha perdido la honorabilidad de la palabra y que no podemos apelar a valores queno están apropiados, y creamos el pre-valor:El más grandecuida al más chicoEl que sabe másle enseña al que sabe menosEl único premioes aprenderEl únicocastigo es no ser creativoQue aunado alos talleres que imparte Gracia Esteva y los 4 acuerdos Toltecas, crean unasociedad ética, empezando por la comunidad de Caminando Unidos, y que se haextendido en las colonias donde vivimos, aunque es una currículo que se hallevado a cabo con una población en condiciones de marginación, los voluntariosextranjeros, el personal que no es de la comunidad que labora aquí, y todos losque hemos participado en Caminando Unidos hemos sido tocados por estametodología y lo hemos adoptado en nuestras vidas, probando así que sirve encualquier estrato social.Planteamos nonormalizar lo insoportable, que hay violencia, bullying, abuso que hemosnormalizado y en este proyecto lo hemos erradicado, nos negamos a normalizarloy lo cambiado, en los primeros 12 meses de trabajo se redujo la violencia a un0% y se erradicó por completo y por los subsecuentes 5 años el bullying.Hemos recibidovoluntarios nacionales, extranjeros y universidades que han visto nuestrorecorrido y que nos han pedido replicar nuestro modelo, y aunque contamos conel material para la documentación no tenemos el conocimiento para generar unmanual. Caminando Unidos ha funcionado hasta ahora de donativos, la propuestaal generar un manual y un video, acompañados de nuestro taller de capacitaciónes que podamos cobrarlos y generar un intercambio. El sueño de Caminando Unidoses que nuestros jóvenes viajen alrededor del mundo a compartir nuestrametodología y nuestros saberes.Tu donativo esmuy importante ya que apoyas directamente a nuestros niños y jóvenes, avalasnuestro trabajo y te conviertes en un tejedor de este sueño, de Caminar Unidos.LO QUENECESITAMOS Y LO QUE OBTIENES:Nuestraintención es contratar a 4 profesionales que nos capaciten en video, audio,guionismo, edición, la compra de las cámaras, micrófono, computadora yprogramas de edición.Al mismo tiempoa dos documentadoras que procesen la información existente, que nos enseñen acrear mejores instrumentos de documentación y el diseño e impresión de losmanuales.El productofinal será un manual y un video, acompañado de nuestros talleres replicables,esto tiene un costo de 80,000 USD, nuestra meta es de 50,000 USD nosotros estamos dispuestos a poner ladiferencia, sin embargo si excedemos nuestra meta podemos crear manuales demejor calidad y cada dólar extra podrá ser usado para mejorar las condicionesdentro de nuestra casa comunitaria. Si no alcanzamos la meta, por lo menospodremos empezar el proceso de documentación y procesamiento de la información.Con tu donativopodrás obtener increíbles y únicos perks, como tu propio kit para hacer fuego,una pieza de barro creada por nuestros niños, fotos, o tu nombre en nuestrapared de donadores.EL IMPACTOAl hacerserealidad este sueño, impactará directamente a las familias de nuestrosparticipantes, y empezaremos a partir de 2015 a replicar este modelo por lomenos con 3 universidades y sus estudiantes de trabajo social.Así como dentrode nuestro programa de construcción contamos con 2 casas con ténicasecológicas, esperamos contar con un contagio ético y creativo de nuestrametodología.OTRAS FORMAS DEAYUDARRECIBIMOSDONATIVOS EN ESPECIE DE JUGUETES, ROPA, ALIMENTOS Y PRODUCTOS DE LIMPIEZA EHIGIENE PERSONAL.PUEDESPATROCINAR HACIENDO UN DONATIVO ÚNICO O MENSUAL CUALQUIERA DE NUESTROSPROGRAMAS O A ALGUNO DE NUESTROS PARTICIPANTES EN APADRINAMIENTO.Y SOBRE TODOPUEDES CORRER LA VOZ Y PEDIRLE A TUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS QUE CONOZCAN NUETROTRABAJO, CADA CENTAVO CUENTA.MUCHAS GRACIASSI QUIERESSABER MÁS DE NOSOTROS, SI QUIERES SABER LA INFORMACIÓN DE NUESTRA PÁGINA ENINGLÉS, ALEMÁN O FRANCÉS PIDE INFORMACIÓN AL SIGUIENTE MAIL:info@caminandounidos.org.mx Para saber másde nosotros:www.caminandounidos.org.mxYoutube:CaminandoUnidos1FB: www.facebook.com/caminando.unidosTwitter: @caminandounidos

story:
Short Summary

Meet Pracxedes, a 21 year old aspiring medic, who has just graduated from the Hawkers Market Girls Centre (HMGC). When I asked her what her goal in life is, she replied: "To be the best medic I can be, and see my siblings through school since my parents cannot afford to educate us."

Meet Carolyne, who was taken in by the centre after the loss of her parents. When asked what her dream is, she replied: "To get a good job to help my family and give back to the community.  That is why I have asked Mrs Keshavjee (the founder of the HMGC) to support me, since she is the mother and father in my life."

Welcome to this campaign! My name is Rashlin and I have been working closely with the HMGC, a community based organisation for 3 years.  Working with these girls, the most hardworking and driven that I have met, has not only humbled me, but driven me to make sure they get what they deserve!  The centre teaches girls like Carolyne and Pracxedes core values, and supports the development of their entrepreneurial, social and life skills to help them break out of the vicious cycle of poverty. 

In the slums there are very few resources: water; sanitation; electricity. HMGC acts as a home away from home, providing safe water, free food and education. HMGC has dedicated mentors who love, care and support the young women who participate. Those who have passed through this centre have found good educational opportunities, moved on to responsible jobs, are educating their siblings, and have experienced better living conditions overall. Many even come back to mentor other girls, in turn creating a virtuous cycle.

As the founder of the centre, Shariffa Keshavjee told me: "To know how to do something isn't enough - these women who have been previously overlooked now need confidence."

This campaign aims to raise money to pay for university and college fees for 10  girls who have graduated from the centre,  and continue to support the day to day running of the HMGC, which includes providing free education and food, dental care, counselling sessions and AIDS awareness. HMGC has previously been nominated for the World Challenge (as shown in the video) and acknowledged by the World Bank. 

What We Need & What You Get
University education for 4 girls: £8000 (This covers fees for 2.5 years)

Medical training for 1 girl: £1200

Catering school for 5 girls: £1800

Cost of running the centre for two years: (This covers food for the girls, medical checks, dental care, classes for HIV awareness and lessons in computing and girl guide training): £12,000

The Impact
Contributions will allow the girls to to attend medical school, universities and colleges around Kenya. This will allow them to have a brighter future, give back to their communities, and provide financial security for their families.


Although Kenya has achieved gender parity, this does not mean universal access to education.  Currently, only half of secondary school age girls are enrolled in further education, due to factors including poverty, inadequate infrastructure, and HIV. Thus, due to socio-cultural norms, when push comes to shove in these situations, boys' education is given higher preference over girls'. 

Funding this campaign would give these girls a voice that counts!


Other Ways You Can Help

Any financial contribution is appreciated; even £5 helps us to reach our goal!

However, if you cannot contribute financially there are many other ways you can help. Please:

  • Use the Indiegogo Share icons above to share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Write about our campaign on your blog, website, or publication. We are happy to provide promotional material, and will in turn share your link on our social media channels.
  • Tell your friends about our project!
Please read more about the work of the HMGC here:
http://www.comeplum.com/14573/2769985/photo/hawkers-market-girls-centre-(photojournalism)
http://ismailimail.wordpress.com/2008/10/02/ken...

For those in Kenya, you can M-Pesa your donations to the founder of the centre, Shariffa Keshavjee, at +254 722 206 030

story:
A Little History

The As'a Telong Music Academy (ATMA) is in its fourth year of existence here in Dschang, in the beautiful West region of Cameroon. Up to this point, the school has been used as an unstructured artistic space where lovers of music and the arts can come to express themselves, but we are looking to renovate the current studio into a space truly conducive to the creative spirit of our students.  

In 2011, famed Cameroonian guitarist As'a Telong established the As'a Telong Music Academy in Dschang with a vision of giving his students an opportunity to not only learn music but also infuse their young minds with creativity and passion. With no emphasis on music education in their schools in addition to enormous price tags on purchasing instruments, Cameroonian youth do not usually have the opportunity to learn music. It may be surprising to find that in a country such as Cameroon, where music and dance is a pivotal part of culture, learning music is reserved for a select few elite with expendable income, but not for everyone. ATMA's mission is to change that. 

As Dschang is a longtime Peace Corps post, the As'a Telong Music Academy has a history of collaboration with four Peace Corps Volunteers; at present, Justin Park (Education 2013-2015) and David Anctil (Youth Development 2014-2016) work at ATMA teaching Piano and Singing respectively. Between As'a, Justin, David, and several other teachers who volunteer their time and talents, children at ATMA are offered a variety of courses : Guitar (all levels), Piano (all levels), a group Chorus, Music and Solfege, Traditional Dance, Percussion (all levels), and a Sanza workshop, where students apprentice with our Sanza master to create the unique African instrument to sell to profit the school. 

While each course demands a specific price which is as competitive (affordable) as possible, the huge majority of students at ATMA are on scholarship, and trade some services (sweeping the floors, cleaning the dance mirror) for the opportunity to take classes at the academy while they contribute financially what they can. Considering the financial state of many residents of Dschang mixed with a typical disinterest on the parents' behalves that their children pursue musical education, every child and young adult who takes music or dance classes at ATMA does so because they have a strong personal passion for music that urges them to look past these obstacles and pursue their dreams. 


Where We're At

ATMA takes the second story of a would-be 3-bedroom apartment located close to the heart of Dschang, and is in rough condition. The walls are dirty and cracking, most of the plugs don't work, almost all of the light fixtures are disconnected or dangling off a string, and windows and doors won't close. 

Materially, ATMA is also lacking when it comes to the condition of its instruments, most of which were gifted to the academy during its first year. There are : 

  • three keyboards, all functional but with issues (broken keys, problems with motherboard, etc.) ; 
  • five guitars of varying condition (one being perfectly maintained, the other four featuring cracks, missing strings, broken pegs/headnuts) ; 
  • several percussive instruments, all either cracked or with torn drumheads. 

ATMA has invested money further in a stereo and some electronic equipment that are in good condition. These items are rented out in the community as a means of building revenue and creating sustainability for the academy. 

 

What We Need

Our funding goal for the re-vamping of the As'a Telong Music Academy is set at $1,000 or 500,000 francs. Every donation, no matter how big or small can help to fund an item or service seriously needed : 

$10 / 5,000 F can buy two piano tables, ten small stools, or pay the electricity bill for a month ;

$20 / 10,000 F can buy screens for all the windows, a necessity with Malaria being a serious killer in Cameroon ;

$32 / 16,000 F pays for a scholarship for an entire semester's course in piano, voice, or guitar ;

$40 / 20.000 F can supply 4 chalkboards or 40 bamboo chairs for all the students in the school at any given point ;

$50  / 25.000 F can buy a small practice keyboard for kids, or update all the electrical in the building ;

$90 / 45.000 F can buy a standard beginner's guitar or pay for a month's rent ;

$100 / 50.000 F can paint the entire interior of the building or buy ;

$120 / 60.000 F can buy a 61-key keyboard for performances and practice.


With the $1,000 / 500.000 F that we're hoping to raise, the funds will be spent as follows : 

Three keyboards ($360), three guitars ($270), two practice keyboards ($100), re-painting the building ($100), installing four chalkboards ($40), purchasing 40 bamboo chairs ($40), screening the windows ($20), updating all the electrical ($50), and buying five piano stands ($25).

With any additional money that may surpass our goal, the funds will be used to purchase more instruments or supply scholarships to those desperately in need. 


A Final Note

We at the As'a Telong Music Academy sincerely appreciate any donation you are able to make ; Cameroon is a beautiful country with a rich musical culture, unfortunately children are not invited - or usually wanted - to hone their musical craft in a worldly or educational setting. The ATMA slogan is « musique pour tous à la porte de tous » ; it is an all-inclusive environment of creativity and passion that is an asset to Dschang and to Cameroon as a whole.


Disclaimer: This fundraising project is in no way administered, sponsored, or partnered with the U.S. Peace Corps, but rather by the As'a Telong Music Academy.

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Our group consists of nine students and three teachers from Benjamin Franklin High School in Baltimore, MD.  Our school is located in south side of the inner-city between Brooklyn and Curtis Bay.  

For the first time ever, we are trying to take an international service trip to Ecuador.  This June, we hope to spend nine days traveling, immersing ourselves in a different culture, practicing our Spanish language skills, and serving others. 

What We Need 

We would really appreciate donations, as our students and teachers are trying to fully fund their trips without placing too much of the burden on our families.  Our group is working tirelessly to fundraise the entirety of our expenses, and we would be extremely thankful for any contribution.

While our group needs to raise over $25,000, we hope to raise $6,000 through donations on indiegogo.  

The Impact

Your donation helps to fight educational inequity.  While traveling abroad tends to be more accessible to certain groups, you can help make this enriching experience available to our students.  

If we do not reach our campaign goals, all of the funds will go directly towards lowering the costs of our students' travel expenses.  We plan on continuing to work extremely hard to meet all of our goals!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please email us for other ways to contribute to our campaign at benforecuador@gmail.com.  We are very grateful for any contribution, whether this be donating, volunteering, or participating in one of our fundraisers!  Thank you!!

story:
Although our Indiegogo campaign has come to a close, we are working harder than ever to make our mission possible.

If you are interested in contributing to the campaign but missed the deadline, you can still donate through our charity website, Environmental Vision Exchange (EVE).

Visit this link:
http://www.evecharity.org

Donate through Canada Helps, and select Solar Ship Foundation as the fund designation.

Perks are no longer available. However, if you are interested in purchasing patch space on the solarship, please email info@solarship.com stating your desired patch in addition to making your contribution on Canada Helps.

You may email this address for any additional questions or comments.

Thank you for your support!

---

Who is Solar Ship? 

The idea to build a solarship for Africa started on February 5, 1983 with a mission to deliver critical supplies to remote areas. The first flight was planned to take off from Cape Town and land in the areas around Lake Tanganyika and Lake Victoria.

Since 1992 we have been involved in dozens of charitable projects in Canada's north with First Nations communities as well as communities across Africa. These projects have created partners for Solar Ship throughout eastern and southern Africa, Madagascar and northern Canada.

We built and flew the first prototype in 2009. We have built 3 additional prototypes since then and have been flying since 2010 with regulatory approval.

This IndieGoGo campaign was created to fund Solar Ship's first mission to Africa.

What is a Solarship?

Powered by the sun and assisted by helium, the solarship is a hybrid aircraft —part bush plane, part airship. It’s a reliable, sustainably powered form of air transport able to operate where there are no roads or fuel supplies - it can take off and land in areas as small as a soccer field. The blend of aerodynamic lift, aerostatic lift and solar creates cost efficient air transport for areas with minimal or no infrastructure. 

Watch the videos below to learn more about the solarship.

Solar Ship Test Flights

Introduction to Solar Ship

The Mission

We take off from Cape Town and we stop every 500km to pick up a fresh round of medical supplies from our partners and deliver them to villages in the surrounding area. We do this ten times over forty days and finish in the Great Lakes region of Africa including Burundi, the country that inspired the idea in the first place.

Where We Are Now

Solar Ship was awarded a grant to build the next generation solarship and fly critical supplies to First Nations communities in the North.

This means the funding required to develop the components and fly in North America are secured. What is not secured, is a dedicated solarship for Africa.

Why Do We Need Money Now?

While our North American mission is underway, we plan to be building, testing and training our pilots for the African mission, which will be launched immediately after the northern Canada project. 

To put costs into perspective, the mission to Canada's north costs $6.2 million.

If we raise at least $1M here on IndieGoGo, we can cover the travel and operating costs needed to complete the African mission.

100% of the funds raised on this campaign will be used to cover these costs.

Solar Ship's Micro-Sponsorship Program

You'll see in our perks section that we've created space on the ship for your logos, messages and ideas. 

Solar Ship has created a micro-sponsorship program to fund the launch of this breakthrough technology into the most threatened places on earth. 

You can sponsor the mission and the technology by purchasing "patches" of logo space on the solarship which will also be reproduced digitally on our website. Sponsors can be anyone - individuals, organizations, or corporations.


When you buy a patch, you have an opportunity to advertise your business, cause, or brand. You can buy as many patches as you like, as long as they are available. The more patches you purchase, the more prominent your image will be, both on the web and the aircraft itself.

We would like to use this platform to lower the costs of delivering this technology to the poorest places with the highest transport costs. 

In the event of overfunding, we will extend our African mission and deliver more critical supplies to more places. 

What is a Patch?

A patch, or a group of patches, represents one sponsor’s logo space. These patches will form a banner that will be permanently fixed on the leading edge of the solarship. The banner will be reproduced on our website and kept online for at least 5 years. 

There are 8,000 patches available.  

How It Works 

After the campaign is complete, you will be asked to send us a hi-res image as well as an associated web link of your choice. Your image can be a corporate logo, a text-based message or a photo, the choice is yours. 

Expected Schedule

Website Launch - March, 2013

Northern Canada Mission - Summer 2014

African Mission - Fall 2014

How Much do the Patches Cost?

The FAMILY PATCH costs $125. It is roughly 1/4 the size of the green patches below. Looks small here, but will be highly visible on the solarship.

One GREEN patch costs $500.

One RED patch (the size of 4 Green patches) costs $2,000.

One BLUE patch (the size of 6 Green patches) costs $3,000.

One YELLOW patch (the size of 25 Green patches) costs $10,000.

On the website, the patches will be clearly visible with a zoom feature and a link to a URL provided by you.

This image is not to scale. It is intended to give you a general idea of how large the patches are relative to one another.

Additional Perks:

For $25,000

NIAGARA CALLS

You are invited to join us at Solar Ship's demonstration flight near Toronto. We'll pay for your ticket to Toronto* and we'll pick you up at the airport.


For $50,000

THE MOTHER BEAR

You can join us on our Northern Ontario Adventure. We'll pay for your ticket to Thunder Bay* and we'll pick you up at the airport.


For $1,000,000

FREEDOM OF MOVEMENT

You can create a new mission and message built and organized in your honour.

Other Ways You Can Participate: 

If you cannot afford a patch but would like your image represented on the solarship, why not get your group of friends together to pool funds and agree on one image to send us?

If you aren't able to donate, you can help us tremendously by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and followers. 

Learn More

Visit our Website

Read our Blog

Follow us on Twitter

Like us on Facebook

Watch our YouTube Channel

Keep an eye on the Gallery for media updates soon.

Everyone here at Solar Ship thanks you for your support!

*Disclaimer: Flight route is subject to change. Please see our Terms and Conditions page in the Gallery section above.

What is a Solarship?
Powered by the sun and assisted by helium, the solarship is a hybrid aircraft —part bush plane, part airship. It’s a reliable, sustainably powered form of air transport able to operate where there are no roads or fuel supplies - it can take off and land in areas as small as a soccer field. The blend of aerodynamic lift, aerostatic lift and solar creates cost efficient air transport for areas with minimal or no infrastructure. 
Watch the videos below to learn more about the solarship.
Solar Ship Test Flights
Introduction to Solar Ship
The Mission
We take off from Cape Town and we stop every 500km to pick up a fresh round of medical supplies from our partners and deliver them to villages in the surrounding area. We do this ten times over forty days and finish in the Great Lakes region of Africa including Burundi, the country that inspired the idea in the first place.
Where We Are Now
Solar Ship was awarded a grant to build the next generation solarship and fly critical supplies to First Nations communities in the North.
This means the funding required to develop the components and fly in North America are secured. What is not secured, is a dedicated solarship for Africa.
Why Do We Need Money Now?
While our North American mission is underway, we plan to be building, testing and training our pilots for the African mission, which will be launched immediately after the northern Canada project. 
To put costs into perspective, the mission to Canada's north costs $6.2 million.
If we raise at least $1M here on IndieGoGo, we can cover the travel and operating costs needed to complete the African mission.
100% of the funds raised on this campaign will be used to cover these costs.
Solar Ship's Micro-Sponsorship Program
You'll see in our perks section that we've created space on the ship for your logos, messages and ideas. 
Solar Ship has created a micro-sponsorship program to fund the launch of this breakthrough technology into the most threatened places on earth. 
You can sponsor the mission and the technology by purchasing "patches" of logo space on the solarship which will also be reproduced digitally on our website. Sponsors can be anyone - individuals, organizations, or corporations.

When you buy a patch, you have an opportunity to advertise your business, cause, or brand. You can buy as many patches as you like, as long as they are available. The more patches you purchase, the more prominent your image will be, both on the web and the aircraft itself.
We would like to use this platform to lower the costs of delivering this technology to the poorest places with the highest transport costs. 
In the event of overfunding, we will extend our African mission and deliver more critical supplies to more places. 
What is a Patch?
A patch, or a group of patches, represents one sponsor’s logo space. These patches will form a banner that will be permanently fixed on the leading edge of the solarship. The banner will be reproduced on our website and kept online for at least 5 years. 
There are 8,000 patches available.  
How It Works 
After the campaign is complete, you will be asked to send us a hi-res image as well as an associated web link of your choice. Your image can be a corporate logo, a text-based message or a photo, the choice is yours. 
Expected Schedule
Website Launch - March, 2013
Northern Canada Mission - Summer 2014
African Mission - Fall 2014
How Much do the Patches Cost?
The FAMILY PATCH costs $125. It is roughly 1/4 the size of the green patches below. Looks small here, but will be highly visible on the solarship.
One GREEN patch costs $500.
One RED patch (the size of 4 Green patches) costs $2,000.
One BLUE patch (the size of 6 Green patches) costs $3,000.
One YELLOW patch (the size of 25 Green patches) costs $10,000.
On the website, the patches will be clearly visible with a zoom feature and a link to a URL provided by you.

This image is not to scale. It is intended to give you a general idea of how large the patches are relative to one another.
Additional Perks:
For $25,000
NIAGARA CALLS
You are invited to join us at Solar Ship's demonstration flight near Toronto. We'll pay for your ticket to Toronto* and we'll pick you up at the airport.
For $50,000
THE MOTHER BEAR
You can join us on our Northern Ontario Adventure. We'll pay for your ticket to Thunder Bay* and we'll pick you up at the airport.
For $1,000,000
FREEDOM OF MOVEMENT
You can create a new mission and message built and organized in your honour.
Other Ways You Can Participate: 
If you cannot afford a patch but would like your image represented on the solarship, why not get your group of friends together to pool funds and agree on one image to send us?
If you aren't able to donate, you can help us tremendously by sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and followers. 
Learn More
Visit our Website
Read our Blog
Follow us on Twitter
Like us on Facebook
Watch our YouTube Channel
Keep an eye on the Gallery for media updates soon. 
Everyone here at Solar Ship thanks you for your support!
*Disclaimer: Flight route is subject to change. Please see our Terms and Conditions page in the Gallery section above.

story:
Shalia’s desire is to touch and speak to youth with an understanding that in the society we are living in today not many voices are being heard. Through GP Speaks, Shalia will give every youth an opportunity to be heard through their craft. The scholarship is only a starting point for GP Speaks. Soon GP Speaks will be widely recognized and reaching youth all over to stand up, speak out, and defy the odds. What odds? The odds that are placed against them everyday because of their race, gender, SES, education, etc... Yes those odds! She did it & believes they can too! Please help GP Speaks help our youth defy the odds! GP Speaks is looking for ideas, investors, anything that will help accomplish its goal by helping the youth defy the odds

GP Speaks is looking to raise $2000; $1500 will go to 3 lucky students in the form of scholarships; and the remaining $500 will go toward the presentation ceremony of those scholarship winners. All donations received will go toward the scholarship fund!

If you help GP Speaks you will change the lives of many youth! Shalia has spoken at many youth events, as well as a college and career summit at North East High School. Since then she has received countless emails and phone calls of how she has touched the lives of many students and even adults. Shalia recognizes that her job is to serve the youth no matter the cost!

GP Speaks is in pursuit of becoming a non-profit organization reaching out to all youth worldwide as a safe haven; helping them to defy the odds through creative expression and empowerment.

Our mission is to help the youth to develop a creative mind of their own by using resources to preserve our future leaders; helping them to liberate their originality instead of conforming to today's society

As you can see the purpose of GP Speaks is to better the lives of youth. In any and every way possible GP Speaks will reach out and help the youth to defy the odds. Are you willing to help us meet this goal? Together we can change the lives of our future leaders. Please donate to help us help them, or simply share our information with others so that we can collectively build a powerful force behind our youth that will help them excel in every aspect of life !! More information can be found on our developing website WWW.GPSPEAKS.COM
